Agustina es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Agustina pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Obstetricia, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Ajo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Agustina trabaja como Obstetra en una posta médica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, Agustina se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que siempre  le ha gustado ayudar a los demás.
Agustina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, ya que desea construir paredes para poder cercarla e ir avanzando poco a poco, así pues Agustina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindar una buena calidad de vida para su pequeña, ya que ella sufre una penosa enfermedad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and her small 5-year-old daughter, whom she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman, who with her husband dedicates all of her efforts to keeping her family going. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Agustina was able to study for a professional degree in obstetrics. In her free moments she likes to distract herself by watching television and in a few occasions she cooks a very delicious garlic chicken to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, Agustina works with much determination and dedication as an obstetrician in a medical post in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours. Agustina feels comfortable in her job since she has always liked to help others.

Agustina is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to start the construction of her home. She wants to construct walls to be able to enclose her home and advance little by little. Thus, Agustina will continue working and exerting herself to be able to achieve her greatest dream of being able to provide a good quality of life for her little one, since she suffers from a terrible illness.

loans.use: to start the construction of her home.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que lamentablemente Nancy es viuda; en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar pequeños trabajos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nancy trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Nancy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá pagar la cuota inicial para adquirir un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera adicionalmente Nancy podrá poner en marcha un negocio y con dicho ingresos desea poder lograr su gran sueño de  brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old and lives in the city of Pisco.  She lives with her two young children whom she loves and who are her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into helping the family prosper.  Sadly Nancy is a widow.  In her spare time she likes to do little bits of work and on some occasions she will cook a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (a traditional stew and soup from the south of Peru) to share with her family.

Using her own initiative, and with determination and dedication, Nancy is a field worker at a farm in her city.  She works from very early in the morning for around eight hours.  She likes doing her work and thinks it is going well because of her good work and for the kind way she treats others.

Nancy is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to put down a deposit for a small stall and the city's central market.  With this Nancy will be able to start up a business and, with the income, she wants to achieve her great dream of providing her children with a better up-bringing.

loans.use: to put money down on a market stall.

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es:
Cayo es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa e hijos, a quienes y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Cayo inició sus estudios para convertirse en Profesor, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad trabajar, Cayo no pudo culminar sus estudios, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta leer un poco y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cuy Chactado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cayo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Cayo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, como abarrotes, bebidas y útiles escolares, de esta manera Cayo tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Cayo is a 45-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and children. His family is his motivation in life. He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, and both he and his wife work very hard to provide a good life for their family. Cayo started studying to become a teacher, but due to lack of financial support and needing to work, Cayo could not finish his studies, although he would still like to. In his free time, he likes to read a little and sometimes cooks a delicious Cuy Chactado (fried guinea pig) for his family.

Cayo works hard running his convenience store -  a business that he started alone. He works every day from early in the morning and works for around 12 hours. He enjoys his job and his business is doing well because he offers good prices and treats his customers well. 
Cayo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy items such as dry goods, drinks, and school supplies so that his store is better-stocked and he can sell to more customers. He will carry on working and doing his best to achieve his dream of seeing his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Johana Esmix

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Johana ha podido estudiar una pequeña carrera de repostería, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hacer dos años, Johana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes.
Johana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de palos, plásticos, maya metálica, comedero y otros, de esta manera Johana podrá construir un pequeño corral para sus cuyes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado  y así desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Young Johana is 20 years old.  She is single and lives in the city of Imperial with her parents and siblings.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, with a great desire to move ahead.  Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Johana was able to study confectionery.  In her spare time she likes to prepare delicious desserts to share with her family.

With her own initiative and a lot of determination and dedication, Johana has now been working as a field labourer for two years at a farm in her city.  She works every day from early in the morning for around eight hours.  In addition she has a small business raising and selling guinea pigs. 

Johana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy straw, plastic, wire-mesh, a feeding-trough and other items  to build a small enclosure for her guinea pigs.  So, she will continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her grand dream of studying to become a secretary and so prosper.

loans.use: to build an enclosure for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan est une femme mariée de 33 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Après quelques années d’étude à l’école coranique, elle décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus  notamment à la vente de la pâte  d’arachide  apprise  auprès de sa mère. Avec une expérience de plus 12 ans, elle maîtrise cette activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, elle décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à sa première experience.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter 12 sacs d’arachide qui seront transformés en pâte d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environnants.  La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile. Sa clientèle est mixte. 
Madame Assitan est très appréciée et sollicitée dans le marché cela est dù à la qualité de ses pâtes d’arachide. La rotation de son activité est très élévée ce qui lui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA.
C’est avec ce bénéfice elle ensisage assurer certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She lives with  her children at her husband's place in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. After several years of Koranic schooling, she decided to interest herself in revenue-generating work, especially in the buying and selling of peanut butter which she learned from her mother. With over twelve years of experience, she has a mastery of this business. 

Having been introduced to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through an agent of the institution, she decided to join its loan program and is now on her first loan. 

To obtain substantial working capital, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to purchase 12 sacks of peanuts that will be processed into peanut butter. She gets her supplies in and around Bougouni. Sales are made to a mix of customers at the big market of Bougouni and at home. 

Ms. Assitan is highly appreciated and much in demand in the market due to the quality of her peanut butter. Her sales rate is very high, and this enables her to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions ensuring that certain family expenses are covered and improving her enterprise further.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nafama  est constitué de six femmes mariées et trois célibataires. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  charbon de bois à travers  KOROTOUMOU, qui est la troisième femme assise de la droite vers la gauche.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 sacs de75 kilos  avec les paysans  des villages environnants de  Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Nafama group is made up of 6 married women and 3 single women. They have an average age of 30 and, on average, 2 children and live in extended, traditional families in the district of Hérémakono Centre, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses and are on their 1st loan. The women in this group sell charcoal via Korotoumou, who is the woman sitting 3rd from the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 75-kilo bags from the farmers of the villages neighbouring Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, María no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser una gran Cosmetóloga, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Picante de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella prepara deliciosos platos típicos de su ciudad y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, como arroz por saco, menestras, ollas, platos descartables y otros, de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante y así desea poder salir adelante al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her two children, whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman who dedicates all of her efforts to keeping her family going since she is mother and father to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity to work to pay her expenses, Maria was not able to study for a professional degree. However, it would have very much pleased her to be a great cosmetologist. In her free moments she likes to distract herself by watching movies, and sometimes she cooks a very tasty spicy beef to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, Maria works with much determination and dedication in her small business selling food. She works every day from the early hours of the morning and she can do so for approximately 8 hours. She prepares delicious dishes typical of her city, and she believes that her business is doing well because of her good seasoning and the friendly treatment she provides to her customers.

María is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to purchase supplies like rice by the sacksful, beans, pots, disposable plates, and others. Thus, María will have her business set up better, so then she will continue working and striving to achiever her greatest dream of having a great restaurant and so wishes to be able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine age 34, is a mother of four children. They all attend school. She sells items in her boutique, which she has been running for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more items, such as sugar, salt, and soap. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame Assetou est une femme mariée de 39 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle décida d’apprendre les activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle a commencé à suivre sa soeur pour apprendre les activités de la préparation et la vente des jus et glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années, la maitrise bien et est très sollicitée dans le quartier pour la qualité de ses jus. Madame Assetou a connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une voisine du quartier. Vu l’évolution de son activité elle décide de venir à Soro Yiriwaso pour prendre un prêt individuel afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement. Avec ce premier prêt elle compte acheter, 2 sacs du sucre, 1 carton sucre-vanille, 25 kilos de gingembre et 1 sac de 50 kilos de dah. Elle s’aprovisionne en matières premières dans le marché de Bougouni et à Sikasso qui est la 3ème region administrative du Mali. Ses jus sont vendus par ses employers à la maison, au marché,  devant les écoles et dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Assetou is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. Having dropped out of primary school in the 5th year (Malian education system), she decided to learn about revenue-generating work. And so she started watching her sister to learn about making and selling juices and ice. She has been operating this business for several years, has mastered it, and is much in demand in the district for the quality of her juices. 

Ms. Assetou knew about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through a neighbor in her district. Given the evolution of her business, she decided to come to Soro Yiriwaso to take out an individual loan for increasing her working capital. 

With this initial loan, she intends to purchase 2 bags of sugar, a box of vanilla sugar, 25 kg of ginger, and a 50-kg sack of 'dah' (dried hibiscus flowers). She gets her supplies of ingredient at the markets of Bougouni and Sikasso, which is the third administrative region of Mali. Her juices are sold by her employees at the house, at the market, and in front of schools in the different district of Bougouni. 

With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making juices

loans.name: Zile Ywan Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  est la représentante du groupe ZILE YWAN. Mme se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans le moins âgé a 18ans. 03 de ses enfants vont à l’école et elle a 09 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des ignames. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 36ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Léo au BURKINA. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  04 calebasses d’ignames.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage d’ignames.
texts.en:
Aminata is the representative of the ZILE YWAN group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  Her oldest child is 40 years old, her youngest is 18.  Three of her children are students.  She has nine people in her care.

Aminata has been selling calabashes of yam for the past 36 years.  She stocks up in Léo, Burkina Faso, and sells to men and women.

She currently wants to buy four calabashes of yam.

She saves her profits and takes care of her children's tuition fees.  Her ambition is to open a large shop for yam storage.

loans.use: to buy four calabashes of yam.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Melba has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from fish-vending. Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora tiene su negocio  ubicado en uno de los mercados de chinandega desde hace 17 años en su negocio vende productos de plastico como barriles, pichingas, sacos etc. con su negocio ha sacado adelante a sus hijos ahora son unos profesionales, comenzo con capial propio.

vende de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, se esfuerza por tener su negocio lleno de producto para ofrecerles a sus clientes, con sus ingresos de sus ventas ha mejorado su calidad de vida,  antes solo vendia sacos vacios y usados. se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos que le hemos brindado ya que  su negocio se oxigena de este credito cada dos meses.
texts.en:
Maria has had her business, which is located in one of Chinandega's markets, for some 17 years. In her store she sells plastic products like barrels, jars and vessels, sacks, etc. Thanks to this business, Maria has advanced her children, and now, they are professionals. Maria began with her own capital.

Maria sells every day, Mondays through Sundays, from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm. She strives to have a business filled with products to offer her customers. With her income from sales, she has improved her quality of life. Previously, Maria sold only empty used sacks. She feels very grateful for the financing that we have offered, since her business is kept alive by these loans every two months.

loans.use: to buy both small and large sacks and blue barrels to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 47 years old. She is married and has three children, one who is in school. 

Joyce is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Joyce requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joyce has been pig-fattening for 16 years now and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Joyce would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen, a 30-year-old married mother of one, describes herself as a polite woman. For four years now, she has been operating a retail store that sells shoes. Her enterprise is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low bargaining power of her customers.

Moreen will use this Kes 20,000 loan, her first from SMEP DTM, to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to completely restock her store within five years.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have four children and only the two oldest go to school. 

Florence sells sorghum and has been running the business for two years. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr:
Madame Assanatou est une femme mariée de 37 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
Madame Assanatou est une enseignante de profession qui, dans le souci de diversifier ses sources de revenus, méne des activités génératrices de revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins tout en aidant son époux. Elle a 2 congélateurs qu’elle exploite à plein temps pour la vente des jus et de la glace. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de tente. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 8 ans. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 3ème prêt.  Elle n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Tous ses prêts sont bien remboursés. 
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, ½ sac du sucre, 1 carton sucre-vanille, 15 kilos de gingembre  et 1 sac de 30 kilo de dah. Elle s’aprovisionne en matières premières dans le marché de Bougouni. Ses jus sont vendus par ses employers à la maison,   devant les écoles et dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni en ambulant.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA.  Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Assanatou is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. Ms. Assanatou is a teacher by profession who, concerned about diversifying her sources of income, run revenue-generating businesses to support herself while helping out her husband. She has two freezers she  uses full-time to sell juices and ice. She learned this business from her aunt and has been running this business for over eight years. 

To satisfy her burgeoning and demanding customer base, she decided to join the loan program at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her third loan. She never had any problems repaying. All of her loans are indeed paid back.

She intends to use this new loan to purchase a ½ bag of sugar, a box of vanilla sugar, 15 kg  of ginger, and a 30-kg sack of 'dah' (dried hibiscus flowers). She gets her supplies of ingredient at the market of Bougouni. Her juices are sold by her employees at the house, in front of schools, and in the different districts of Bougouni by going door to door. 

With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for selling juices

loans.name: Isabel Soledad

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo de 9 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Isabel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Isabel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de flores, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en las afuera de un cementerio de su ciudad, Isabel trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Isabel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de flores para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera ella podrá atender a mas clientes y brindar un mejor servicios, así pues Isabel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder tener una gran florería.
texts.en:
Isabel is 40 years old and lives in Chincha with her nine year old son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who dedicates all of her efforts to getting her son ahead, especially since she is both mother and father to him.  Unfortunately, Isabel was not able to study for a career as a nurse like she wanted, due to a lack of resources and she had to go to work.  She likes to watch soap operas in her spare time and sometimes cook a delicious  Carapulcra with dry soup to share with her family.

With great dedication, and thanks to her parents’ encouragement, Isabel works her small flower business.  She has a small stall outside a cemetery in her town.  Isabel works about 10 hours every day, beginning in the morning and she believes that things are going well for her because of the good prices and good service she provides for her customers.

Isabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she was able to buy flowers in quantity to supply her business.  In this way she was able to tend to her customers and provide better service.  Isabel will continue working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream of having a great flower shop.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir, a 34-year-old married woman, has been printing books from her house since 1999 and supplements her income by working as a tutor. Because her house is her working place, she needs to keep it in good repair to receive her students.

Abir is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to help her husband in fixing their house ceiling and buying oil necessary to stay warm during this winter season. Abir hopes to expand her printing business and open a small office in the future. She will try her best to save as much as she can to make her dream come true.

loans.use: To help her husband fix their house ceiling.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 3 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Dougounina.
Ayant vite abandonné l’école moderne, très tôt il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des téléphones portables et accessoires qu’il apprit auprès de son oncle. Avec une experience de 8 ans, il maîtrise parfaitemenent son activité.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement consistant, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 des téléphones portables, 15 batteries et 18 façades. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue ses ventes au marché de Bouigouni.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise et aider son son père assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye is a 39-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in Bougouni, in the Dougounina district. Having dropped out early from a modern school, he soon started revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of mobile phones and accessories which he learned from his uncle. With eight years of experience, he has mastered his business.

To obtain significant working capital, he decide to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to purchase 20 mobile phones, 15 batteries, and 18 covers. He is now on his first Soro Yiriwaso loan. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and makes his sales at the Bougouni market. 

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. With the profits, he envisions expanding his enterprise and helping out his father to ensure that family expenses are covered.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in his store.

loans.name: Exemple De Bordemer Group

texts.fr:
Jodelin est le coordinateur de son groupe Exemple de Borddemer. Il est un commercant. Il habite dans la région BOR-DE-MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Jodelin a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant 11 années. 

Jodelin voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la acheter de produit divers. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc Jodelin dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Jodelin is the coordinator of her group Exemple de Borddemer. He is a merchant and lives in the BOR-DE-MER region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Jodelin has been running his general store for eleven years. 

Jodelin would like to use this loan to invest in purchasing a variety of goods, such as shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc. He hopes his loan will help him to expand his business. He says his main challenge is becoming a major merchant. He says his main goal and dream is to own a big business through his capital and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to purchase various goods (shoes, clothing, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Virginia Stefany

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia vive en Guayaquil, tiene 22 años de edad. Ella decidió ponerse un negocio de venta de comida rápidas debido a que su esposo la abandono dejándola sola con un niño pequeño. Fue por la cual en la actualidad se esfuerza cada día por seguir adelante con su hijo pequeño.

Ella esta soltera y solo cuenta con la ayuda de Dios.  Con este negocio gana muy poco para la alimentación de su hijo y apara los gastos del hogar por eso requiere del préstamo para poder incrementar más platos para la venta, en lo que víveres.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar carnes, enlatados, vegetales, tarrinas platicas. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negcoio y seguir luchando debido a su hijo que le quiere dar lo mejor en la educación.
texts.en: Virginia, 22, lives in Guayaquil.  She decided to start a fast-food business because her husband abandoned her leaving her alone with a small son.  This is why she strives daily at present to get ahead with her little boy.  She’s single and her only help comes from God.  She earns very little with this business to cover her son’s food costs and her household expenses which is why she needs the loan to buy foodstuffs to increase the number of dishes she sells.  She wants to use the loan to buy meats, canned goods, vegetables and plastic containers.  In future, she’d like to increase her business and continue striving because she wants to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy meats, canned goods, vegetables and plastic containers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Vilma requested a loan of 19500 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell like noodles, sugar, milk, shampoo, and canned goods.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, sugar, milk, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old, and has one wife. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his general store in Malindi; he earns a monthly profit of KES. 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his first loan of KES. 20,000, which he will use to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and food, such as flour, to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to look after his small family for now, while continuing to gradually expand the business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and food, such as flour, for his general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married, with two children who are in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like bread, canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, and other groceries needed for her store.

Teresita has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like bread, canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, and other groceries needed for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride is 32 years old. She sells different items such as soap, rice, and sugar. With the loan, she wants to add more items for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, rice, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Tièssiri est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus
à travers de OUMOU qui  est la  deusième dame assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elle fait l’achat vente de tissus et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 pagnes univax avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is composed of six married women averaging 44 years of age, with five children. They live in traditional expanded family in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. In order to  strengthen their financial capacity and better manage their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their third loan. The prior loans have been duly repaid. This group sells cloth, which is what Oumou does, for example. Oumou is the second one seated from the left. She buys and resells cloth and plans to use her loan to buy 20 sets of traditional “pagnes: cloth  of the Univax brand from the Bamanko wholesaler. She sells at the market and out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to achieve an average monthly profit of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme marié de 28 ans et père de 2 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfantss chez lui même dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Monsieur Yaya est diplomé en dessin Bâtiment. Avant de terminer ses études il a appris auprès de son père la menuiserie bois.  Anisi pour subvenir à ses besoin tout en aidant son père dans les dépenses de la famille, il décide d’ouvrir un atelier de menuiserie et de vente de bois. Avec 9 années d’expérience, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 70 planches de bois et 30 contre-paquets. Il s’approvisionne à Manankoro, à Sikasso et à Bougouni. La vente se fait dans son atelier. Sa clientèle est composée essentielement de menuisiers et de maçons. Il est très solicité par ses clients.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’améliorer son entreprise et à payer le prêt. 
Il ambitionne de se doter prochainement d’une machine de rabotage de bois (car il dépense par mois plus de 100.000FCFA  pour les frais de rabotage).
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya is a 28-year-old married man and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in his own home in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. Mr. Yaya has a degree in building design. Before graduating, he learned woodworking from his father. Thus, to support himself while helping out his father to cover family expenses, he decided to open a carpentry shop and sell lumber. With nine years of experience, he has a mastery of his work.

To obtain substantial working capital, he decide to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to purchase 70 boards and 30 pieces of plywood. He gets his supplies in Manankoro, Sikasso, and Bougouni. Sales are made at his workshop. His customer base is composed essentially of furniture makers and masons. He is much in demand by his customers.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA enabling him to improve his enterprise and to pay off the loan. His ambition is to equip himself soon with a power planer (since he spends over 100,000 francs per month in planing costs).

loans.use: to purchase lumber to sell

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
El señor se dedica a la actividad de taller de motores estacionarios desde hace 28 años, es casado tiene 4 hijos todos en edad escolar por los que trabaja fuertement de lunes a sabado desde las  cinco de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche para brindarle educacion, y mejoras en el hogar.
el señor comenzo su negocio como trabajaor de aviacion en reparaciones de aviones y posteriormente decidio ahorrar para poner su propio negocio, el señor tiene años de trabaja con la institución  y con estos financiamientos ha mejorado su negocio mantiene bastantes respuestos los cuales para el no puede dejar de mantener en su negocio ya que para el satisface a sus clientes ya que si el cliente nesecita algun respuesto el se los ofrece si nesecidad de que sus clientes anden de un lado a otro buscandolos.
texts.en:
Jose Noel has a shop where he has been working on stationary engines for the past 28 years. He is married and has 4 school age children. He works hard for his children from Monday to Saturday from 5:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night so he can give them an education and make improvements to their home.
He started his business as an aviation technician repairing airplanes and decided to save to start his own business. He has been working with the institution for years and with the loans he has been able to keep his customers satisfied and improve his business by maintaining a supply of spare parts so his customers don’t have to run around and search for the parts they need.

loans.use: purchase spare parts such as rings, pistons, cylinders, etc.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis, holding one of her children, is a 38-year-old married woman; she has five children. She describes herself to be a humble woman. 

Philis operates a retail business selling utensils such as cooking pots, plastic plates, spoons, etc . She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located at a viable location, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy utensils to sell. Her goal is to improve this business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy utensils to resell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 27-year-old married woman. She has a child who is three years old. She describes herself as a hard working woman. For three years, Lucy has operated a retail business where she sells shoes. Her business is located in an area with good business potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes insufficient funds for improving her business as her biggest business challenge. 

Lucy will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy shoes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Wade

texts.en:
This loan will help Wade to pay for product distribution on consignment websites to attract more clients and better advertise his company.

Wade first launched American Deadstock, a designer clothing and accessories company that specializes in unworn vintage apparel, seven years ago. However, within the last year, Wade’s business has significantly grown both in sales and clients, and Wade is now looking to take his company to the next level. Wade currently sells his unique items online through third party consignment store websites. This loan will allow Wade to pay more websites and stores to carry his product line, which will allow him to expand his business by gaining more customers and receiving more orders.

Wade hopes to continue to gain visibility for his product and, in the future, would like his company to help create jobs for the community.

loans.use: To pay for marketing on more retail websites in order to reach more clients

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en:
This loan will help Jairo to continue to offer quality treatment for pets.

Jairo, originally from Colombia, has always cared for animals. After working in veterinary hospitals for many years, Jairo saw the need to offer the same quality treatment found at hospitals, but at clients’ homes instead. In 2007, Jairo began his own business, Chien Inc, a home-based company that both sells pet products and provides veterinary care in the comfort of clients’ homes. Over the last six years, Jairo has built a large clientele base and a strong reputation by word of mouth, and he is now looking to expand his business to be able to take on more pet patients. 

Jairo will use this loan to purchase and update medical equipment, to establish a webpage, and to pay for his own marketing and advertising. With this loan, Jairo hopes to gain more clients while being able to continue to offer superior care to his customers and their pets.

loans.use: To purchase and update medical equipment, pay for marketing, and launch a webpage.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou est une femme mariée de 25 ans et mère de 1 enfant qui vit avec son enfant chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Après quelques années d’étude à  l’école moderne sans succès, elle décida de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et la vente des chaussures et des pomades. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa mère. Avec une expérience de 5 ans elle maîtrise son activité. 
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de prêt solidaire du quartier, elle  décide d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 3 douzaines de paires de chaussures de diverses catégories et 2 douzaines de pomades de plusieurs qualités.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako. La vente se fait dans sa boutique située au quartier Massablcoura de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est mixte. Madame Oumou envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA.
C’est avec ce bénéfice qu’elle envisage améliorer d’avantage son entreprise et rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Oumou is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She lives with her child at her husband's place in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. After a few years of modern schooling without success, she decided to interest herself in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of shoes and ointments. She learned this business from her mother. With five years of experience, she has a mastery of her work.

Having been introduced to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through a solidarity loan association in her district, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 dozen pairs of shoes of diverse types and 2 dozen of ointments of several qualities. She gets her supplies in Bougouni and sometimes in Bamako. Sales are made at her store located in the Massablcoura district in Bougouni.  She has a mixed customer base.  

Ms. Oumou envisions making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions improving her enterprise further and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and ointments to sell

loans.name: Ganga Mahila Self Help Group

texts.en:
A few years back, 10 women from a small village of Khurda District, Odisha stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family and formed a group named Ganga Mahila Self Help Group. The members of Ganga Mahila Self Help Group are all women from a district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs.Monalisha, who was selected as their president. The lady standing second from the left hand side, wearing a multi-colored saree in the photo is Monalisha. 

Monalisha is 39 years old and is living with her husband. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. 

Initially she started with growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourds, snake gourds, cucumbers, lady fingers and 'brinjal' (eggplant). She has very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested a loan to utilize it in purchase of land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing land, seeds, fertilizers, etc. for doing vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Zulnozakhon

texts.en:
Zulnozakhon is 19 years old. She is not married and has no children. She is an industrious and intelligent young woman who has always wanted to be a successful business lady. She graduated school with excellent marks, but, because of her parents' small income, she didn’t attend university. She decided to start her own business. 

To this end, she took the "To Get Ahead" course from the local women's organization to learn business skills. She wants to start a business buying and selling fruits, which she will manage alone. She is likely to be a very successful business woman, as she is hardworking and smart. 

Zulnozakhon is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy fruits for her new business, which will be her source of income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more agricultural products to sell.

loans.name: Melanton

texts.en:
Melanton is a 36-year-old father of five children whose ages are between 12 and 3 years old. He and his wife Sofia (aged 31) have been covering their family's living expenses by selling agricultural products such as vegetables, coconuts, yams, corn, onions, beans, etc at the market for more than 11 years. He buys those products from local farmers and resells them at the market in the town center. 

At the moment, Melanton really wants to improve his business, not only selling agricultural produce but also to commence a kiosk business at his house, so he could generate more income. The thoughts then lead him to apply to TLM for a loan of around 10,000,000 IDR. This loan will help him to add more agricultural products and also kiosk stock such as snacks, instant noodles, eggs, shampoo, bath soap, mosquito coils, candies etc. He is hoping that the loan assistance provided by TLM could help him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to add more agricultural produce and also kiosk stock such as snacks, instant noodles, eggs, shampoo, bath soap, mosquito coils, candies, etc.

loans.name: Selvin Roberto

texts.es: Selvin, tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Yoro, Yoro. El tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio de taller de ebanistería donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles, como puertas, ventanas de madera, muebles de cocina, cómodas, respaldos de cama etc. El taller lo tiene en su casa y trabaja en base a pedidos. Anteriormente el trabajo como locutor de una radio local y luego decidió mejor tener su propio taller. El préstamo que solicita es por 22,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar una maquina cepilladora y compra de madera para la elaboración de muebles ya que tiene varios contratos con los clientes y este préstamo le ayudara a cumplir los pedidos. Tiene como plan hacer crecer el negocio, ofrecer variedad de muebles y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Selvin, 35, is married and has a son; he lives in the municipality of Yoro, Yoro.  He’s had his own cabinet making workshop for five years where he manufactures all kinds of furniture like doors, wood window frames, kitchen cabinets, armoires, headboards, etc.  His shop is located at home and he works based on prior orders.  He used to work as a local radio announcer and then decided it would be better to have his own shop.

The loan he’s requesting is for 22,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy a sander and to buy lumber to manufacture furniture since he has several customer contracts and this loan will help him fill them.  His plan is to make the business grow, to offer a variety of furniture and to be able to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy lumber and a sander.

loans.name: Sante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SANTE  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées et 1 célibataire. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, .4 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes   à travers de MANTA, qui est la femme assise avec une garnde assiètte  de banane. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 régimes de bananes de 20 kilos avec les producteurs de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group SANTE comprises four married women and one unmarried woman. They average 32 years of age and four children each, living in traditional extended families in the district of Hérémakono Centre in Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan. 

This group of women does commerce in fruit & vegetables through Ms. MANTA, who is seated in the photo and holding a large dish of bananas. She intends to use her loan to purchase 25 bunches of bananas at 20 kg from Bougouni producers. 

Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed essentially of women, she makes her sales at the market and at home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA that will be invested in business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Lona Awatex

texts.en:
Lona is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has four children between the ages of three and 11, all of whom go to school.

Lona runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. 

Lona heard about Finance Sudan through other clients, and she is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase tomatoes, onions, and other produce. In addition to this business, Lona has no other source of income.

In five years, Lona would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Lona says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like onions and tomataoes for sale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 31 years old. She owns a bar and has been in business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more beers for sale, specifically Primus and Mutzig beers. With the profits from the business, Valentine plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more Primus and Mutzig beers for sale.

loans.name: Togmid

texts.en:
Mr.Togmid is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Tosontsengel Soum, Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Togtohmend, age 43, runs a small cafeteria and works as the chef there. His son Ganbayar, age 18, is a university student, Ganbat, age 15, and daughter Ganchimeg, age 10 study at local schools. 

This borrower has been working at a local conservation office as a patrol. His wife has been running the cafeteria for five years and has not renovated the place since. He is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows for his wife's cafeteria in order to reduce the heat loss and give their customers comfortable service. He and his wife are hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials and vacuum windows for his wife's cafeteria

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 46 years old. She sells different items in her boutique, which she has been running for six years. With the loan, she wants to add sugar, soaps and corn flour to sell. The profits expected from the business will be used to reinvest in the same store.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soaps, and corn flour to sell..

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en una colonia de Yoro junto a uno de sus hijos. 
Doña Norma lleva 12 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos AVON, vende cosméticos, lociones, champú, cremas, desinfectantes, etc. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar producto nuevo de una línea nueva de lociones para vender. Su objetivo es surtir el negocio para incrementar los ingresos. Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio grande que sea auto sostenible y que sus hijos lo puedan administrar.
texts.en: Norma, 50, is a single mother; she has three children and lives in a neighborhood in Yoro with one of them.  She’s been selling AVON products for 12 years; she sells cosmetics, lotions, shampoo, creams, disinfectants, etc.  She sells from place to place and also based on prior orders.  She’s requested a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy products from a new line of lotions to sell.  Her objective is to stock the business in order to increase income.  Her goal is to eventually have a business that’s big and self-sufficient that her children can manage.

loans.use: to buy a new line of lotions to sell.

loans.name: Monhsuh

texts.en: Mr. Monhsuh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger on land with others in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Bolortuya helps her husband to run their grocery store. Monhsuh's son Monhhairhan is a freshman at a university. His other son Monhtor and daughter Sodtsetseg go to local schools. His youngest son Sodbileg goes to a local kindergarten. Monhsuh has been running a small retail business since 2004 and has just expanded the business to a bigger rental space. He needs the extra investment of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase organic fruits and vegetables to sell in their grocery store. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to buy organic fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es: Jose, tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece a Taulabe, Comayagua junto a tres de sus hijos. Jose se ha dedicado a la agricultura, principalmente de café junto a su familia. Pero hace 3 años el se dedica a su propia producción. El café lo vende en el mercado local o intermediarios.  Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 13,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café. El espera mejorar su finca para que su familia se supere.
texts.en: José, 47, is married and has four children; he lives in a village belonging to Taulabe, Comayagua with three of his children.  José has worked in agriculture with his family, especially growing coffee.  But three years ago he started his own crops.  He sells the coffee in the local market or to middlemen.  He’s asking for his second ODEF loan for 13,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fertilizer to provide care for his coffee crops.  He hopes to improve his farm so his family can better itself.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Moussa est un homme marié de 37 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son feu père à Bougouni dans le quartier Niébala. Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après mûre réflexion, il décida d’apprendre auprès de son oncle  l’achat et la vente des tasses de tous genres. Après avoir eu un petit fonds de roulement à travers son père avant son décès il décide de méner des activités génératrices comme l’achat et la vente de tasses en aluminuim et tasses thermos. Avec une expériences de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter  30 douzaines de tasses. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et la vente se fait dans sa boutique située au grand marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est  composée surtout de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses familialle.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa is a 37-year-old married man and the father of five children. He lives with his wife and children at his deceased father's house in Bougouni, in the Niébala district. After Koranic school, he remained unemployed for a long time. So, after thorough reflection, he decided to learn from his uncle how to buy and sell basins of all kinds. With a small amount of working capital from his father before he died, Mr. Moussa decided to operate revenue-generating businesses, such as those involving aluminum basins and insulated containers. With over ten years of experience, he has a mastery of his work.

With respect to bolstering his business, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is now on his first loan, which will be use to purchase 30 dozen containers. He gets his supplies in Bamako, and sales are made in his store located at the big market in Bougouni. His customer base is composed of women in particular.

With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will used to pay back the loan and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase basins to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear products to resell

loans.name: Purusikira

texts.en: Purusikira is 50 years old. She sells shoes and clothes and has been in the business for eight years. Her husband works with her in the same business. They have five children between the ages of 8 and 27. All of their children go to school. She has requested this Kiva loan to buy more shoes and clothes to resell. With the profits from the business she will renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, para que de esa forma y por medio del trabajo de todas unidas puedan ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Lucresia es empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes, y también tiene una despensa en su casa, tiene 2 hijos aun pequeños, la despensa lo cuidan sus 2 hijos y su mamá. Ella retiro el crédito  para la compra de insumos variados para su despensa, como ser panificados, bebidas, golosinas, yerba, etc. Lucresia tiene como meta ampliar mas su negocio, teniendo mas clientes y así poder dejar de trabajar en casa de familias, lo cual es muy sacrificado. teniendo
texts.en:
One of this group’s members started the group by inviting and organizing her friends to join the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Enterprising Women] so that, by working together, they could help their families.
Lucresia is a domestic employee and she works Monday through Friday.  She also runs a small store out of her home. Her mother and 2 small children tend to the store. She requested the loan so she can purchase a variety of items for her store such as baked goods, beverages, sweets, yerba, etc. Lucresia wants to expand her business so she can increase her clientele, allowing her to quit her job as a domestic employee, which is a huge sacrifice.

loans.use: purchase baked goods, beverages, sweets, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Kolthoum

texts.en:
Kolthoum, a 46-year-old married mother of three, has been working in agriculture since 1989. Two years ago she started her own business to help her husband increase their family income to ensure their children will have their needs met. A hard worker who grows fruits and vegetables, Kolthoum is very happy with her production and business.

Kolthoum is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to prepare for the planting season with necessary seeds and fertilizers. Her previous loan helped increase her production, and she is sure that this new one will have the same effect. She puts a great deal of effort into expanding and increasing her production as much as possible.

loans.use: to prepare for the planting season with necessary seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is a 56-year-old merchant from Ubay, Bohol. She sells auto fuel enhancer, serving as a supplier to nearby auto shops in her community. Enriqueta needs a loan to buy more fuel enhancer. With this, she will be able to increase her inventory, which will allow her to distribute more to her customers. In the future, Enriqueta hopes to expand her business, save money to reinvest in the business, and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy more fuel enhancer

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 29 years old. She sells clothes. She and her husband work together in the same business. With the loan she has requested, Charlotte wants to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build her home.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 21-year-old married man who has been working as an electrician for seven years. In 2008, Husein started his own business to increase his income and improve his living. Husein was only fourteen years old when he started working to help his parents. He finished his intermediate studies and then entered the workforce.

Husein is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay for his wife's medical treatment at the hospital.This will be Husein's third loan cycle as a Kiva borrower. His previous loans helped him a lot in covering most of his needs and expanding his working zone.

Today Husein is very pleased with what he has, but he is willing to work harder to make sure that his business will cover his family's needs, especially education, which he misses in his own life.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical treatment.

loans.name: Girimpundu Group

texts.fr:
UZZIEL est membre du Groupe GIRIMPUNDU. Il a 41 ans et a 4 enfants le plus age a 17ans et le moins age a 8 ans. tous ses enfants vont à l`école. ses niveaux d`étude est de 6 eme primaire. il sollicite cet Emprunt pour louer le champs à cultiver. il n`attend aucun difficultés pour rembourser cet emprunt.

Ses strategies pour la croissance de l`affaire est d`utiliser les engrains chimiques.
son ambition  est d`avoir son propore champ.
pour sa famille , c`est le bien être et éduquer ses enfants jusqu`à l`université.
texts.en:
UZZIEL is a member of the group GIRIMPUNDU. She is 41 years old and has four children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 8. All of her children go to school. She has a 6th grade education. She is requesting this loan to lease fields to cultivate. She expects no difficulties at all in repaying this loan. 

Her strategy for increasing her business is to modernize her farming by using chemical fertilizers. Her ambition is to have her own field, and for her family members, to ensure their well-being and to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to lease fields to cultivate

loans.name: Byiringiro/rwaza Group

texts.fr:
REGINE est membre du groupe IBYIRINGIRO , elle est marié et a 3 enfants le plus agé a 21 ans et le moins agé a 13 ans. ses 3 enfants vont tous à l`école. elle est agé de 42 ans.

elle sollicite cet emprunt pour louer les champs à cultiver, acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.
elle n`attend aucun difficultes pour rembourser ce crédit.
sa stratégie pour accroitre son activité est de moderniser son agriculture en utilisant les angrais chimiques.
ses ambition est de dévenir l`agriculteur proffessionnelle.
et pour sa famille c`est le bien être.
texts.en:
REGINE is member of the group IBYIRINGIRO. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is 13. All three of the children go to school. She is 42 years old. 

She is requesting this loan to lease fields to cultivate, purchase some chemical fertilizers, and pay for labor. She expects no difficulties at all in repaying this loan. Her strategy for increasing her business is to modernize her farming by using chemical fertilizers. Her ambition is to become a professional farmer, and for her family, to ensure their well-being.

loans.use: to lease field to cultivate

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 65-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown children from CPG, Bohol. She is a mat weaver and has been in this business for more than 30 years now.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy more dye, straw, and romblon, a native plant. This will allow her to weave more mats and sell more to the market.

loans.use: to buy more romblon, dye, and straw for weaving.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, ages two and eight. She describes herself as a polite woman. 

For four years, Rose has operated a general store where she sells shoes and clothes. Her business is located in an area with good business potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her customers' low bargaining power as her biggest business challenge. 

Rose will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Phil is 30 years old, married, and supports two people. He has been running his retail shop for about four years now with an income of about 24,000 KES.

This is Phil's third loan for KADET LTD, and he repaid his previous loans successfully. He wants to use the loan to buy bars of soap, salt, sugar, and cereals for sale. He hopes to be a leading wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to spend the loan on sugar, coffee, tea, biscuits, mineral water, etc,. and also to sell petrol

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in furniture making since seven years ago. In 2012, Hassan opened his own factory and is very happy with this step forward.

He is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary business needs such as staples, nails, cloths, sponge, wood and tools.

This is his first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he hopes that this loan will serve the requested goal.

At the beginning, Hassan was supported by his mother and father who gave him the first financial push to open his working place. He hopes that in the future he can expand his working zone and open a wide showroom.

loans.use: to buy necessary business needs such as staples, nails, cloths, sponge, wood and tools

loans.name: Lentitiyio

texts.en:
Lentitiyio is 38 years old, married to Naipartuni and blessed with five children that he supports. He is a wheat farmer in Narok county and has been in farming for the last four years, earning an income of KES 25,000 monthly.

He is servicing his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD that will facilitate land preparation and purchase of farm inputs to help get better yields.

He intends to use anticipated profits to support the business and to provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare his land.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Glady is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 13. All of them go to school.

Glady runs a fish-selling business, and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.

She is taking a loan of 3, 000 SSP to purchase fish and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Glady would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Glady says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is a merchant from Anda, Bohol. He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business, fishing and running a convenience store.

Feliciano is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles and other dry goods. With this, he will be able to improve his earnings from these ventures. In the future, Feliciano hopes of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles and other dry goods

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has six children ranging from 13 to 27 years old. She describes herself to be a trustworthy woman. She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Feliciano	Jr

texts.en:
Feliciano Jr. is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is 27 years old and has a 4-year-old daughter.

Feliciano has been in the fishing business for more than six years now. Feliciano is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and a boat engine. With this, he will be able to improve his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a boat engine

loans.name: Parsanika

texts.en:
Parsanika, 46, is married. He is a livestock trader at Kitengela market, which is a busy market where most of his clients are. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET LTD. He has been in this business for 13 years and earns a monthly profit of 14,000 KES. This loan of 100,000 KES is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to purchase more livestock for resale.

If the loan boosts his business, he plans to open a butchery. Parsanika dreams of becoming a meat supplier in Kitegela. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 38-year-old, married man. He has four children with ages ranging from seven years to 18 years. He describes himself to be a social man. 

He operates a van where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the repairing of the van. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) after managing to successfully pay a loan of KES 10,000.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the van he uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Tet Fret De Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
