Antoine est le coordinateur de son groupe Tet Fret de Dumas. Il est un commercant. Il habite dans la région de Dumas où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Antoine a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant 10 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Antoine était un Etudiant.

Antoine voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le charbon etc. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme nourriture, cosmetiques, charbon, etc. Antoine dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Antoine is the coordinator of his group Tet Fret de Dumas. He is a merchant and lives in the Dumas region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Antoine has been running his general store for ten years. Before starting this business, he used to be a student.

Antoine would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal, etc. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Some other active members have need of a loan for such business as selling food, cosmetics, charcoal, etc. Antoine says his main goal and dream is to own a big business through his capital and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert Group

texts.fr:
Marline est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Puissance de Philibert. Elle es une commercante. Elle habite dans la région Philibert d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Marline a dirigé son commerce de Produit Divers pendant 3 années.

Marline voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Charbon, Vetement, chaussures, entre autre. Marline dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un grand magasin avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Marline is the coordinator of her group Puissance de Philibert. She is a merchant and lives in the Philibert region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Marline has been running her general store for three years. 

Marline would like to use this loan to invest in various goods. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Some other active members have need of a loan for such business as selling charcoal, clothing, shoes, and more. Marline says that her main challenge is to become a major merchant. She says that her main goal and dream is to own a large store through her capital and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and more

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 10. They are presently in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling fresh frozen fish on a table in the local market. Her major problem is the price of fish is unstable. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh frozen fish for her business. She plans to live a better life and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh frozen fish for her business.

loans.name: Abigial

texts.en:
Abigial is 23 and lives in Montserrado County, near the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia.  She is a college student and she is single.

For the past four years, she has been selling slippers and dishes in the local market, starting this business with money from her susu (local saving account) and later from BRAC Liberia.  She learned this way of selling from her friends.  She likes her business because it gives her more profit.

She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers and dishes (bowls, cups, spoons, plates, etc.) for her business.  She wants to get more money to build her house and graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and dishes (bowls, cups, spoons, plates, etc.) for her business

loans.name: Leh We Member-I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Leh We Member-I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 SLL for each member in the group.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their profits and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Mary.  Mary is 45 years old. She was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone but she currently resides in Waterloo with her husband and two children. For many years now, Mary has been selling firewood. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Better Group

texts.en:
The “Better” group consists of small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan for 4,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the group, which they will use to expand their respective businesses, make more profits, and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abibatu. Abibatu is 40 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. She was born in Yonni Bana village, in northern Sierra Leone but now resides in Waterloo.  Abibatu has been a businesswoman for many years selling rice, beans, peppers, etc.  With her portion of the loan, she will buy rice, beans, peppers, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is a hardworking and industrious woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and Malohat also wants to be a businesswoman. With this aim she took a course entitled ‘To get Ahead’ offered by a women’s organization. She received a lot of information and learned to write a business plan. 

She organized her business, selling vegetables in the local market, one month ago. She wants to develop this business but she does not have the money necessary to buy items for widening the assortment of goods she sells. She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables to increase business. With the future profit she plans to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to develop her new business.

loans.name: La Segesse De Borddemer Group

texts.fr:
Meniau est le coordinateur de son groupe SEGESSE DE BORDDEMER. Il habite dans la région de SEGESSE DE BORDDEMER, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de Moto pendant 10 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il était un professeur.

Meniau voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans pièces de moto et de pièces de rechange. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces. Meniau dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçant. Meniau dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu.
texts.en:
Meniau is the coordinator of the group SEGESSE DE BORDDEMER. He lives in the SEGESSE region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has been running his motorbike business for ten years. Before starting this business, he was a teacher.

Meniau would like to use this loan to invest in spare parts and replacement parts for motorbikes. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Some other active members have need of a loan for such businesses. Meniau says that his main challenge is to become a major merchant. Meniau says that his main goal and dream is to own a big business through his own capital and with God's mercy.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorbikes to sell

loans.name: Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi Iii .a Group

texts.fr:
ETIENNE est membre du groupe DUTEZIMBERE UBUHINZI III .A , IL est âgé de 45 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé a 6 ans. 3 enfants vont à l`école.il a étudié jus`qu au 6 eme primaire. il sollicite cet empruny pour acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.

il n`attend aucun difficulté pour le remboursement de cet emprunt. la stratégie por la croissance de son affaire est de demander d`autre emprunt pour financer son business. ses ambition est d`être l`agriculteur proffessionnel des maïs et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne is a member of DUTEZIMBERE UBUHINZI III .A Group. He has four children: the eldest is 23 years old, and the youngest is 6. Three of his children attend school.

Etienne has a 6th grade education. He's seeking this loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor. He does not expect any difficulty in repaying the loan.

His strategy to grow his business is to seek loans to fund it. He ambitions to become a professional corn farmer and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of eight females who are involved in the sales of cooking utensils, slippers and sandals, fish, underwear and children's clothes, ice chests, ceramic bowls and plates, and plastic products. They have been together for two years and meet on Wednesdays, in the southern part of Teshie, to discuss businesses and repayment of loans.

Setina is a 32-year-old, plastic products seller. She sells plastic chairs, plastic buckets, plastic bowls, and other plastic products. She is married to a 35-year-old painter and they have two boys. She has been selling these products to 12 years.  She plans to reinvest her profits and also save towards payment of children's school fees, with the help of the husband.

Setina, together with her trade mates, need GHS 3,250 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more plastic chairs, bowls, and buckets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 50 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Старшему сыну 27 лет, младшему 13 лет. Старший сын активно помогает матери по хозяйству. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Роза занимается животноводством. Начатое в 1995 году с 30,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Розы имеется 150 голов овец и 4 голов лошадей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота а в будущем планирует построить большой дом.
texts.en: Roza is 50 years old, she is a widow and has 4 children.  Her oldest son is 27 years old and her youngest is 13.  The oldest son actively helps his mother with her farm.  As a source of income for her family Roza raises livestock.  The business started in 1995 with 30,000 som (KGS) today brings around 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  At the moment, Roza's holdings include 150 sheep and 4 horses.  In order to further grow her business, Roza turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 3 bulls to fatten and resell.  Roza plans to invest her profits into further increasing her livestock count and in the future plans to build a big house.

loans.use: to purchase three bulls for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Kirmusoi

texts.en:
Kirmusoi is 34 years old and blessed with three children aged 10, five and two respectively. He is a livestock trader in the Lemek area and has been running this business for the past four years. He earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

He has taken out a third loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to expand his business. 

His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a rice farmer from Ubay, Bohol. 

Gina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her rice crops and eventually her harvest. In the future, Gina hopes to make her rice farming business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Raya

texts.ru: Рая 57 лет, вдова. Дети Райкан уже взрослые и самостоятельные. С 1991 года, После развала СССР в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Рая начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 дойные коровы, 26 голов овец, 3 лошади и приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рая обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 голов телят. В будущем, Рая хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес и мечтает купить сыну автомобиль для того что бы выезжать в город.
texts.en: Raya is 57 years old, she is a widow.  Raya's children are already grown and independent.  Since 1991, after the fall of the USSR, searching for a source of income for her family, Raya started her livestock business.  Thanks to her tenacity and perseverance  today her holdings include 4 dairy cows, 26 sheep, 3 horses and bring in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products and livestock sales.  In order to further grow her business, Raya turned to Bai-Tushum and partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 3 calfs.  In the future, Raya would like to increase her holdings and grow her business, she dreams of buying her son a car so he can drive to the city.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calfs

loans.name: Bakhtiyorh

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель Яванского района. Ему 24 года. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Бахтиёр занимается предоставлением услуг такси. Сейчас он хотел бы начать новый бизнес. Бахтиёр заинтересован животноводческой деятельностью, так как сегодня это прибыльное дело. Чтобы ресализовать свою цель он обратился за кредитом. Бахтиёр просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Bakhtiyorh is a resident of the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  He's 24 years old, married, and has two children.  He works offering taxi services, but now would like to start a new business.  Bakhtiyorh is interested in livestock since it's a profitable business.  In order to achieve his goal, he's taking out a loan in order to start buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: To purchase and sell cattle.

loans.name: Belle Dame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Belle Dame, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits, de condiments, et de céréales.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente AÏCHA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter des tissus percales avec les revendeurs de Nangola, qu’elle tricote pour en faire des draps et des califourchon, destinés à  la vente sur place dans le village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habits.
texts.en:
The group Belle Dame is composed exclusively of married women who average 30 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Tomba, in Commune de Wacoro, Prefecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing, condiments, and grains. The women of the group are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, AÏCHA, the second person from the right in the photo, intends to purchase some percale fabrics from the retailers of Nangola. She knits them to make bed sheets and 'califourchons' for sale locally in the village.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 5,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Les Rayons De Borddemere Group

texts.fr:
Bertheleine est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Les Rayons de Borddemere. Elle es une commercante. Elle habite dans la région Bord-de-Mere d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Bertheleine a dirigé son commerce de Produit Divers pendant 11 années. 

Avant de commencer ce commerce Bertheleine était un couturiere. elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business de Produit Alimentaire. 

Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Charbon, Vetement, chaussures, entre autre. Bertheleine dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bertheleine is the coordinator of her group, Les Rayons de Borddemere.  She is a businesswoman.  She lives in the Bord-de-Mere region of Haïti where electricity is rare and water is very limited.  Bertheleine has managed her business of selling various products for 11 years. 

Before starting this business, Bertheleine was a seamstress.  She would like to use this loan to invest in her various products.  She hopes that this loan will help her to build up her business of selling grocery products.  

Other members of the group need loans for businesses such as selling charcoal, clothing, shoes, and other products.  Bertheleine says that the main challenge was becoming a business woman.  She says that her goal and her dream is to own a big business with her own money, by the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy various products (cosmetics, etc.).

loans.name: Janyl

texts.ru: Жаныл получила хороший результат от первого проекта который он а осуществила с помощью КИВА. На сегодняшний день Жаныл имеет ежемесячный доход в размере 15,000 KGS. В хозяйстве сегодня имеется 2 лошади, 15 овец и 3 коровы. Жаныл обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец.
texts.en: Janyl had a positive experience with good results from the first project she undertook with the help of Kiva.  Today, she brings in around 15,000 KGS monthly, and, thanks to her work, now owns 2 horses, 15 sheep and 3 cows. Janul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 to buy calves and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 30 years old, single and has three children who attend school.  She lives in Montserrado County, the capital of Liberia. For the past 10 years, she has been selling rice, peppers, bitter ball, charcoal, etc. in the community market.  Bendu spends eight hours a day on her business and uses taxis to get her goods to her market table. She started her business with the help of her mother. 

Bendu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more rice, peppers, bitter ball, charcoal, etc. for her business. She hopes to earn more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peppers, bitter ball, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is taking a subsequent loan after a successful repayment of the previous loan. From the increased income from the first loan, she was able to improve her family's living standards. 

She has now approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan request amounting to KES 50,000 to pay school fees for her children. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Biira's Group

texts.en:
Biira's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Biira is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Biira has been working hard to manage her business, which deals in firewood. 

To help expand her business, Biira has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to start another business, and also buy more firewood to sell. It will help Biira to generate greater profits and lead to increased returns so she can start another business. Biira hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Biira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to start another business, and also buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 44-year-old married woman from CPG, Bohol. She has been involved in the fishing business together with her husband for more than twenty years. This is their source of income.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, rope and screen, and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to increase his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Gina hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, rope and screen, and buckets

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité de 8 de Diciembre se encuentra en el 1º ciclo es de la ciudad de Santaní y está integrada por 11 señoras. Todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su esfuerzo.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, cuentan que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que tienen que estar pendiente de sus animales todo el día, y que es un trabajo de tiempo completo. La Sra. Amalia se dedica a la venta de animales faenados a los comercios y a los locales de venta de comida.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de alimento para sus animales, para que de esa forma pueda seguir teniéndolos bien y que crezcan bien.
texts.en:
The group 8 de Diciembre [December 8th] is in its first loan cycle. They are from the city of Santaní and the group is made up of 11 women. They are all hard working women that are striving to get ahead and help their families.
All of the women raise and sell animals for a living. They say that it requires a lot of sacrifice and that it is a full time job because they have to keep an eye on their animals all day. Amalia sells animals that have already been slaughtered to businesses and food establishments. 
She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her animals so that she can continue raising healthy animals.

loans.use: purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Hermina

texts.en:
Hermina is 52 year-old housewife. She is married to Yohanis, 63 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children in a simple house. Hermina and her husband are still working hard to finance three children who are still at school. A kiosk business has been operated by Hermina since 2008 to help her with extra income. The income from the business enables her to pay for the children’s school expenses, while her husband’s income is used to finance their everyday needs.

Last year, Hermina’s kiosk was running out of stock, as she had spent her business capital for her daughter’s wedding. After that, she only focused on producing fried corn and sells it at her kiosk.  She also distributes it to another kiosk near her house. She was able to continue the business because she got many orders from her customers. Recently, Hermina planned to renew her kiosk inventories, such as nine daily basic needs, snacks, coffee, sugar, tea, detergent, soap, etc.  She is applying for a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 4,500,000 to be spent on those things. She is hoping that her business will bring a good impact for her family.

loans.use: to renew her kiosk inventories, such as nine daily basic needs, snacks, coffee, sugar, tea, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en: Shee is requesting a loan amounting to ksh.20000 to buy a tap for water.  This is after a successful repayment of the previous loan.  Its was helpful to her business as it boosted its income.  This is why she wants to install water pipes to her house and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a tap for water

loans.name: Abashizehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Cyriaque fait partie du groupe  Abashizehamwe et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 49 ans et est marié à Consolate, une commerçante.  Ensemble ils ont 3  enfants  âgés de  13 à 18 ans,  tous  étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sucre, …) et de boisson  de banane  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son  quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, en plus de  l’argent qu’il va tirer de la vente du riz,  va lui permettre d’acheter  une parcelle. Il  gardera un capital pour continuer son commerce. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison en briques cuites.
texts.en:
Cyriaque is part of the group Abashizehamwe and lives in Cibitoke. He is 49 years old and married to Consolate, a merchant. Together they have three children, aged 13 to 18 years old, all students. 

Cyriaque has been in business selling store goods (beans, rice, sugar…) and banana drinks for five years. 

He is on his fourth loan at Turame. The KIVA loan he is obtaining, in addition to the money he will derive from selling rice, is going to enable him to purchase a plot of land. He will keep some capital to continue his business. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land and build a house made of fired bricks.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, beverages, etc for his grocery store

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Mr.Narangerel is 22 years old and lives and with his parents and brother in small house in Tosontsengel Soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. His parents work as interior design workers, and  the borrower has learned from his parents. His brother runs a small firewood retail business in the local market.  Mr. Narangerel has been helping his brother, and helps his parents half of the time with their business. He is planning to start his own business of firewood retail and is now requesting 1,000,000MNt to purchase firewood and sell to capital city customers at a  higher price. He is a hardworking, diligent and well-behaved man.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and sell to capital city customers at a higher price

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 41 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Montserrado County the capital of Liberia. For the past 20 years, she has been selling dried fish in the local market.  Martha started this business with money from her husband and learned this way of selling from mother.,

Martha is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more dried fish for her business.  She enjoy her business because of the profit she makes every day. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children with between the ages of two and five years. He describes himself as a patient, obedient and social man. 

Gabriel operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a business area with potential, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the poor road network, especially during rainy season as the roads are impassable. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan in addition to savings to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Etelvina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora es comerciante desde hace 20 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en los alrededores del mercado ella es soltera y madre  de seis hijos los cuales toda la vida trabajo para sacarlos adelante ya que ella ha sido madre y padre para ellos.
la señora empezo su negocio con capital propio, ella antes de ser comerciante se dedicaba hacer domestica tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel y ella ha incrementado su negocio ahora se lleva al negocio una maquina de coser para hacer remiendos, ella siempre ha sido una señora que se esfuerza por buscar el ingreso para llevar el sustento de la casa.  su calidad de vida ha venido mejorando poco a poco ya que no deja de tener sus ingresos para realizar lo necesario en la casa.
texts.en:
Etelvina del Socorro has been a merchant for 20 years. Her business is located on the outskirts of the market. She is a single mother of six and has worked all her life to get them ahead. She has been both mother and father to them.
She started her business with her own capital. Before becoming a merchant, she did domestic work. She has worked with Ceprodel for four years and has been able to expand her business; she now has a sewing machine for making repairs. She has always been a woman who works hard to make an income to support her household. Her quality of life has improved bit by bit as she never lacks the income she needs to cover her household costs.

loans.use: to buy costume jewellery, Avon products, and used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labor

loans.name: Allarakha Mahila Self Help Group

texts.en:
The responsible Allarakha Mahila Self Help Group is made up of ten members. The members of the Allarakha Mahila Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Ms. Ajija, who was selected as their president. The lady sitting second from the right hand side in the front is Ajija. 

Ajija is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is engaged in the activity of selling goats and cow’s milk in the village and nearby market. She purchases goat kids and sells them to the butcher once they are grown up. 

Ajija has requested a loan for purchasing more goat kids and a cow for selling a greater amount of milk to earn a profit. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase goat kids and a cow for her cattle farm.

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, Aminata is 35 years of age, married, and the mother of three children, one in primary and two in secondary school.

For many years now, Aminata has been selling market food such as beans, ogiri (a flavoring made from fermented seeds), etc. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, however, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan to expand her business by purchasing more beans, ogiri, etc.

loans.use: to buy beans, ogiri, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jose Rodrigo

texts.es:
JOSE RODRIGO tiene 36 años de edad es soltero tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

José Rodrigo se dedica a la siembras de maíz, habas, fréjol, arveja. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguisidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en insumos para el mejoramiento y crecimiento de las siembras.
Las compras de los productos agrícolas los realiza en Chimbo. El sueño es mejorar los cultivos para así mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es adquirir más terrenos esperando que la siembra mejore. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con los hijos y no dejarlos solos en ningún momento.
texts.en:
Jose Rodrigo is 36, single, and has three children. He lives with his children in the city of Chimbo, Bolivar province.
He sows corn, beans, and peas. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies, manure, fertilizer, fungicides, and insecticides. With this loan, he will be able to invest in supplies to improve and expand his crops.
Jose Rodrigo purchases his agricultural supplies in Chimbo. His dream is to improve his crops in order to also improve his family's quality of life.
He must confront the challenge of acquiring more land in the hope that his crops will improve.
He enjoys spending his free time with his children and not spending even a moment without them.

loans.use: to buy supplies, manure, fertilizer, fungicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with five children. Only four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

Victoria has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

She has been in this business for two years, selling to all categories of people. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis only, six days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Victoria aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аиде 29 лет, замужем. Аида по характеру очень веселая девушка. Её оптимизму и доброжелательности нету границ. Соседи Аиды отзываются о ней как о отзывчивой и старательной девушки. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Аида начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS) в 2005 году, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота и продажи молока. . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы и 10 голов овец по более низкой цене. Доходы Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Aida is 29 years old and married. She is a very upbeat young woman. She is unreservedly optimistic and friendly. Her neighbors describe her as thoughtful and hard-working. As a main source of income for her family, Aida started raising livestock. She launched her business in 2005 with 10,000 KGS; now her farm brings in about 10,000 KGS each month from cattle and dairy sales. In order to develop her business further, Aida has applied to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS intended for the purchase of one dairy cow and 10 sheep at a lower price. Aida plans to invest her revenues into a further development of her business by increasing the livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and one dairy cow.

loans.name: Las Luqueñas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Luqueña está en su ciclo número cuatro , ellas han hecho su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y arrojo que 3 de las miembros estan por debajo de la linea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien está en en nivel uno de la encuesta. Ella trabaja arduamente todos los días para ir creciendo y por medio de su esfuerzo mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. Mirna tiene un gran espíritu de superación y lo muestra día a día.
Solicita de este crédito, ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para su despensa, como ser verduras, fideos, arroz, frutas, panificados, leche y demás, ya que son los productos que más vende y que más demanda tiene.
texts.en:
The group called "La Luqueña" is in its fourth loan cycle.  They have done a poverty elimination survey, which revealed that 3 of the members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Mirna, who is at level one of the survey.  She works hard every day to continue growing and through her effort, to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Mirna has a great spirit of overcoming and shows it day after day.

She is applying for this loan, because she wants to invest it in buying basic needs to stock her grocery store, such as vegetables, noodles, rice, fruits, baked goods, milk and more.  These are the products that sell the most and that are in greatest demand.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, noodles, rice, fruits, baked goods, milk and more.

loans.name: José

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como técnico de equipamento agro-pecuário e tem uma machamba. Com o presente empréstimo pretende investir na sua machamba. 
No futuro deseja ampliar a sua machamba e crescer profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é  trabalhar mais.
texts.en:
Married with 3 children who attend the school, José lives in his own home and does not support anyone else. 
He works as an agricultural equipment technician and has a farm. With this loan, he wants to invest in his farm.
In the future, he wants to extend his farm and grow professionally, for that he is committed to repay the Hluvuku loan in order to request further loans. 
His goal is to work more.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Believe In God Iii Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ibrahim was born 37 years ago, in Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple have four children, one is in primary school and three are in secondary school. 

For 15 years now, Ibrahim has been a businessman. Currently, he is selling cigarettes and medicines.

This is the first loan that Ibrahim and his group members have applied for from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT)/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve upon their living conditions. 

Ibrahim is going to use his share of the loan to buy a large and wide variety of cigarettes and medicines, to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large and wide variety of cigarettes and medicines for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old entrepreneur from Kisauni, Kenya. She has two children, a boy and a girl aged 14 and 16 respectively. They are both in school. Rose’s major monthly expenditure is the school fees payment.

Rose has a poultry business where she keeps and sells poultry and eggs. She started the business three years ago.

She has approached for a loan request of KES 20,000 to add poultry to her business, simply because demand has increased.

loans.use: to add poultry to her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número diez, donde dos de las miembros han mostrado en su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que están en el nivel uno.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ylda es quien justamente esta dentro de las dos mujeres del nivel uno, quien necesita mejorar mucho su emprendimiento. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, y cuenta que está empezando a mejorar mucho, ya que se ha hecho más conocida de la gente y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Sus comidas son muy ricas y así gana a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, huevo, harina y demás, con lo que puede seguir haciendo sus alimentos y de esa forma seguir ganándose la vida y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Virgin de Fatima group is in its tenth loan cycle. Two of its members have been shown in a poverty elimination survey to be in level one.

One of the members of the group is Ylda, who is just in between the two level-one women. She needs to improve her entrepreneurial skills very much. She works selling all types of food and says that her business is starting to improve because she has become known by people and now has a good clientele. Ylda has won over her customers because her meals taste very good. 

Ylda is requesting this loan to be able to buy different types of meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, flour and other ingredients. With it she will be able to continue to make her dishes and continue earning a living and improving her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 61-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working in the transportation business since fifteen years ago. 

Khalil specializes in transporting children from and back to school. During his free time, he works as a taxi driver to increase his income and develop his family's social and financial situations.

Khalil is applying for his first loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to change his bus engine and pay for his wife's medical surgery. Both needs are important to him, since his bus is an essential source of income for him.

He is well known in the region and trusted by all of his customers who send their children with him.

Khalil hopes to buy another bus, and increase his income.

loans.use: to change his bus engine and pay for his wife's medical surgery.

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É motorista e negociante dedica se a venda de comidas e bebidas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, carne, frangos, e outros) para preparar e revender. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e construir uma mercearia para a sua esposa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
João is married and a father to four children who currently attend school. He lives in his own house and does not have to provide for anyone else.

He is a driver and a merchant and makes a living selling food and drinks. With this loan he intends to buy products (rice, flour, meat, chickens and others) to prepare and sell.

In the future he wishes to expand his business and build a grocery store for his wife. He commits to repaying the loan in order to request further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenges are the high cost of living and the lack of funds to carry out all his projects.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, meat, chickens and others) to prepare and sell

loans.name: Temel

texts.en:
Temel is 44 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in Batumi District. Several times, Temel requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is Temel’s salary, working as a driver of an emergency car. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Temel requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Temel will purchase a car and will work as a taxi driver. He will serve local people and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 50 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 18 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados de la zona del plan 3000,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Victoria va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  La Sra. Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar  de mejorar la  sazón de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo, La Sra. Victoria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old and has a son who is 18. She runs a lunch stall which is located in the one of the markets in the Plan 3000 area. This will be her first loan from the institution. Victoria will use the loan to buy supplies at wholesale, such as groceries and vegetables to make her dishes. She is requesting the loan because she cannot afford to buy the supplies she needs. Victoria’s main challenges in her business are the weather conditions and the competition from other food sellers, and that is why she needs to make her dishes taste even better. She will use the money she earns to buy utensils and to expand her business to bring in more customers at hte peak hours of lunch time. Victoria is a very hard-working person, and she is happy about the opportunity given to her by those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as groceries and vegetables, at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado María Auxiliadora de San Isidro está en su ciclo número 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde se esta aplicando con ellas la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con lo cual se quiere medir como están ellas y su situación económica.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir está en una situación media. Ella vende ropas de segunda mano desde hace un tiempo, y cuenta que su negocio está mejorando ya que las prendas usadas son cada vez mas aceptadas porque son más baratas y de esa forma está creciendo y da a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Alicia se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que se esfuerza al máximo para poder crecer.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas usadas y zapatos usados, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The María Auxiliadora de San Isidro Group is in the 13th phase of the women's committee program, where a survey about poverty elimination is being applied to determine how these women are doing and what their financial situations are. One of the group members is Mrs. Alicia, who showed a poverty level of 2 (medium) on her last survey. She's been selling second-hand clothes for some time and says her business is improving as used clothes, which are cheaper, are being increasingly more accepted. Her business is therefore growing and providing her family with all they need. Alicia defines herself as a very hard-working and determined woman that wants to get ahead, which is why she works to the maximum to keep growing. She's requesting this loan to buy second-hand clothes and shoes, so that she'll be able to set her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mary Kojo

texts.en: Mary is a 35 year old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 8.  All of them go to school. She has been running a clothes selling business for 4 years. She has no employees, and no other source of income. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase clothes and other things. In 5 years Mary would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Mary says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Angelina Aketi

texts.en: Angelina is a 37 year old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 12.  All of them go to school. She has been running a clothes selling business for 4 years. She has no employees, and no other source of income. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase clothes and other things. In 5 years Angelina would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Angelina says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Lona Dure

texts.en: Lona is a 27 year old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 2 children aged 3 and 8.  Both of them go to school. She has been running a clothes selling business for 5 years. She has no employees, and no other source of income. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase clothes and other things. In 5 years Lona would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Lona says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos varios en su casa de habitacion ubicada en el reparto pedro joaquin de chinandega, desde hace 4 años. la señora acompañada tiene dos hijos a su cargo y uno en edad escolar, la señora le gusta sentirse motivada con su negocio, ella a la vez de tener su negocio de mini pulperia tambien se esfuerza los fines de semana y realiza venta de sopa, ya sea de gallina, de res con punche o de mondongo varia segun la gustacion de sus clientes, tambien vende frijoles cocidos que es una alimento que no se deja de vender en toda Nicaragua ya que con este se hace el riquisimo y tradicional Gallo Pinto.

La señora empezo su negocio con capital propio con una ventesita de leñas y tortillas siempre ha trabajado de comerciante le gusta salir adelante y sacar adelante a su hijo por el cual se esfuerza para brindarle comida y estudios. tiene poco de trabajar con la institucion en su primer credito , pero en la entrevista manifesto que  se sintio en familia en la institución ya que la atendimos cuando nos nesecito.
texts.en:
The lady has been selling various products for 4 years in her home, located in the neighborhood Pedro Joaquin of Chinandega. She has two dependent children and one is school-aged.  The lady likes to feel motivated with her business, she had her business of a mini grocery store while she also works on weekends selling soup.  She offers either chicken, beef with crabs, or tripe soup as taste varies by customer.  She also sells baked beans which is a food that is not allowed to be sold across all of Nicaragua since this is the rich and traditional Gallo Pinto (traditional dish of rice and beans).

The lady started her business with capital of firewood and tortillas.  She has always worked in business as she likes to get ahead and raise her son, for whom she strives to provide food and education. She has little experience working with this institution for her first loan, but in the interview she said she felt like she had been in the family of the institution since it helped her when she needed it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as laundry detergent, detergent, bleach, rice, sugar, oil, costume jewelry, and vegetables.

loans.name: Safadur

texts.en:
Safadur is 45, married, and father of three daughters, ages 23, 21, and 19. His two eldest daughters are married; his third daughter is betrothed and will get married soon. He was a songster at the wedding parties. But, after the death of his last, fourth daughter, he stopped this activity.  

Today, Safadur operates a grocery store where sells consumer goods. This store is the main income to support his family. Additionally, to earn extra money, he is engaged in the sheep-breeding business. 

Safadur is a hard-bitten man and always tries to do his work himself. He wants to develop the sheep-breeding business. With the loan he has applied for, he plans to buy 35 head of lambs, to fatten them, and re-sell them at the bazaar located in the district where he lives.

loans.use: to buy 35 head of lambs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 53 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 7 hijos mayores ,con quienes comparte la casa de material noble que construyerón con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Adela es la venta de comida como desayunos, almuerzos y tamales. La preparación la realiza en su hogar y la venta de forma ambulatoria es decir caminando por las calles de la ciudad. Ocasionalmente trabaja con su hija en la entrega de almuerzos a trabajadores que realizan obras de construcción ,llegando a vender hasta 50 raciones diarias. Se inició hace más de 15 años en este negocio con un préstamo particular, al comienzo lo realizaba sola, pero ahora cuenta con el apoyo de sus 3 hijas . Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los ingresos económicos que recibe y viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea establecer un modesto restaurante en su hogar para que asi continue con su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de utensilios e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, condimentos y otros a su vez comenta que está contenta , al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes.
texts.en:
Adela is 53 years old, single, and lives with her seven grown children in a home that they built themselves out of good materials.  Adela works selling breakfast, lunch and tamales. She does the preparation at home and makes her sales by walking the city streets.  Occasionally she delivers lunches with her daughter to construction workers, selling up to 50 servings a day.  

Adela started in this business more than 15 years ago with the assistance of loan funding.  At first she worked alone, but now she is joined by three of her daughters.  She considers the business profitable given the incoming revenues.  Because of the good returns, she would like to move forward with her business by establishing a modest restaurant in her home.  Adela is requesting $600 (S/. 1500) to buy cooking utensils and ingredients, including rice, sugar, condiments and more.  Adela says she is happy knowing she has financial support to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and ingredients.

loans.name: José Adan

texts.es:
José tiene30 años de edad, esta soltero. Él vive junto a su abuelo, que dependen totalmente de José; por lo que ha tenido que ser una persona responsable para cuidar a su abuelo. Tiene ocho meses de administrar su propia tienda, le ha ido muy bien, pues la ha ampliado y el lugar en donde vive es bien poblado; hace seis años dejo de estudiar. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar como jornalero ganando $5.00 dólares el día, desempeñando labores de abonado, limpieza, corta en los cañales. 

Los productos para su tienda, los compra a los proveedores que llegan hasta su casa y a los agricultores de la zona que les compra plátanos para madurarlos en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar bebidas, frutas para hacer licuados, plátanos en cantidades mayores. De esta manera, podrá vender más y podrá comprarle a su abuelo las medicinas y vitaminas que necesita, para mejorar un poco su vida. Su propósito, es convertirse en un gran comerciante y formar su propia familia con esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old and single.  He lives with his grandfather who in completely dependent on him. José has had to be a responsible person in order to take care of his grandfather.  He has been managing his own store for eight months.  It is going very well as he has expanded it and the place where he lives is well populated.  He left school six years ago.  Previously, he worked as a laborer earning $5.00 a day, performing tasks such as fertilizing, cleaning, and cutting on the sugar-cane plantations. 

He purchases the products for his store from suppliers that come to his home and from area farmers.  He buys bananas and ripens them in his home.  He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase drinks, fruit to make smoothies, and bananas in large quantities.  In this way, he will be able to sell more and purchase the medicines and vitamins that his grandfather needs to make his life a little better.  His goal is to become a successful merchant and form his own family with a wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, fruit to make smoothies, and bananas in large quantities.

loans.name: Somanath Self Help Group

texts.en: Puspalata is a 47-year-old lady and has five children. She lives in Balipatna village, Odisha, India with her husband and her children. She owns and manages a "Chaat stall" (Indian spicy and sour street food). She roams around the village and in the nearby market place. She is requesting a loan amount of 200,000 INR to buy ingredients like wheat flour, grams, lentils, sauces, spices, vegetables, etc. for making "Chaat". With this investment she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting within a group of 10 members where all are women and all of them live in the same community. They named their group Somanath Self Help Group, situated in the Khurda district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing ingredients like wheat flour, grams, lentils, sauces, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food stall.

loans.name: Lankeswari Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en:
Lankeswari Mahila Samiti consists of 12 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among them. 

One of them is Mamina, who was selected as the President of Lankeswari Mahila Samiti. The lady standing fourth from the right hand side, wearing a black dress in the photo is Mamina. Mamina is 38 years old and is living with her husband and her three children. All her children are in school. She hopes to see them later on as a officer serving the country. She is engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in the village and nearby market. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 INR, which will help her to purchase more cows and fodder for her dairy business. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase a cow and fodder for cows.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more cows and fodder for her dairy business.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana es madre soltera con mucha fuerza de voluntad con muchos ánimos y muchos deseos de superarse y ser un ejemplo para sus 2 hijos los cuales con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio están estudiando. Uno esta en el kinder y el otro en la escuela su familia a pesar de ser de bajos recursos económicos pudieron ayudar a su hija a completar la primaria. Ellos no pudieron seguirla apoyando ya que sus ingresos eran muy bajos y en ocasiones solo alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar como la alimentación, medicinas y vestimenta. Ana no tiene ayuda de parte del padre de sus hijos pero tuvo la dicha y la bendición de DIOS de poner en su camino a la madre de su ex pareja misma que le regalo un pedazo de tierra para que pudiera trabajarlo. Gracias a eso ella cultiva café actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres su propiedad esta ubicada a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada diariamente a pie.

Ana actualmente está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono y para el pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento y corte de su cosecha de café ya que ella es madre soltera y no se da abasto para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo. De esa forma ella podrá elaborar un buen trabajo y le dará mejores resultados para poder invertir sus ganancias en su cultivo.
  
Su sueño es que sus hijos logren educarse para que tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo, una mejor calidad de vida y puedan apoyarla y ayudarla a cubrir algunas necesidades en el hogar y personales ya que ellos serán los herederos del esfuerzo y sacrificio que ella hoy en día hace para salir adelante, la tierra para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother with a lot of willpower, spirit and desire to better herself and be an example to her two children. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, both of her children are currently studying. One is in kindergarten and the other is studying in the school. Despite having limited resources, her family was able to help her daughter finish primary school. But they were not able to continue supporting her, because their income is very low, and on occasion they were only able to cover basic household necessities like food, medicines and clothes.

Ana does not receive help from the father of her children. But she says that good fortune and the blessing of God have put his mother in her life, who has given Ana a piece of land so that Ana can cultivate it. On this piece of land Ana grows coffee, which she was taught how to do by her parents. Ana’s coffee field is three kilometers from her house, and she travels to it each day on foot.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay for the labor for maintaining and harvesting her coffee crop. As a single mother, she says she is just not able to maintain it. With this loan, she says she will be able to harvest a good coffee crop, and with better results, she can invest the profits in the cultivation of the coffee field.

Ana’s dream is for her children to be educated so that they have better work opportunities and a better quality of life. They could then also support her and help her cover some household and personal necessities, as they are inheriting from all of her current effort and sacrifice for them to get ahead and have her coffee field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay for the labor for maintaining and harvesting her coffee crop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 56 años, es soltera y vive junto a su hija y su nieto en la casa propia que construyo junto a su ex esposo.El negocio de Juana consiste en la venta de diversos artículos de uso común tales como esmaltes de uña, ganchos de cabello, algunas prendas de vestir, juguetes, algodón, espejos y otros. Todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda ubicado en el interior de un concurrido mercado para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Recuerda que cuando se inició en este negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, eso la desanimaba , sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeño puesto de ventas, ahora le va muy bien  razón por la cual ya tiene 10 años en este negocio.Lo que más le gusta de su labor es intercambiar con sus clientes instantes de felicidad, conversar con ellos y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano, sobre todo cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará productos que se usarán en la fiesta de carnavales de su ciudad  como globos, pistolas de agua y talcos debido a que se acerca la celebración de estas fiestas y serán objetos muy requeridos en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, is single and lives with her daughter and grandson in her own house that was built with her ex-husband.  Juana's business is selling various items of common use such as nail polish, bobby pins, some clothing, toys, cotton, and mirrors etc. Every day from early morning, she opens the doors of her shop, located inside a crowded market, to serve all customers who come to her establishment in search of a product with the assurance that they will find what they need. 

She remembers that when she started in this business she did not have many products to offer so she could not have good sales during the day.  That was discouraging, but nevertheless she found a solution.  She got a small amount of capital and gradually implemented her small selling station.  She is doing very well now for 10 years in this business.  What she most likes about her work is to share with clients moments of happiness; to talk to them and see them start the day with a smile.  She believes that the hardest part is getting up early, especially when she feels tired, however, she knows that's her job and she has to do it.  She expects her business to grow further and provide better financial income

With this opportunity, Juana will request 500 soles.  She is very happy to know she has financial support, as this will make her feel more confident to move forward with her work.  She also promises once again to meet timely payment of her dues. With the requested loan, she will buy products to be used in the celebration of their city's carnivals such as balloons, water guns and powders.  As they approach the celebration of the holidays these items will be in high demand this season.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the parties of carnival.

loans.name: Maa Bhuasuni M K S Group

texts.en:
Thirteen women from a village stepped out and formed a group named Maa Bhuasuni M K S in Odisha. They help each other and share their problems and solve them among them.  They celebrate their festivals together in their village.  

Sabitri, leader of the group, is engaged in the activity of selling products made of plastic like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware, containers, etc. She purchases these products from a wholesaler and then sells them at the market. Her husband assists her in selling these products. In this way she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily family activities.
	
She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase more products of such kind in bulk, so that she can reduce her transportation cost. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. 

She has requested a loan of 195,000 INR for her group, so that they can earn more and they will control their family cash flow.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing plastic products like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware, containers etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mahalami Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mahalami Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. Few years back they were all facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Swagatika who was selected as their president. Swagatika is a 35-year-old lady, living with her husband and her three children who are at their schooling. The lady standing fifth from the left hand side is Swagatika. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which reason she has requested a loan to utilize it in purchasing items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 36 years old and lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. Betty is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old. The children are presently in school and live at home. For the past 12 years, Betty has been selling fresh fish from a table in the local market. Her major challenge is that the price of  fish is not stable. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. She plans to improves the lives of her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 40 years old and married, and she supports a family of six. She runs a general store in Eldama Ravine. This has been her income generating business for the past ten years and where she gets an average monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000, with this being her second loan with KADET LTD. With this loan, she intends to purchase more stocks of goods for her retail shop, like maize flour, crates of bread and tea leaves, for resale. She anticipates making a profit, with which she will pay school fees for her children. With the surplus, she will expand her business.

Razia hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods for her shop, like maize flour, crates of bread and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and dairy feeds for his dairy cow.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 27-year-old man from the western part of Kenya. He is a married man, and, together with his wife, they are blessed with one child who is three years old. He a carpenter and has been in this business for the last four years where he comfortably makes a monthly income of 45,000 KES.

Denis was introduced to KADET LTD by his current group members and since then he has enjoyed benefits that KADET offers through its products. He is taking his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more fine wood for making tables, chairs, and other assortments of furniture. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of becoming the leading carpenter in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fine timber and plywood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to resell in his store, like sugar, soap, and tea leaves

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is a 40-year-old gentleman married to Ruth, a housewife, and he is a father of five. He sells shoes for a living and has been in the business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He learned about KADET LTD from one of his regular customers, who is already registered. He has acquired his first loan of KES 20,000, which he has added to his savings to purchase a bale of secondhand shoes, as well as expand his business space. 

Hosea plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His hope and dream is to grow his business and venture to a large outlet.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Osohchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Osohchimeg is 21 years old and lives with her mother and twin sister in a small house in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. Her mother Oyunhuu has been running an organic vegetable and fruits retail business in the local market for year. The borrower has been helping her mother since she was in the 1st grade of primary school. Her twin sister Osohnemeh studies at university. The borrower started her own organic vegetable sales business in a rental counter of the local market in 2005 during her free time from her studies. She is now requesting 3,0000,000 MNT to purchase more organic vegetables to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, well-experienced, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase more organic vegetables to sell to local customers

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposa e hija que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar una motocicleta para el transporte para su trabajo. El cuenta con un trabajo donde se le dificulta el transportarse por autobús por su horario de trabajo, por lo cual es que el necesita mejorar o facilitar la llegado a su labores y en el horario establecido. El tiene pensado así aumentar su rendimiento de trabajo en horas y a su vez ser más puntual con respecto a la hora de entrada a labores. El piensa en el futuro de su familia por lo cual necesita cuidar mucho su trabajo para su bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Jairo is in a common-law marriage and live with his wife and daughter who are his greatest priority.  He plans to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work.  It is difficult for him to travel to work by bus because of his schedule.  He needs to improve or facilitate his mode of transportation so that he arrives at work on time.  He is thinking about increasing his work hours and in turn, arrive at work more punctually.  He is concerned about his family’s future and welfare so he needs to care about his job.  This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He hasn’t had any other loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provides the loan with easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work.

loans.name: Zambagatsetseg

texts.en: Zambagatsetseg is 54 years old lives with her husband and two children in Ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Nergui, is a herder and travels around with livestock. Her daughter, Bulgantamir, helps her father to take care of the livestock. Her son, Ochirbat, is disabled and stays home. Zambagatsetseg has been running an organic dairy products production and sales business in the local market since 2000. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic milk and meat products to produce organic dairy and meat products. She is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman who also has good previous loan records in XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk and meat products to produce organic dairy and meat products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 33 years old and is from Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a shop for the maintenance and sale of used refrigerators and washing machines. She asked Yehu for this loan in order to buy new goods and stock with bundles of wheat flour for her shop. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and increase her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new goods and bundles of wheat flour for her shop

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a 54-year-old man. He lives with his family in Khashuri district. His wife is 49 years old, and they have two children who are going to school. Vazha owns an apartment which he is renting out so the family has a small monthly income. 

Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the requested loan Vazha wants to open a Georgian bread bakery. He owns a commercial space and will buy all the needed equipment. Vazha will bake himself normal Georgian bread and also flavored sweet bread which originally comes from Khashuri district.  Vazha hopes the business will be profitable, as the location is very populous. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family and Vazha will be able to provide for his children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Naserian Enole

texts.en:
Naserian has paid off her previous loan owing to last season's bumper harvest.

She has used the proceeds to lease an additional piece of land as well as hire workers to man the farm.

She has been advanced a third loan of 30,000 KES which will facilitate her in the preparation of land for the upcoming planting season as well as the purchase of farm inputs.

She hopes to use the increased proceeds to diversify in animal rearing and pay fees for her children. Her dream is to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Freddy Alonso

texts.es:
FREDDY ALONSO tiene 30 años de edad es soltero tiene una hija, vive con unos familiares en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.
