FREDDY ALONSO trabaja en una institución Pública. Solicita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora, lavadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los electrodomésticos que tanta falta le hace en la casa.

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.El sueño es cambiar el nivel de vida. Los desafíos a los que se nefrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en: Freddy Alonso is 30 years old, unmarried, and has a daughter.  He lives with his family in Chimbo in the province of Bolívar.  He works at a public institution.  He is requesting the loan to purchase a refrigerator and washing machine.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to purchase the much needed appliances for his home.  He will make the purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to improve his standard of living.  The challenges he faces are illnesses.  In his free time, he enjoys playing football.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and washing machine.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 2 filhas das quais 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de comidas e bebidas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (caldo, arroz, refrescos, cervejas, vinhos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e ajudar as suas filhas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento devido do empréstimo para poder levantar outros
texts.en:
A widow and a mother to two daughters, one of whom attends school, Angelina lives in her own home and does not support anyone else. She is the owner and operator of her own business selling food and drinks. With this loan, she plans to buy products (juice, rice, soft drinks, beers, wines, and others) to increase her available merchandise.
In the future, she wants to grow her business and to help her daughters, for these reasons she is committed to repaying the Hluvuku loan. Her goal is to repay the loan so that she may take out further loans.

loans.use: to buy products (juice, rice, soft drinks, beers, wines, and others) to increase the amount of her merchandise.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 33-year-old mother from the western part of Kenya and is married to Julius, who also supports the family. She and her husband are blessed with three children who are 16, 13 and 5 years old.

Hellen is a fish monger and she has been doing the business for the past four years, comfortably making a monthly income of Kes 8,000. 

She is currently taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase the stock of fish for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back into the business and start another business.

She has a dream of becoming a successful businesswoman and educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kate Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of Kate's Group. She went along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Josephine is a 48-year-old married woman, and the mother of four children (Tony-32-M, George-26-M, Rita-23-F, Albert-14-M). She has been working in preparing and selling Mouneh for two years, to help her beloved husband in making their living, and covering their expenses. Today Josephine is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood to keep her family warm during this winter season.

Josephine wishes that one day she will be capable of buying each one of her children his or her own house. She is the second from the left.

Danielle is a 29-year-old married woman, and the mother of two children (Elio-2-M, Kate-1-F). She has been working in a tailoring business for six years. Her shop is well known in the region and she has a very good reputation. Her portion of the loan will be invested in developing her business. She is the first one from the right.

Ahlam is the second one from the right; she has worked in a clothes selling shop for three years. She is a 28-year-old married woman, and the mother of one child (Huda-8months-F), and she is planing to start her own clothes selling business.

Noura is a 29-year-old married woman, and the mother of one child (Aya-7-F). She is the first one on the left. She has worked in a beauty salon for six years. With her portion of the loan, she will buy necessary oils requested to keep her family warm during this winter. She hopes to open her own beauty  salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary wood to keep her family warm during this winter season.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 52 years old and is from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married to Gatumbi and they have four children who are in school.

Hannah is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She hopes to use the loan amount to buy three bags of fertilizer for use in the farming business.

She hopes to increase her farm yield so as to educate her children and improve the family's living standards

loans.use: to buy  three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Apotcho

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants de 18 et 15ans, Apotcho est mariée. Elle est couturière de profession et exerce en même temps comme activité la vente de pagnes et des produits de mercerie.  Avec 5 apprentis dans son atelier, elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de revendre aux clients. Elle désire à l’avenir, augmenter son stock d’articles de mercerie et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle est âgée de 44ans et son conjoint est gérant d’un dépôt de boissons.
texts.en: The mother of two children, aged 18 and 15, Apotcho is a married woman and a clothier by trade. At the same time, she has a business selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and sewing supplies. With five apprentices in her workshop, she is requesting a second loan to purchase some merchandise to resell to customers. For the future, she would like to increase her inventory of sewing supplies and to meet the needs of her family. She is 44 years old and her husband is a manager at a beverages warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Minto

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 25ans, Minto est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant en charge. Il est informaticien et a ouvert un cyber depuis 2011 dans un quartier de la place. Afin d’acheter un compteur électrique et réaménager son cyber, il  fait son troisième crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs. Il espère voir son activité évoluer et assurer ses moindres besoins vitaux.
texts.en: A 25-year-old young man, Minto is unmarried and has no children to support. He is a software engineer, and he opened an internet café in 2011 in a local district. To purchase an electric meter and to renovate his internet café, he has taken out his third WAGES loan in order to achieve his goals. He hopes to see his business evolve and to ensure every vital need is met.

loans.use: to purchase an electric meter and to renovate his internet café.

loans.name: Adidjétou

texts.fr: Adjidjétou vit avec son mari chauffeur et leurs 04 enfants à Lomé. Trois de ses derniers sont scolarisés. Adjidjétou quant à elle est revendeuse de friperie au marché et cela depuis 2003. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoè et sollicite ce premier à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle voudrait à l’avenir, augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Elle est âgée de 44ans.
texts.en:
Adidjétou lives with her husband (a driver) and their four children in Lomé. Three of her children are at school, and Adidjétou herself has worked reselling second-hand clothing in the market since 2003. She gets her supplies in Hédzranawoè market, and has requested this first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise.

In the future, Adidjétou would like to increase her sales, as well as to make sure that her family gets ahead in life. She is 44 years of age.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.pt:
Casada e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, portas, barrotes, chapas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e fazer crescer o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e ver o seu negócio crescer.
texts.en:
Married and a parent to three children who attend the school, Suzana lives in her own home and does not support anyone else.
She is the owner and operator of her own business selling various products. With this loan she wants to buy construction materials (windows, doors, beams, plates, and others) to continue the work on her house.
In the future, she wants to complete her home and grow her business, for these reasons she is committed to repaying the loan to Hluvuku. 
Her goal is to work harder to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (windows, doors, beams, plates, and others) to continue the work on her house.

loans.name: Olzii-Orshig

texts.en: Olzii-Orshih is 35 years old and lives with his wife and son in a Ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Altanchimeg, age 26 is a university student and helps her husband to run his wood furniture manufacturing business. His son, Erhes, age 4, goes to the local kindergarten. Olzii-Orshih has been running his wood furniture manufacturing business since 2006. He sells his furniture to local and countryside customers and he delivers the furniture to customers. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to pay his wife's university tuition fee. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to pay his wife's university tuition fee.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 38 years old. She is married with six children who are all still in school. She works in sales, and has owned a charcoal store for about six years. She started in sales with her own money, which she had acquired from her previous work, which she then invested little by little in her store. She says that it has been going very well, since she makes money every day, and has fixed customers. This has been her first business.

She has asked for a loan amounting to 10,000 KES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elisio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É auxiliar administrativo dos CFM. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para remodelar e ampliar a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e ver os filhos formados, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para ter fundos suficientes para pagar os estudos dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Elisio is married with three children, two of which are attending school.  He lives in his own home and does not support anyone else. 
He is an administrative assistant at "CFM". With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron etc.) to expand and remodel his home.
In the future, he wants to complete his home and see the children formally educated, for these reasons he is committed to repay Hluvuku in order to request further loans.  
His goal is to work more in order to have enough funds to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron etc.) to remodel and extend his home.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, todos frequentam escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seu irmão, mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
É agente do serviço no Ministério da Saúde afecto em Boane. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, portas, chapas, e outros) para a cobertura e reboque da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
António is married with three children, all attending school, and lives in his own home supporting his brother and two nephews who live with him.
He is a service agent at the Ministry of Health in Boane. With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, paneling etc.) to cover his home and trailer.
In the future, he wants to complete and furnish his home, for these reasons he is committed to repay Hluvuku in order to request future loans.
His goal is the completion of the construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, paneling etc.) to cover his home and trailer.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ben, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits, de condiments, des tubercules et de céréales.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ben sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente MARIAM, assise au milieu, compte acheter un chargement de charrette d’ignames avec les grossistes de Dioïla  pour ensuite les revendre sur place dans le village et des les foires environnantes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The group Ben is composed exclusively of married women, who average 38 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Tomba, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing, condiments, tubers, and grains. The women of the group Ben are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, MARIAM, who is seated in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase a cart load of yams from Dioïla wholesalers and then resell the yams locally in the village and at nearby fairs. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in this business.

loans.use: to purchase tubers to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de tubercules, de savon et font l’élevage.                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
La cliente KOROTOUMOU, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des débout, compte acheter des condiments (un sac sel, deux paniers de tomate, cinq kilos d’oignons et un paquet de cube Maggi) avec les revendeurs de Nangola, qu’elle revend sur place dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of married women who average 41 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Tomba, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, tubers, and soaps, and they raise livestock. The women of the group Benkadi are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, KOROTOUMOU, who is the second person standing from the right, intends to purchase some condiments (a bag of salt, two baskets of tomatoes, 5 kg of onions, and a packet of Maggi cubes) from Nangola retailers. She resells them locally in the village to a customer base composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the condiments business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
Casado e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
É operador de máquinas numa empresa de produção de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, aros, portas, chapas, e outros) para a cobertura da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa, construir um murro e adquirir uma viatura, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para realizar os seus projectos e a falta de apoio moral da sua família.
texts.en:
Albino is married, does not have any children and lives in his own house supporting two nephews who live with him.  
He is a machine operator in a banana production company. With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials (cement, frames, doors, paneling etc.) to cover his home.
In the future, he wants to complete his home, build a wall and buy a car, for these reasons he is committed to repay Hluvuku in order to request further loans.
His challenges are the lack of sufficient funds to carry out his projects and lack of moral support from his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, rims, doors, paneling etc.) to cover his home

loans.name: Santos Xiomara

texts.es:
Santos Xiomara es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y con deseos de superarse junto a su esposo en hogar tienen una hija la cual está en primaria y al salir de sus actividades escolares ayuda en con los quehaceres en su casa a su madre y el en campo le ayuda el esposo con las actividades de limpieza, poda y corte del mismo. Santos Xiomara tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 4 grado ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos por lo cual ellos le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura en la siembra y cultivo de café. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 10 años el terreno donde están sus cultivos es propio el cual lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y empeño. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de tres kilómetros de su casa de habitación por lo cual gracias a la buena inversión y forma de utilizar el dinero pudieron comprar un carro el cual les ayuda a llegar y trasportar las herramientas para el mantenimiento de su cultivo.

Santos Xiomara actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abono y otros materiales para su cultivo de café que le es difícil adquirir debido al su alto costo.
  
Su sueño es que su cultivo sea uno de los más productivos de la zona de esa manera poder educar a su hija para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo, un mejor nivel de educación, ya que el cultivo de café es la única fuente de trabajo e ingresos de nuestra familia.
texts.en:
Santos Xiomara is a striving, enterprising woman with desires to succeed with her husband.  They have a daughter at home who is in primary school and after she gets out of school, she helps her mother with the chores at home and her husband helps her in the fields with the cleaning, pruning, and cutting.  Santos Xiomara has a primary school education and only studied up to fourth grade because her parents are poor.  They taught her to work on the farm in coffee planting and cultivation.  She has been engaged in farming for ten years.  She owns the land where she cultivates her crops and acquired it through great effort and determination.    Her crops are located three kilometers from her home.   Thanks to a good investment and money management, she was able to buy a car which helps her to reach her crops and carry the tools for their maintenance.

Currently, Santos Xiomara is requesting help to purchase fertilizers, organic fertilizer, and other inputs for her coffee cultivation that are difficult to acquire because of their high cost.  Her dream is that her crops are one of the most productive in the region.  In this way, she will be able to educate her daughter so that she will have a better quality of life, better employment opportunities, and a higher level of education since coffee growing is her family’s only source of work and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, organic fertilizer, and other inputs for her coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Nasygul

texts.ru: Насыгуле 49 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей, младшей дочку  11 лет. Муж Насыгуле скоропостижно скончался в 2011 году. Насыгула с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Насыгули имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 15 овец, 2,0 га с посевом фасоль, эспарцета , ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). Доходы позволяют Насыгуле покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи на питание и бытовые нужды. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насыгула обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец увеличения доходов от перепродажи скота. Доходы Насыгула планирует копить деньги на свадьбу детям.
texts.en: Nasygul is 49 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children, the youngest of whom is her 11 year old daughter. Nasygul's husband died suddenly in 2011. Since 1994, Nasygul has practiced animal husbandry and crop farming, starting this business with 3,000 som (KGS). On Nasygul's farm, she currently has one milk cow with offspring, 15 sheep, and 2.0 hectares of land planted with beans and sainfoin.The monthly profit is about 9,000 som (KGS). The income allows Nasygul to cover her family's daily expenses for food and living needs. In order to further develop her business, Nasygul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 8 sheep, which would increase her income through the resale of livestock. With this income, Nasygul plans to save money for her children's weddings.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sheep

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora con muchos deseos de superación feliz mente casada madre de un hijo junto a su esposo se dedican a la actividad de cultivo y producción de granos básicos como ser maíz, frijoles y café en pequeña escala producto que es comercializado en los alrededores y cercanías de su pueblo, mercado local  y de su vivienda. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 15 años siendo sus padres agricultores desde toda una vida los que le enseñaron dicha actividad sus cultivos están a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente para su asistencia y monitoreo ya que este tipo de cultivo necesita mucho cuidado. Teresa no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero agradece mucho el esfuerzo de sus padres por haber podido ayudarla a cursar hasta el 3 grado de educación primaria ya que sus recursos económicos eran pocos.

Teresa hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación para su cultivo de café de esta forma evitaría que su cultivo se enfermera con la roya la cual afecta y destruye cultivos completos de café de no ser tratada a tiempo.   

Sus sueños es que sus cultivos de café sean los mas productivos para que de esa manera pueda seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de la canasta básica, como también poder darle a su hijo una buena educación prepararlo a nivel universitario para que pueda tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hard-working and determined women who seeks to get ahead in life. She is happily married and has one child with her husband. They earn their living through farming basic crops such as maize, beans and coffee on a small scale, and then selling the products in the areas surrounding her town, at the local market and from her house. She has worked in agriculture for over 15 years. Her parents were farmers and since she was a little girl have taught her about this activity. Her crops are at a distance of 2 kilometers from her house. She walks this distance every day to look after and monitor the crops, since these types of crops require a lot of care. 

Teresa did not have the opportunity to study but she is very grateful for the help of her parents in helping her to go to school up until the 3rd grade of primary education since they did not have many resources. 

Teresa is now asking for help to buy fertilizers, manure and fumigation pumps for her coffee plantation and in this way avoid the destruction of her crops by leaf rust fungus (Roya) which can completely destroy coffee plantations if they are not treated on time. 

Her dream is for her coffee plantations to become as productive as possible so that in this way she can continue helping her husband with the daily household expenses and provide her son with a good university education  so that he can have more employment opportunities and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and fumigation pumps for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine’s group is one of YICE’s Women self-help groups in Ntuuma village. The group is made up of five members and they all come from the same village. Josephine is the group leader. All group members are farmers, but the types of crops they grow are varied, including: maize, beans, vegetables, ground nuts, and cassava. They also keep animals like pigs, goats, and sheep.

Currently, Josephine (first from the right), age 36, grows ground nuts, beans, and cassava. She has been growing these crops for over the last five years but is getting low yields. After acquiring skills through YICE’s farming-as-business training, Josephine now needs a loan to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farming enterprise.

She believes her yields will increase and she will earn a higher income after selling her produce. She plans to use her profits for school fees for her two orphaned children, and she has a dream of seeing her children completing University education and working in the Ugandan local government.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret’s group comprises five members who all live in the same village. All the group members are smallholder farmers; they grow crops and rear animals on a small scale. Members grow crops like maize, onion, beans, ground nuts, soya beans, and vegetables. Two of the members also rear pigs. 

The group leader, Margret (second from left), is 46 years old and a widow with six children -- two of who were born with physical disabilities.

Margret grows beans, maize, and rears animals. She has been a farmer for the last twenty years, and she earns all her income from farming. Margret and other members of her group attended YICE’s trainings in farming-as-a-business and acquired skills in better farming methods that will increase their farming productivity.

Margret and her group members are requesting a loan to buy good quality seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizers for their farming enterprises. Margret plans to use profits after sale of her produces to expand her farm size and has a dream of building a good house for her children.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pestcides to improve their farming

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth’s group has received trainings on better farming practices through YICE’s farming-as-a-business training project, and it is one of YICE’s women self-help groups in Namabale village. The group leader is Ruth (center); all of the group members have small farming enterprises and come from the same village. Members of this group grow different crops, but they work as a team and help each other on their small farms.

Ruth is 57 years old and married with six children. Ruth has been farming since she was 15 years old, but she believes that she has never yielded enough at harvest because she has always used poor quality local seeds and never used any fertilizers. 

Ruth asks for this loan to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to access more training on better farming methods. She believes with this support, her yields will increase and she will be able to help her family and improve her finances.

Ruth has a dream of training her last born to become a lawyer.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en:
Felista’s group consists of five members living in the same village and growing the same crops: onions and beans. Felista (first from right) is the group leader. She is 59 years old, widowed, and has eight children. Felista and her group members have grown onions and tomatoes for the last two years but they believe they have never yielded enough at harvest.

After attaining training in better farming practices, Felista and her group members want to try better ways of growing onions and tomatoes and using better quality seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides. 

Felista asks for a loan to buy good quality onion and tomato seeds and fertilizers to apply in her field. She will use a portion of this loan to hire casual laborers to help her prepare her field well.

Felista says she enjoys YICE’s interactive trainings on farming and health practices. She has a dream of becoming a model onion farmer in her village, and she enjoys sharing her knowledge with the rest of the community members to learn.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence’s group is made up of 5 members, all of who are women from the same village. All members of this group rear pigs and keep local chickens, and they also grow crops. The leader of this group is Florence (first from right); she is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are three and five years old.

Since 2010 Florence has earned her income through sales of pigs for meat and eggs from her chicken.  She faces a challenge of slow growth of her pigs. She believes that this is because she rears local poor breeds.

Florence attained training in farming-as-a-business and acquired new skills to improve her piggery and poultry projects.

She is requesting a loan to buy an exotic male piglet. This way she will get quality piglets and convert her business to rearing exotic pigs. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy high-quality feed for her pigs and chicken. 

She has a dream of educating her children to university and supporting her husband to start a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy animals and high-quality feed for their piggery and poultry projects

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 31 años de edad de estado civil viuda con 3 hijos menores de edad los cuales dependen de ella, su esposo desgraciada mente falleció hace 4 años ya que le quitaron la vida de manera violenta fuera de su comunidad. En su juventud sus padres de muy bajos recursos no pudieron ayudarle con sus estudios lo que a muy temprana edad decidió aprender a trabajar la tierra. Posteriormente decidió casarse a una edad de 19 años felizmente casada su matrimonio duro 8 años. Hoy en día sus suegros con gran cariño hacia ella y sus nietos le regalaron una propiedad la cual esta cultivada con café para que ella pudiera dar asistencia a su cultivo y poder cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos como ser: vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas, etc. Muy agradecida con DIOS en primer lugar, sus padres, y sus suegros le ayudan con parte de los gastos de sus hijos mientras la cosecha se termina de producir para luego poder volver a invertir un poco de las ganancias en sus cultivos y la otra parte para su hogar ya que sus hijos van creciendo y los gastos son mas. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de de 6 kilómetros de su vivienda al cual se traslada diariamente a pie. 

Irma tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante tomando en cuenta el apoyo que le brindan sus padres y suegros hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de riego para abonar sus cultivos de café y poder sacar este próximo año una buena cosecha. 

Su meta, sus esperanzas y sus sueños es poder educar a sus tres hijos para que de esa manera ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y puedan ayudarle con lo que ella mejor sabe hacer a pesar de ser cansado el apoyo con la agricultura.
texts.en:
Irma is a 31-year-old woman. She is widowed and has three children, all under the age of 18, who depend on her. Her husband sadly died four years ago, victim of a violent murder outside of their neighborhood. When she was younger, her parents had a very low income and could not support her in her studies, so she decided to learn how to work the land from a very young age. She married when she was 19 and was happily married for eight years. Her in-laws very kindly gave her and their grandchildren a plot of land to grow coffee so that she could provide for herself and her children in terms of clothing, food and medicines, etc. First of all she is thankful to God, her parents, and her in-laws who help her with her children’s expenses while the harvest is ending. She uses part of her earnings to invest in her crops, and spends the other part on her family as her children are growing up and the expenses are increasing. Her crops are six kilometers from where she lives, and she travels to them on foot. 

Irma want to improve her situation and has the support of her parents and in-laws. She is currently requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and water pumps to fertilize her coffee crops in order to have a good harvest this year.

Her goals, hopes, and dreams are to be able to give her children a good education so that they have a better quality of life, better job opportunities,and can support her in what she knows best how to do, which is agriculture, although it is very tiring work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and water pumps to improve her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel lives in Sinkor, one of the areas where the living conditions are almost like those in the center of Monrovia. She is 37 years old and single. She has a one-year-old child. She is a high school graduate. 

For five years now, Mabel has been selling palm oil, but sometimes buying goes slow. She learned this trade from her friends and likes her business because it makes her self-sufficient. 

Mabel is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build her house and take care of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Wan Word Movement Group

texts.en:
Members of the “Wan Word Movement" group are grateful to Kiva lenders for the previous Kiva loan that they received. With the help of their just concluded loan, these entrepreneurs were able to expand on the sizes and qualities of their respective businesses. This led to an increase in sales and project-to-sale-margins. 

Having finished repaying their last loan successfully, they have reapplied for a new loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. This new loan will further enhance their respective businesses.  

Featured leader Aminata will again use her share of the loan to buy market food: onions, salt, pepper, rice, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, salt, pepper, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
This is Cecilia's group and they are made up of ten females. They sell items like ladies’ top and down wear, bed sheets, hair and body creams, fish, charcoal, yams, eggs, stationery, provisions and plastic products. 

Cecilia is a 32-year-old secondhand clothing seller. She is married to a 46-year-old civil worker and they have three children.

She sells ladies top and down wear, bed sheets and body creams. She hawks to customers in Teshie and also travels to Ashiaman and sells to customers. She has been doing this job for seven years and sells from Monday to Saturday and from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Cecilia needs GHS 800 to be able to buy one bale of bed sheets to sell to customers.

Cecilia, together with her colleagues, needs GHS 7,000 to be able to buy more items to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy one bale of secondhand bed sheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lilian Wangui

texts.en:
For five years, Lilian has been running a boutique in the Nairobi business center, where there is a flow of customers, earning a profit margin of KES. 26,600 per month. She is 26 years old, married to Joseph, and they have one child.

Lilian has successfully paid back her previous loans on time. This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD and she intends to buy ladies' and children's clothes for sell.

She will save the extra profit and open another business. She hopes to be a prominent business lady within and outside the country. Lilian is active and very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy ladies' and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Glevis Grisel

texts.es:
Glevis es una joven madre de familia de 19 años de edad es una joven dinámica, luchadora, emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante y de superarse día a día. Sus padres le dieron el apoyo para que ella pudiera estudiar y graduarse de perito mercantil y contador publico lastimosamente ella no pudo ejercer su profesión como tal ya que tomo la decisión de casarse a temprana edad y como ama de casa surgieron otras necesidades donde ya incluía una hija. Junto a su esposo decidieron buscar mejores oportunidades para salir adelante y vieron la necesidad en su pueblo de implementar un negocio el cual no tiene mucha competencia una repostería. Ella tiene enormes deseos de hacer otra actividad más que ser una ama de casa su esposo es graduado de su misma profesión como Perito Mercantil y Contador Público y actualmente trabaja en FUDEINFA brazo técnico de la cooperativa COMIXMUL como asesor de proyectos donde los ingresos que el gana son para poder llevar lo necesario a la casa. Juntos vieron la necesidad de que uno de los dos tenía que ver la forma de generar un poco mas de ingresos por lo que se le presento a Glevis la oportunidad de poder sacar un curso de repostería impartido por la institución (FUDEINFA) y que gracias a la cooperativa aprendió a valerse de una forma distinta.

Glevis actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de una vitrina, ollas, Cazuelejas, espátulas, batidora,  para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes los cuales son vecinos, amistades familiares y demás que han ayudado a que su producto se vuelva popular.  

Glevis es una joven con muchas habilidades y eso le ha permitido tener sueños, esperanzas de formar su pequeña micro-empresa para generar mas ingresos y poder ayudar a su esposo con la canasta básica, poder tener para su hija un ahorro que pueda ayudar con sus estudios y demás necesidades que se presenten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Glevis is a young mother of a family. She is 19 years old. She is a dynamic, hard-working, and entrepreneurial young woman with a great desire to advance and better herself every day. Her parents gave her support so that she could study and graduate as a certified public accountant. Unfortunately, she was not able to practice her profession as such since she made the decision to marry at an early age, and as a homemaker, other needs arose, including a daughter. Along with her husband, they decided to look for better opportunities to advance, and they saw the need in their town to set up a business that does not have much competition, a confectionery. She has a great desire to have another activity beyond being a homemaker. Her husband is a graduate from the same course in public accounting, and he now works in FUDEINFA, a technical branch of the COMIXMUL cooperative, as an evaluator of projects, where the income that he earns brings the necessities to their home. Together they saw the need that one of the two had to see a way of generating a little more income, and so the opportunity was presented to Glevis to take a course in confectionery given by the FUDEINFA institution, and thanks to the cooperative, she learned to manage in a different way.

Glevis is now applying for assistance to buy a display case, pots, casseroles, spatulas, and a mixer in order to give better service to her customers, who are neighbors, family friends, and others who have helped her products to become popular. 

Glevis is a young woman with many abilities, and this has allowed her to have dreams and hopes of forming her little micro-business to generate more income and be able to help her husband with the family basics, in order to have some savings for her daughter that can help her with her schooling and other necessities that present themselves in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a display case, pots, casseroles, spatulas, and a mixer to make bread

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 40-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a high-traffic business area, and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale business of selling vegetables and fruits within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 34 years old and a married mother of four. She and her husband and children live in Kisauni, Kenya, in a rental house with both water and electricity. All her children are in school and therefore her major monthly expenditure is school fees. She owns a food cafe where she prepares and sells food, a business she has been doing for two years and has been successful.

Bahati has asked for a loan amounting to 20,000 KSH to buy food ingredients, sacks of potatoes, and bunches of bananas. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, sacks of potatoes, and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is 27 years old. For the last two years, he has earned a living by operating a general store in Malindi. He earns a monthly income of KES. 12,000 from the business. 

Kahindi was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES. 35,000, to buy additional stock for his store such as fruit, soft drinks, sweets, some stationery, and cooking oil to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to expand the business to a well established retail shop in the area and help pay school fees for his nephew as well.

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit, soft drinks, sweets, some stationery and cooking oil

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a general store and a beauty salon  where she provides hair services, sells household items and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to expand her businesses within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for the salon

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from Kisauni Kenya. She is a single client of 28 years of age, who lives with her cousin in Kisauni.
She owns a small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. She established this business four years ago. She has built good experience in this field and she is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.
She is requesting a loan amounting to ksh.10000 loan to stock her store with sacks of potatoes and soft drinks. She hopes these will increase her profits, so she will be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock her store with sacks of potatoes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a resident of Katembe in the Isingiro district. She is aged 38 years with 5 children all of whom are in school. She lost her husband 2 years ago. Since then she is the only one taking care of the family in terms of paying the tuition fees for children and meeting all their other basic needs. Unfortunately when her husband passed away the family had no income generating project except the banana plantation. This is used as a source of food and any surplus is sold to earn money for upkeep. Recently her plantation was attacked by a banana wilting disease. It is drying up and will make her family starve if she does not remedy the situation. She is requesting for a loan of 1,200,000 to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides to save her banana plantation. She is grateful that Ugafode is coming to her rescue at one of the moments she needs them most.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Sainjargal

texts.en: Mr. Sainjargal is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in a ger (a traditional Mongolian hut) in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife Battor, aged 36, is currently unemployed. Previously she had been working at a local tailoring service company and has gained lots of experience there. His son Zandangarav, aged 20, runs a taxi service with his father. Dorjnamjaa, aged 13, studies at a local school. Mr. Sainjargal has been running his taxi service in town since 2008. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000MNT to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory for his wife to start a tailoring service at home. His family members are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory for his wife to start a tailoring service at home

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Victoria nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde las miembros se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Irene, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empandas, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien ya que sus comidas son muy aceptadas porque ella tiene muy rica sazón.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtirse con los productos de primera necesidad para hacer sus alimentos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The committee "La Victoria" was born through the administration and support of another committee that is working in the same place. This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo, where the members have set as their principal objective the growth of each one of them.

Señora Irene, the president of the group, is an entrepreneurial and innovative woman, and she relates that she makes food such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items. She says that it is going very well for her, since her food is very well received because she creates very delicious flavors.

She is applying for this loan to be able to stock up on the basic products to make her foods. She is grateful for the opportunity to advance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and other items

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Siguatepeque junto a su esposa. Carlos, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la producción de café y también a la cría y destazo de cerdos.  Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero y es por 25,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su finca y va comprar alimento para los cerdos. Su meta es ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He and his wife live in the town of Siguatepeque.

For the past four years, Carlos has been producing coffee and also raising pigs for butchering. The items that he produces are sold at the local market. The loan he is requesting is his third transaction and is in the amount of 25,000 HNL. The proceeds will be used to buy fertilizers so that he can maintain his farm. He will also buy feed for his pigs.

His goal is to help his children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat in bulk that he can grind and sell.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Doña Olga, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, ella vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace varios años ella obtuvo un puesto en el mercado local de la ciudad para vender verduras y frutas como tomate, cebolla, yuca, brócoli, chile, papas, repollo, jilotes, piña, melón, bananos etc.  Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de verduras y mantener dinero disponible para comprar a mejor precio.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para obtener ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Olga is 53 years old and a single mother of three children who already independent. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Several years ago, she obtained a stand at the local market in the city where she now sells fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, cassava, broccoli, chile peppers, potatoes, cabbage, corn, pineapple, melons, bananas, and other types of produce. She decided to request a second loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock with more vegetables and keep some money available for when she can buy at the best price.

Her goal is to continue working so that she can generate more income to provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy all types of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 58, is married and the mother of six children who are all in school. For the past eight years she has run a store. She started it with her own money which she had saved from her previous work. Little by little she has invested in her store. She says that business has been going very well. She makes a profit every day and has regular customers.

Agnes is applying for a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy rice, sugar, beans, soap, beverages and bags of wheat flour with the objective of adding more products to her inventory. She hopes to increase sales and so make more in profits.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell in her store.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha,  tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro sula junto a sus hijos y su madre.  Hace un año ella ha decidido por tener su propio negocio donde elabora y vende pastelitos de harina de maíz rellenos con carne, baleadas, donas y otras golosinas. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en su colonia y a sus alrededores. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para comprar harinas, manteca, azúcar y otros insumos. Ella espera mejorar el servicio al cliente con esta inversión. Tiene como plan seguir trabajando para crecer con el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha, age 38, is single because she is a widow. She has three children and lives with them and her mother in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

One year ago, Martha decided to start her own business of making and selling cornmeal turnovers filled with meat. She also prepares “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito), donuts, and other snacks. Martha conducts her sales as a street vendor in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 5,000 HNL and will be used to buy flour, lard, sugar, and other supplies. With this investment, she hopes to improve the service she provides to her customers. Her plan is to continue working so that she can grow her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, sugar, and other supplies used in making her dishes.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger in Bayanhongor Province. Her husband, Otgondalai, 24, is a herder and cares for their livestock. Her son, Togtohbayar, who is two and her one-year-old daughter, Monhnasan, stay home with their mother. Gereltuya is a hardworking, modest and diligent woman.

Since 2008 Gereltuya has been working as a seamstress in a local company. During this time she had her children and is now starting her own sewing business at home. She is applying for a 1,200,000 MNT loan from XacBank to buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.name: Missael

texts.es: Missael, tiene 26 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Siguatepeque. Missael se ha dedicado a la agricultura y hace 6 años el tiene su propia finca de café. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido por solicitar un segundo préstamo el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo de café y obtener mayor producción. Su meta es lograr una superación familiar.
texts.en:
Missael is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the town of Siguatepeque.

Missael is a farmer who has managed his own coffee plantation for the past six years. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market. He decided to request his second loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The proceeds will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers so that he can improve his coffee crop and obtain a larger harvest. His goal is for his family to be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. For the past five years she has sold clothes to help cover household expenses. Last year she started selling clothes on her own from her home. She is a hard worker with a good reputation and is well known in her area for her excellent customer service.

Today Mariam is applying for a 800 USD Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new collection of clothes as well as various accessories, perfume and makeup so as to increase her income and develop her business as much as she can.

Mariam hopes to keep on expanding her business as much as she can so she can afford to open her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes as well as various accessories, perfume and makeup to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 39 años de edad luchadora y con muchos deseos de superación madre soltera y tiene dos pequeños hijos que están en la escuela los cuales dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Sus padres de escasos recursos no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de seguir estudiando en la secundaria por lo cual ella tiene una educación primaria completa. Elsa tiene casa propia que le dejo el padre de sus hijos ya que el la abandono ella es madre soltera no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos sus padres le dieron de herencia una propiedad en la cual cultiva café para que ella pudiera sostenerse y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos mismos que le enseñaron al cultivo y mantenimiento de este producto. Ella ya tiene veintinueve años de dedicarse al cultivo de café siendo la única fuente de ingresos que ella tiene ademas de ser ama de casa sus cultivos están frente a su casa de habitación por lo cual le permite estar pendiente de su siembra.

Elsa solicita ayuda para invertir una parte del efectivo en la compra de fertilizante, abono y equipo de fumigación para su cultivo de café y la otra parte para invertirla en la compra de 1,000 plantas de café ya que este año tuvo que talar parte de su cultivo debido a que le dio la enfermedad de la roya que acabo con una parte de su cultivo. 

Su sueño es educar a sus dos hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y un mejor nivel de educación para que ellos puedan ser hombres de provecho y puedan heredar la tierra que hoy en día trabaja su madre.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 39-year-old determined woman with great wishes of getting ahead. She is an unmarried, mother of two small children, who are in school and who depend on her in all aspects. Her parents, of limited resources, couldn't give her the opportunity to continue studying in secondary school so she completed a primary education.

Elsa has her own house which the father of her children left her as he abandoned her. She is a single mother who doesn't have the support of the father of the children. Her parents gave her a property as inheritance which she grows coffee so that she could support herself and give her children a better education, and she taught them to cultivate and maintain this product.

She has been growing coffee for twenty-nine years which is the only source of income she has, in addition to taking care of the house. Her crop is located in front of her house which allows her to keep an eye on her crop.

Elsa is requesting help to invest a part of the cash for the purchase of fertilizer, manure, and fumigation equipment for her coffee crop and the other part to invest in the purchase of 1,000 coffee plants since this year she had to cut down part of the crop due to blight disease that destroyed a part of the crop. 

Her dream is to educate her two children so that they have a better quality of life, better opportunities of employment and a better level of education so that they can be resourceful men and can inherit the land that nowadays their mother works.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and fumigation equipment for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 26 años, es una mujer muy jovial alegre y trabajadora, es soltera , no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus hermanos  en la casa de su madre.La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, azúcar,entre otros a su vez vende diversos productos de limpieza, su negocio esta instalado en su hogar y desde alli  atiende a su clientes . Se inició hace tan solo 1 año gracias al apoyo de su familia.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad que necesita para realizar otras funciones laborales donde perciba algún dinero extra, tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliando su bodega ofreciendo a sus clientes mayor variedad de artículos que ellos demandan.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche , entre otros. A su vez se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que le brinda MFP para continuar con sus sueños.
texts.en: Rosa is 26 years old. She is a very cheerful, happy, and hard-working woman. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her siblings in their mother's house. The activity that Rosa does is sell groceries like rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, among other things. She sells diverse cleaning products. Her business is located in her home, and from there she tends to her customers. She started only a year ago thanks to the support of her family. She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and have the tranquility that she needs to do other work where she perceives some extra money. She has plans to continue growing and expanding her store, offering a better variety of items for her customers that they demand. For this opportunity, she is requesting 800 soles for the purchase of groceries in bulk like rice, sugar, eggs, milk, among others. She feels grateful for the financial support that MFP provides to continue with her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase home goods.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and married. She is from Kisauni, Kenya. She has two children; both live at home and are still in school. Her major monthly expenditure is payment of school fees. She owns a retail shop where she sells home-use goods, a business she has been doing for the last four years.

She has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bundles of wheat flour and sacks of maize flour and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour and sacks of maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de 26 años de edad ,es soltera y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia la cual compro con su ex pareja .Ella se dedica a  la  venta de comida, refrescos, hamburguesas y pasteles. La preparación de todos estos potajes lo realiza en la casa de su madre ya que se encuentra  más cerca a su puesto de venta. Su principal clientela se concentra en los trabajadores de construcción  razón por la cual tiene  una cantidad específica de platos , los cuales entrega  diariamente, cuando no hay alguna faena cerca va en busca de ellas hacia otra zonas alejadas para continuar realizando su trabajo, de esta forma asegura sus ventas y sus ganancias económicas. Trabaja en esta labor mas de 2 años.Se inició con un préstamo que le otorgó su madre quien también se dedica a este negocio, ella la animó mostrándole la rentabilidad que obtenía semanalmente, inicialmente atendía a pocas personas pero sus ventas se fueron incrementando razón por la  cual decidió continuar con su negocio, ahora espera que su negocio continúe prosperando para que sus ahorros se incrementen y cuando tenga el monto necesario pueda instalar un pequeño restaurante. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de diversos utensilios como vasos, cucharas, tenedores, envases descartables, ollas e ingredientes para la cocina tales como arroz, verduras, condimentos, aceite, frutas y azúcar que le sirven para la preparacion de las comidas.
texts.en:
Susana is a single 26 year old mother of one.  She lives with her 7 year old son in a home which she purchased with her ex-husband.  She makes a living selling food, beverages, hamburgers, and pastries.  She prepares all her dishes in her mother's home as it is near her location.  Her main customers are construction workers which is why she prepares certain dishes which she sells daily.  When there are no workers in her area she searches in other zones so she can continue to work and therefore ensures the sale of her products. 

She has been doing this for over two years.  It started with a loan from her mother who also does this for a living.  Her mother showed her the potential for profits in this business.  Initially, she had few customers but they kept increasing and she decided to continue with her business.  She now hopes that her business keeps thriving so that she can increase her savings.  When she has enough saved up she wants to open a small restaurant.  In this instance, she is seeking 1500 PEN to purchase a variety of utensils like cups, spoons, forks, disposable containers, pots, and ingredients like rice, vegetables, condiments, oil, fruit, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known areas in Montserrado County, Liberia.  She is 27 years old, lives in her parents’ house, and has a 4-month-old child who is looked after by her mother. 

For the past 4 years she has been selling used clothes and making local soap.  She is busy working eight hours on her business and this makes her proud, just like those working in bank offices.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and making a profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes, caustic soda, oil, and wood for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes, caustic soda, oil, and wood for her business.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada en el departamento de León, donde cuenta con empresas productora como es la Yesera aquí es donde habita la joven Aura Lila. 

Aura lila se Llama la joven de 49 años es nacido y criada en este bello municipio con buenos costumbre y amor al trabajo que desde muy pequeña ha sido luchadora por su vida, costumbre heredadas de sus padres.  

Se dedica a brindar sus servicios laborales en uno de las empresas ubicada en este municipio, sus rendimiento han sido bueno, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, pero es de gran importancia brindarle un mejor techo donde vivir. 

Debido a toda estas condiciones de vida que está enfrentando le dio la necesidad de solicitar un crédito con Kiva Y Ceprodel Para elaboraciones de Zin, Madera y Pago de Mano de obra.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful city that is located in the Department of León. This is where many production companies, such as Yesera, are located. This is also where Aura Lila makes her home.

Aura Lila is 49 years old and was born and raised in this beautiful city. She developed good habits and a love of her work at a very young age. Aura Lila has been a fighter her entire life since she inherited this quality from her parents. She provides her services to one of the companies located in this city and her job performance has been good.

Aura Lila has three children under her care, so it is of great importance that she provides them with better living conditions. Faced with this need, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL in order to buy zinc, wood, and also to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy zinc, wood, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 45-year-old widow with five children, ages 22, 20, 14, 5, and 2 years old.  She operates a boutique shop in Narok, Kenya and has been running the business for 20 years.  She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She has borrowed a second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD to purchase more clothing for her business.  The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, está casada con Pablo con quien tiene 3 hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia , la cual es fruto de todo su esfuerzo.Julieta tiene como actividad principal la venta de abarrotes en general,tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, accesorios del hogar, bebidas entre otros. Su bodega está instalada en su hogar la cual está ubicada en una zona estratégica de su cuadra. Lleva ya 4 años con este negocio, trabaja generalmente sola y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos .Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene gran cantidad de clientes interesados en su productos . Julieta tiene muchas ganas de expandir su negocio y a la vez  convertirse en una gran empresaria de la región por esta razón solicitará S/. 1200 soles para la compra de abarrotes como huevos , verduras , arroz , entre otros y  a su vez  agradece a todos los que hacen posible este crédito para continuar con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Julieta, age 34, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married to Pablo and they have three children (ages 15, 8, and 6). They live together in their own home, which they acquired as a result of all of their efforts.

Julieta’s main business activity is selling groceries such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, household accessories, beverages, and other items. Her store is located in her home, which is situated in a strategic section of her city block. She has already been in business for four years and generally works alone, but on some occasions she will receive help from her children. Julieta enjoys her work since it allows her to devote time to other household activities. Her business generates good earnings since she always has a large number of customers who are interested in her products.

Julieta has the drive to expand her business and turn it into a successful enterprise in her area. For this reason, she is requesting 1,200 PEN in order to buy grocery products such as eggs, vegetables, rice, and other items. In return, she would like to thank everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue pursuing her goals.

loans.use: to buy various household and cooking products.

loans.name: Tsagaantsooj

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsagaantsooj is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 3 children in Uvs, Mongolia.  Her sons, Tumen-Olzii (21) and Tuvshinjargal (23), are university students and her daughter, Bat-Undrah, is a secondary school student.  Mrs. Tsagaantsooj has been planting fruit trees on her land and growing organic vegetables.  Her sons help her to take care of the vegetables and trees.  She also operates a small grocery store where she sells her organic products.  

She is now requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more land where she can plant more trees and produce more organic fruits to sell.  She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase land for planting trees.

loans.name: Dúo El Cariño Group

texts.es: Dúo el Cariño, este Dúo esta integrado por la señora Elsa Magdalena, ella tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de delantales tipicos y blusas, lleva años de dedicarse a esta actividad y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: The group named “Dúo el Cariño” includes Sra. Elsa Magdalena.  She is 46 years old and spends her time making and selling traditional aprons and blouses.  Elsa has been in this business for years.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials for making her woven goods.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional woven goods.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a 38-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya with her husband and their child who is 16 years old and goes to Bamburi High school. They live in a rental house with both water and electricity. She owns and operates a grocery where she sells onions, bananas, watermelon, potatoes, kale, cabbage and oranges. She has been running this business for three years.

She has requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy sacks of onions and potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 39 years old and supports seven people. James runs a small scale farming business and a retail shop. He has been in these businesses for the last two years and his monthly income from the businesses is KES 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs for this year's planting season and a few items for his retail shop like wheat flour and sugar.
 
He plans to use the additional income to invest back into the business and to purchase farm machinery.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar to sell and to  buy farm inputs for use on his farm.

loans.name: Yondonpil

texts.en: Mr. Yondonpil is 53 years old and lives with his wife and nephew in a ger in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife Enhtuvshin, age 45, helps her husband to run his firewood and charcoal sales business in the local market. The borrower's children are all married and live separately. His nephew is a university student. The borrower purchases charcoal from a mining site and sells it to local customers for a higher price. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay his nephew's university tuition fee for the next academic semester. He is a hardworking, talkative and open-minded person.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's university tuition for next semester

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in the communications business for five years. He has an international calls office, which is highly requested in his region, since almost all of the local citizens need this service to call their children and relatives abroad.

He also sells mobile phones accessories to increase his daily income. Kassem is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase his mobile phones accessories stock with a newly released collection.

Kassem hopes to keep on expanding his business by starting to sell mobile phones soon.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones accessories

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 44 years old. She lives in the Sagarejo district with her husband and five children. Mzia receives a pension from the local government as she has many children. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is small monthly salaries earned by Mzia’s husband and her eldest son, who works locally as a shepherd. Besides this, they own two donkeys and transport wood from the forest to sell among their villagers. The income is hardly enough for food for a seven-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the Subsistence Poor category. 

Mzia requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program aims to provide business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions, to the country’s rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit she received, Mzia will purchase stocks of basic groceries for starting up a small grocery store. She will sell the products with a price mark-up and this will increase the family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the large family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of basic groceries for starting up a small grocery store

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 43 years old and lives in Kakamega County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Elizabeth and they are blessed with two children whose ages are 12 and 15 years old, respectively.

Jacob owns a posho mill and is a small-scale farmer. He has been doing these businesses for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 40,000. He repaid his previous loan successfully and is now taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm equipment and to purchase dry maize for milling. 

He will use the anticipated profit to purchase another posho mill to generate more income. His dream is to become a successful farmer and provide a stable future for his dependants.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment and dry maize for milling

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a 43-year-old woman with three children living in Kisauni, Kenya. She owns and operates a retail shop along with farming as an additional source of income. She lives in her own house with electric power and tapped water.

She has requested a loan of KSH 10,000 and intends to use the loan to buy sacks of maize flour, sugar, salt and bathing soap to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, salt and bathing soap to sell.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is a 22-year-old proactive farmer from Sisian town. He lives with his parents who receive a retirement pension. Despite his young age, Andranik is the only breadwinner in the family. He runs a farm, which currently includes 4 cows, 10 sheep, 2 mother pigs, 4 little pigs, 50 chickens and 10 turkeys. He also owns a plot of agricultural land where apple, nut and apricot trees are grown. Andranik is a very hardworking young man who works hard to cover his parent's daily needs. As agricultural is Andranik's only source of income he would like to expand it.

Andranik has applied for this loan to purchase 30 sheep. This will enable him to gather more agricultural income and ensure a better life for his parents.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheep

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 13 years old. He describes himself to be a faithful man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items. His business is located at a busy and potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the language barrier with customers who buy from him. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy household items to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 31 years old and live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children ages 7, 12, and 19 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. For years, she been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. One problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, fufu (fufu is made out of cassava), cold water, pepper, fish, meat and charcoal for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fufu, cold water, pepper, fish, meat and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
