Jesca is a 46-year-old married lady. She has children whose ages range from 15 years to 9 months old. She sells clothes in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is now applying for a second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more new clothes to sell.  

The profits she earns will be used to purchase more stock of clothes to sell. Her dream is to educate her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be an energetic and ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items. Her business is located in a suitable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She managed to pay a loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined and strong. Victoria operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Plimus

texts.en: Plimus is an aged man married to a hard working woman who does farming, especially growing plantain, a major economic activity in the area where they live. The main challenge this year has been banana wilt, a worm that attacked the plantains. Now the plantains are poor quality. The remedy was to cut down the affected areas so they do not spread the disease to other plantains. This has left them with limited resources to support the family. He will use this particular loan to buy fertilizers for the young plantains that have been planted where the affected ones were uprooted. They think they will be able to grow faster with the help of organic fertilizers. In the photo is Plimus and his wife.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 27 years old and single. She is a poultry farmer raising indigenous chickens. The products she gets i.e. eggs and meat, she sells to the local residents and business people. Her business is now one year old and she is getting an income of KES 12,000.

She is now servicing her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this loan to purchase more chicks to raise and sell later at a profit.  

The amount she gets as profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to have an alternative source of income.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantuya is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband Tomorchodor, aged 38, works at a local mining company as a driver. Her son Buman-Ayush, aged 12, goes to a local school and her daughter Bumandari, aged 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Mrs. Gantuya has been running her butcher shop for 15 years at a rental counter of a local market. She has built a close relationship with her customers and suppliers. She purchases organic meat products from herders to sell to local customers. She is now requesting MNT 2,000,000 to purchase large amounts of organic meat products from herders to sell to local customers. She is a hard-working, open-minded and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic meat products from herders to sell to local customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 40 años de edad felizmente casada y de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella el cual esta estudiando en la escuela ya que los otros con el esfuerzo impuesto por ella y su esposo pudieron prepararlos pudiendo sacarlos de la secundaria. Maria tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el 3 grado ella no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando. Ella y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz, frijoles y café por mas de 14 años producto que es comercializado y vendido en pequeña escala en el mercado local, y con los vecinos. Sus padres dedicados desde toda una vida fueron los que le enseñaron esta actividad y sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie y que gracias a esto les permite dar la asistencia técnica posible y llevar un monitoreo y cuidado de su cultivo. La tierra que maría trabaja es propia y le agradece a DIOS por eso y por todo lo que a diario le da.

Hoy en día maría solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abonos para su cultivo de café de esta manera ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia a su cultivo y por medio de esta ayuda lograra que su cosecha sea mas productiva y sana.

Sus metas y sueños son poder incrementar sus cultivos de esa forma obtendría mas ingresos para su hogar y su familia pudiendo seguir ayudando con los gastos de la canasta básica a su esposo, pero como prioridad lograr que su ultimo hijo se pueda también preparar como sus hermanos y pueda tener una mejor educación, mejores oportunidades de empleo y ser mejor cada día.
texts.en:
María, 42, is happily married and has six children, one of whom is still in school and depends on her.  She and her husband worked hard so their other children could finish high school.  María has a third grade education because her parents could not afford to continue supporting her.  María and her husband are crop farmers, growing basic grains such as corn, beans and coffee, which they have been selling for 14 years on a small scale at the local market and to neighbors.  Their parents were crop farmers all their life and taught them the trade.  Their farmland is two kilometers from their house, and they walk to work every day to care for and supervise the crops.  María owns her land and is thankful to God for everything she has.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her coffee crop so she can give it proper care and obtain a healthy, productive harvest

Her goals are to increase crop production so she can earn more income for the household and the family.  She wants to continue helping her husband with main expenses, but her youngest son is her top priority.  She wants him to follow in his sibling's footsteps to get a good education so he will have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Steffany

texts.es: Steffany, tiene 28 años edad , es soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo y su madre ya que ambos son el motor de su vida.El trabajo de Steffany consiste básicamente en brindar servicio de elaboración de planos, asesoramiento logístico, elaboración de perfil de obras, ejecución de proyectos y otros. Su trabajo es independiente y en horarios libres dependiendo de la disponibilidad de clientes. Tiene en su casa una computadora en donde trabaja arduamente cuando tiene algún contrato, ahí puede pasar muchas horas concentrada en brindar un buen resultado para sus clientes. Afortunadamente, asegura que los clientes con los que ha trabajado hasta ahora se han sentido satisfechos con su trabajo . Lleva en esta actividad 4 años y se siente muy bien haciendo lo que mas le gusta.Le esta yendo muy bien en esta labor ya que es bien remunerada , al principio le fue complicado abrirse camino en este rubro, sin embargo su tenacidad y esmero le permitieron seguir adelante.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de una computadora nueva y asi poder seguir elaborando los planos que le solicitan sus clientes a su vez  agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito y por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Steffany, 28, is single and has an eight-year-old son.  She lives in her own house with her son and mother, who are her motivation in life.  Steffany earns a living providing services, including blueprint drawings, logistic consulting, preparation of construction details, projects, etc.  She works independently and her schedule depends on the availability of her clients.  At home she has a computer that she uses when she has a contrac; and she can spend much time there to give her clients the best service she can.  

Fortunately, the clients she has had to date have all been satisfied with her work.  She has been in business for four years and enjoys what she does.  It is a well-paid job and going well.  At first it was hard for her to get involved in this sector, but because of her tenacity and careful work she was able to get ahead.  

Now she is requesting 2,000 PEN to buy a new computer so she can continue producing drawings for her clients.  She is grateful for the opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanical farming equipment.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru: Дилдоре 30 лет. Она является одной из таких женщин, которая стоя бок с боком мужем упорно работает для благо получения семьи. Дилдора замужем за хорошего и доброго человека и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще не трудоспособные. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Дилдора решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей золотых изделий, так как золото является прибыльным бизнесом. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  15000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dildora is 30 years old. She is one of the women who stands by her husband and works hard for the wellbeing of their family. Dildora is married to a good and kind man and have two children. Their children are not working yet. Her husband receives a small salary. This salary is not enough to support the family with everything they need. Dildora has decided to help her husband and well being of their family. With this goal she has taken a course in Achieve Success organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to start her business buying and selling gold jewelry because gold is a profitable business. She plans to improve her living conditions with the received profit. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 somoni to buy goods to start her new business. She looks forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for a new business.

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela, de 32 años de edad, esta casada con Horacio quien es comerciante y padre sus 2  hijos. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron  a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. La actividad que realiza Gissela es la venta de zapatos femeninos de marcas reconocidas y que gozan de la preferencia de su clientela, compra por catálogo a precios cómodos y los vende incrementando un monto adicional al precio original para que pueda tener cierto margen de ganancias. También vende ropas variadas para damas, caballeros y niños. Toda su mercadería la obtiene mensualmente comprando al por mayor en otra ciudad. Realiza sus ventas en su hogar entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, vende al contado pero en ocasiones también lo hace a crédito. Se inició hace 5 años en este negocio y lo hace sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que obtiene muy buenas ganacias.Su prioridad a corto plazo es tener una tienda de zapatos y prendas de vestir con todos los implementos necesarios.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles para la compra de zapatos femeninos y sandalias que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado a su vez se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que tendrá para avanzar con su negocio razón por la cual se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Gissela, 32, is married to Horario, a merchant, and they have two children.  They live comfortably in their own home which they bought with a lot of effort and dedication.  Gissela runs a business selling women's brand name shoes and her clientele prefers her over the competition.  She sells by catalogue at good prices, after adding in her profit margin.  She also sells women's, men's and children's clothing.  She buys all the merchandise wholesale in another city on a monthly basis, and sells by going door-to-door, visiting freinds, neighbors and relatives.  She sells both in cash and on credit.

Gissela began her business five years ago and works alone.  She feels her work is very profitable.  Her short-term goal is to open a shop where she can sell shoes, clothing and accessories.  On this occasion she is requesting 3,000 PEN to buy women's shoes and sandals which are in high demand.  She is grateful for this financial support which will help her get ahead in her business, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada a 90 Km del departamento de León, donde existen diferente tipos de actividades comerciales.  

Felix se llama el Joven de 45 años de edad donde habita con su esposa en este bello municipio, tiene buenas costumbres, sus principales sueños es vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 
 
Se dedica brindar servicio en uno de los centros educativo, hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel Y Kiva piensa en el desarrollo de las personas emprendedoras como es el caso de este joven, de tal forma le está solicitando a que le brinden un financiamiento, para la compra de un mini componente.

Esto sería de mucho beneficio después de llegar un día cansada de su trabajo a su vivienda seria de mucha importancia para mantenerse informada en las noticias y divertirse un poco. 

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful city located 90 Km from the department of León, where there are different kinds of business activities.

Felix, 45, lives with his wife in this beautiful municipality, and his greatest goal is to provide a better lifestyle for his family.  He works for an educational center and found out that Ceprodel and Kiva can help young entrepreneurs, such as himself.  He is requesting a loan to buy a stereo system which would be beneficial to him after a long day's work.  It would give him access to news and entertainment.

He is grateful to KIVA and Ceprodel for this small loan which will help improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a stereo system.

loans.name: Jose Wilson

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santo Domingo, vive José, un hombre de 31 años, se separó hace poco de su esposa con quien tuvo 2 hijos y a quienes tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios para que un día se conviertan en profesionales y obtengan el título que él nunca pudo tener debido a que los reducidos recursos económicos de sus  padres solo alcanzaron para que José termine la primaria.  
Don José reside exactamente en la Parroquia de Río Verde y es conocido por sus vecinos como una persona honesta y emprendedora, tiene varios años de experiencia como comerciante y vendedor, ya que trabajó desde muy joven en varios negocios pequeños de la ciudad. 
Aprovechando que Santo Domingo es el puerto que une a las Regiones Costa y Sierra del Ecuador, varias personas han establecido negocios de todo tipo para conseguir los ingresos que sirven mantener los gastos del hogar. Es el caso de José que desde hace 6 años emprendió con la venta de víveres y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda ubicada en un lugar estratégico, cerca de escuelas, hogares y parques donde sus clientes son niños, jóvenes y adultos que compran distintos productos.

Solicita su segundo crédito en Fundación Alternativa, en donde le han brindado la confianza y facilidades que necesita para que su negocio crezca, pues este crédito lo utilizará en productos surtidos y de todo tipo en diferentes cantidades para abastecer su tienda y así satisfacer la demanda que tienen sus clientes cuando lo visitan. Con este paso de crecimiento en su negocio, José demuestra que es posible salir adelante a pesar de lo que la falta de una educación completa implique. José espera superarse, que su negocio sea conocido en toda la ciudad, los vecinos y habitantes de la zona para que sus ingresos mejoren  y con ello,  el nivel económico de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 31,  lives in the town of Santo Domingo and is recently divorced from his wife.  He has two children who he must support and educate so they can become professionals one day.  He was unable to study because his parents could only afford an elementary education.

José lives exactly in the Río Verde Parish and is known among his neighbors as an honest, hard-working person.  He has several years' experience as a merchant and salesman and has worked in different businesses in the city since he was very young.

Taking advantage of the fact that Santo Domingo is the port that joins the Coastal Region and the Sierra of Ecuador, locals have established all kinds of businesses to support their families.  Such is the case of José who began his business six years ago.  He opened a grocery store selling basic goods, in a strategic location, near schools, homes and parks where his customers are children, youth and adults who buy different items.

He is requesting his second loan through Fundación Alternativa, where they have given him the confidence and facilities he needs to grow his business.  He will use this loan to buy a variety of products to stock his store and satisfy customer demand.  With this step toward business expansion, José is proving that he is able to get ahead despite having an incomplete education.  José wants to be successful and become popular in the city among neighbors and local people, so he will earn more income and improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand his grocery store.

loans.name: Ludgarda

texts.es: Ludgarda, de 58 años,es soltera y vive en su casa propia construida para albergar a 6 de sus 12 hijos y sus nietos, convive con 14 personas en su morada de material noble. La actividad laboral que Ludgarda desarrolla es la venta de prendas de vestir de diferentes modelos, tamaños y colores. De manera periódica realiza la compra de su mercadería la misma que ofrece a los habitantes de los pueblos ribereños .Ofrece prendas de segunda mano como pantalones, polos, blusas, vestidos y otros. Trabaja sola en este rubro desde hace 15 años. Complementa esta función con la venta de productos orgánicos como miel de abeja, cortezas y resinas curativas. Le agrada mucho trabajar vendiendo prendas de vestir porque le permite conocer nuevos clientes y generar sus propios ingresos , por esta razón desea abrir una tienda de ropa y consolidarse de manera segura en el mercado.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de prendras de vestir tales como blusas , camisas, pantalones , polos entres otros .Actualmente está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante .
texts.en: Fifty-eight year old Ludgarda is single and lives in her own house, which was built to accommodate six of her twelve children and her grandchildren.  She lives with 14 people in her dwelling that is made of noble material.  Ludgarda makes a living selling different styles, colours and sizes of clothing items.  Every so often she buys her merchandise, which is the same as that which is sold in riverside towns.  She sells secondhand clothing, such as trousers, t-shirts, blouses, dresses and other items.  She has been doing this work on her own for 15 years.  She also works selling organic products such as honey and healing peels and resins.  Ludgarda very much enjoys working selling clothes because it lets her meet new customers and generate her own income.  Because of this she would like to open a clothes shop and become stronger in the market.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan pf 1500 Nuevo Soles to buy clothing items such as blouses, shirts, trousers, t-shirts, and more.  She is very grateful for the opportunity of a loan that she has be given, and for the financial support which she needs to move forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes for far away towns.

loans.name: Luis Margin

texts.es:
Achuapa un pequeño pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita el joven Luis Margin.

Luis Margin es un Padre responsable con sus dos hijos bajo su cargo, ambos a duras penas le está brindando una linda educación, pero también ve de gran Necesidad, mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita un financiamiento a Kiva Y Ceprodel para la compra de: Cemento, ladrillo y Arena, con esto cubriría parte de su necesidades de mejorar el pequeño techo y brindarle una mejor vida saludable a sus hijos. 

Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad al trabajo y su buen record crediticio que le han ido mejorando su vivienda. 

 Agradece a Dios por haberle iluminado de poder seguir Solicitando Crédito con Ceprodel y Kiva y espera que le brinden el pequeño financiamiento y poder cumplir con sus pequeños sueños que en su vida ha tenido.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a small town which has a number of different businesses in it and it is here that Luis Margin lives.

Luis Margin is a responsible father, with two children in his charge.  He is barely able to give them a good upbringing but it is now necessary to improve his home, so he is applying for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy cement, bricks and sand.  With this he will be able to cover the necessities of improving the small roof and giving his children a healthier life. 

Luis Margin is in good health. He is an honest worker and his good credit rating have helped him improve his home.

He thanks God for helping him to continue applying for loans with Ceprodel and Kiva and he hopes he will receive this small loan to help him with the small dreams he has had in his life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.name: Juan Aureliano

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una encantadora ciudad ubicada en el departamento de León, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive Juan Aureliano.  

Juan Aureliano se llama el Varón de 46 años de edad Luchador por su vida y la de sus dos hijos quienes con tanto sacrificio mantiene los gastos de colegiatura, pero son de sus grande sueño poderle dar un mejor techo donde estos jóvenes puedan vivir mejores condiciones de su vida. 

solicita un crédito a ceprodel, para la compra de: Arena, Cemento y Pago de mano de Obra, con esto ayudaría a mejorar su pequeño dormitorio donde habitan sus pequeñitos hijos. 

Agradece de todo corazón a Dios por haberle dado Esa iluminación de haberse encontrado con Kiva y Ceprodel, para que estos le brinden el apoyo que tanto necesita
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is an enchanting city located in the León department, a place full of enterprising people. This is where Juan Aureliano lives.

Juan Aureliano is this hardworking man’s name. He is 46 and fights for a better life for him and his two children. He pays for their studies and his biggest dream is to provide them with better housing conditions, so that they can have a better life.

Juan Aureliano is requesting a loan to CEPRODEL to buy sand and cement, and to pay for the labor needed to improve his children’s room.

He thanks God with all his heart for finding Kiva and CEPRODEL, which can give him all the support he needs so urgently.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Maria Elisabeth

texts.es:
Maria es casada tiene un hijo vive en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar con el esposo y con el hijo.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maiz en terrenos arrendados. El credito lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para cocechar un producto de calidad y vender a precio justo y tener utilizades.

Maria con el credito ha podido comprar lo que necesita para el cultivo de maiz, el sueño de maria es ahorra un poco de dinero  y salir de paseo a la playa ya que no ha tenido la oportunidad de conocer. En los momentos libre le leer historias romanticas.
texts.en:
María is married.  She has a son and lives in Chimbo in the Bolivar province with her son and husband.

María works in agriculture, sowing corn on rented land.  The loan she is applying for is to buy seeds, fertilisers and manure so as to sow a quality product that she will be able to sell for a fair price.

With the loan María can buy the necessary items to grow corn.  María's dream is to save a little money to go on a trip to the beach, as she has never been before.  In her spare time she likes to read romantic stories.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and manure.

loans.name: Dúo Vicion De Fe Group

texts.es: Dúo Vicion de Fe, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Haydee de 42 años de edad ella tiene ya 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, se siente muy contenta porque espera que por medio de Kiva ella pueda seguir con su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elaboracion de tortillas para la venta.
texts.en:
Vicion de Fe Duo

Haydee is a member of the Vicion de Fe Duo. She is 42 years old and has been making tortillas for three years. She is very happy because she hopes that through Kiva, she will be able to continue with her business. She has applied for this loan to buy corn to make tortillas, which she will then sell.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas for sale.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia, age 46, is engaged in a retail grocery business. She has been engaged in her venture for three years. Her husband is a farmer. They have four children. 

Lucrecia would like to increase the volume of her grocery inventory but does not currently have sufficient capital. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. The loan funds will be used to purchase grocery items such as cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles, soft drinks, and canned goods. She knows that by re-stocking her store she can attract more customers and provide better customer satisfaction.

Lucrecia will be thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles, soft drinks, and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has been engaged in the general store business for 12 years. She is thankful because her previous loan has had a great impact in increasing her sales.

She is doing her best to be successful in the business and is asking for a bigger capital of PHP25,000 to invests towards further development of her general store. She will use the loan in buying grocery items such as frozen foods, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods and autoload max (prepaid cell phone credits) for her general store.

She hopes for continuous access of loans so she can continue to obtain greater income, educate her three children, and sustain her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as  frozen foods, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods and autoload max (prepaid cell phone credits) for her general store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 34-year-old married entrepreneur. Their two children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in Kisauni, Kenya in a rental house with electric power and tapped water.
She owns and operates a grocery store. She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy sacks of potatoes and onions. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and and onions.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a hard working woman. She operates a farm and dairy stand where she sells maize, beans and milk. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a suitable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cows for expanding dairy farming. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cows to expand her dairy farm.

loans.name: Gerelmandah

texts.en: Mrs. Gerelmandah is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband Hurelsuh, age 43, works at a construction site as an assistant worker. Her daughters Davaajargal, age 20 and Davaajav, age 18 study at universities and her son Tuvshinbat, age 8, studies at a local primary school. Gerelmandah has been working in a local tailoring union since 2010. She is experienced and popular among her customers. She is now planning to start her own business at home taking orders from her regular customers and is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her tailoring business at home. She is a hardworking, diligent and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her tailoring business at home.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 37-year-old man married to Callence who is 28 years old, and they are blessed with two children whose are seven and three years old.
Alfred is a carpenter in Kakamega county. He has been a carpenter for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 4,700. His previous loan was paid back successfully and he is now applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase more finished woods for making chairs, tables and all sorts of furniture. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business so that the business can expand.
His dreams and hope is to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase finished wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Darwin Moises

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada en el departamento de León, donde cuenta con empresas productora como es la Yesera que ha sido de mucha importancia, ha generado empleo a todo los habitantes del municipio. 

Darwin Moisés es nacido y criado en este municipio con buenos costumbre y amor al trabajo que desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a sobrevivir con su propio Esfuerzo. 

 Se dedica a brindar sus servicios laborales en uno de las empresas ubicada en este municipio, sus rendimiento han sido bueno, pero por un problema de salud que presenta a tenido problema en su empeño, le dio la necesidad de solicitar un crédito con Kiva Y Ceprodel Para elaboraciones de exámenes y compra de medicamento, con esto ella considera que va a mejorar en su salud y va a obtener mejores rendimiento en su trabajo. 

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudara a mejorar la salud de su persona el buen empeño en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful city in the department of León. Many production companies are located here, such as Yesera, which has been very important in generating employment for the municipality's inhabitants.

Darwin Moisés was born and raised in this municipality. He has good habits and love for his work. Since he was young, he was taught to survive on his own efforts.

He makes a living providing his labor services in one of the companies in the municipality. His performance has been good, but due to a health problem he has had a problem with his work. This created a need to apply for a loan with Kiva and Ceprodel in order to carry out medical examinations and buy medicine. He believes that this will help him to improve his health, so that he will achieve a better performance at work.

He is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for their help with these small loans, which help improve people's health so they can put the proper effort into their work.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón, es un Pequeño Pueblo con muchas características de comercio, es aquí donde habita la joven Johana del Carmen. 

Johana se llama la Joven de 28 años de edad, luchadora por la vida es casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que su esposo gana en su trabajo mantiene en el sustento diario de su familia, pero son de sus sueños, brindarles un mejor techo a sus hijos.

Se le presente la oportunidad de conocer a Ceprodel y Kiva que estos ayudan este tipo de personas a través de pequeños financiamiento, viendo de gran Necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, solicita un crédito para la compra de: Cemento y arena, seria de sus grandes sueños darle un repello a las paredes, esto le da más seguridad en sus lindas vidas de su familia.  

Agradece a Dios todo poderoso por haber conocido a Kiva y Ceprodel ya que son de sus sueños que estos le financien el crédito para poder vivir en una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small town with many business activities. This is where Johana del Carmen lives.

Johana, 28, is a fighter in life. She is married with two children in her care. With what little her husband earns at work, she maintains her family with their daily sustenance, but she dreams of giving her children a better roof over their heads.

She had the opportunity to learn about Ceprodel and Kiva, organizations which help people like her through small loans. Due to a great necessity to improve her home, she has applied for a loan to buy cement and sand. It would be a dream for her to plaster her walls, which would give better security to the life of her beautiful family.

She thanks God for having been introduced to Kiva and Ceprodel because it is a dream for her to have been granted this loan, in order to be able to live in a better home.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en: Mr. Ganhuu is 49 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and stays home. His son Darhanbaatar, age 22 works as a electrician at rental place. Ganhuu has been drawing and painting pictures by order since 2000 at his home. He has gotten orders from the local court house and a kindergarten and needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase some tools and paints to meet the order and run his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who dreams about having his own business in his own workplace.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and paints to to complete his drawings and painting orders.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a single man. He describes himself to be a hardworking and trust worthy man. He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. His business is located in a suitable and viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil runs a farm. He keeps 12 little pigs and seven cows, cultivates potatoes and cucumbers, as well as grows peaches, apricots, cherries, and plum trees. He has been involved in agriculture for already five years. The family's sole financial income comes from agriculture so it is very important for Vasil to gather good harvest and get a high income. As Vasil has no financial means to expand his farm, he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Vasil will purchase three pigs, two bulls, forage for feeding the livestock, and potato seeds. This will significantly increase Vasil's agricultural income and will give him an opportunity to ensure better living conditions for his family. Vasil lives in Dashtavan village of Ararat region with his wife and 25-year-old son.
Vasil is 59-years-old, and he hopes that the loan will help him to expand his farm and live a better life.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs, two bulls, forage for feeding the livestock, and potato seeds.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 2 children that are 18 and 21 years old. She describes herself to be determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been doing this for 12 years. Her business is located along a busy street and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38-years-old and married to Charks. She comes from Vihiga in Kakamega county, which is located in western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family; she is blessed with three children whose ages are 10, five, and one years old. 

Ann sells cereals within the town of Vihiga; this her main source of income. She was introduced to KADET LTD by group members and took her first loan, which she repaid. She is now taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to boost her stock by purchasing beans, sorghum, and maize for sale.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.She has a dream of growing her business so as to help her husband to take care of their family.

loans.use: to purchase more of beans, maize, and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Charllote's Group

texts.en:
This is Charllote's group which is made up of five women. They sell the following products:  chicken meat, beef, plastic products, slippers, fish, cooking utensil and pork.

Charllote is a chicken, beef and pork meat seller with nine years of experience. She sells from morning to evening every day. This is her fifth loan with ID-Ghana and has repaid the previous loans without any difficulty.
She has been saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other half so that the savings have become her immediate back-up capital.
She is requesting a loan for GHS 1,200 to buy enough chicken meat, beef, and pork to sell to her customers.
The group needs a total of GHS 3,700 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy enough chicken meat, beef, and pork and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 29 years old and lives in the town of West Point which has one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is single and has a sixth grade student.
For six years she has sold plantain in the local Market. She enjoys the response of her customers and learned how to sell from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantain for her business. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plantain for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic and a molding machine for making fans.

loans.name: Angela Candelaria

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer de 59 años, ha aprendido a subsistir a pesar de la falta de empleo que su falta de educación le causó, pues por varias circunstancias solo pudo terminar la escuela primaria. Ahora viven en unión libre con su pareja Ramón de 57 años que lleva el sustento a su hogar gracias a su labor de agricultor y con quien tiene 6 hijos a quienes educaron y sostuvieron hasta que salieron de casa para ser independientes y trabajar por sí solos. En la actualidad Angela vive con su esposo en la Parroquia Río Verde del Cantón Santo Domingo  en Ecuador. Todos en la zona la conocen como una mujer emprendedora y esforzada que lucha cada día por sus sueños. 
Angela ayudaba a su esposo en la agricultura, pero la necesidad en su hogar fue creciendo y decidió emprender hace 16 años en el comercio de juegos de ollas y ropa casual. Ella aprendió la actividad del comercio en su tierra natal que es Calceta y es una ciudad pequeña que se caracteriza por ser bastante comercial. De hecho el obstáculo más grande que ella ha tenido es rehacer su vida en una nueva ciudad que ella no conocía pero en la cual fue muy bien recibida. Ahora ella solicita un préstamo para adquirir mercadería y realizar algunas adecuaciones a su casa esquinera en donde atiende para que llame la atención y las personas que le buscan recomendadas por sus clientes puedan localizarla más fácilmente. Angela realiza su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa gracias a la recomendación de su hija quien le hablo de la confianza y el apoyo que esta entidad brinda a los emprendedores de zonas vulnerables. Angela espera que con este préstamo sus ventas se incrementen y así poder ver su negocio convertido en una empresa comercial de excelencia que brinde lo necesario para tener una buena vejez a lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Angela is a 59 year old woman. She has learned to survive despite the lack of work caused by her lack of education. Due to various circumstances, she was only able to finish primary school. Now she lives in a common law marriage with her spouse, Ramón, who is 57. He supports the home with his work as a farmer and she has 6 children with him, whom they raised and supported until they left home to be on their own and work for themselves. Right now, Angela lives with her husband in the parish of Río Verde in the Santo Domingo canton of Ecuador. Everyone in the area knows her as an enterprising and hardworking woman who fights for her dreams every day. 
 
Angela helped her husband with the farming, but the need in the home grew and 16 years ago she decided to start selling sets of pots and casual clothes.  She learned about sales in her native home of Calceta. It is a small town characterized as being very commercial. In fact, the biggest obstacle she has had is starting her life over again in a new city that she wasn't familiar with, where she was very well received. Now she is asking for a loan to acquire merchandise and improve her corner house where she has her locale so it will get people's attention and the people who seek her out on her customers' recommendation can find her more easily. Angela is taking out her first loan with Fundación Alternativa thanks to the recommendation of her daughter, who told her about the trust and support that this entity gives entrepreneurs in vulnerable areas. Angela hopes that with this loan, her sales will increase and she can see her business become an excellent commercial business that gives her what she needs to have a nice old age at her husband's side.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and improve her locale to attract customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 47 años de edad, esta casada con Osias y con él tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente su casa propia la cual fue comprada a base de mucho esfuerzo.La actividad que realiza Judith es la venta de panes, quesos y jamonadas. Tiene 2  puestos de venta en un mercado cerca de su vivienda en donde ofrece a la venta estos productos. Su actividad empieza todos los días a altas horas de la mañana  con la entrega de productos de parte de sus proveedores. En ocasiones sus ventas son muy buenas ya que logra vender todo lo que ofrece durante el día. Trabaja desde hace 4 años con la ayuda de su hija y se inició en este negocio con un préstamo particular luego poco a poco logro incrementar sus ventas . Considera su negocio bastante rentable ya que obtiene buenas ganancias económicas .Por otro lado comenta que decidió iniciarse en  esta labor pensando en el bienestar de su familia .  Ahora espera abastecer sus dos puestos de venta con mayor cantidad de productos de panadería y más adelante consolidar un tercer puesto de venta. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles , está contenta de saber que tiene el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes.Con el monto solicitado comprará una mayor cantidad de panes, bizcochos, jamonadas, quesos y otros productos de panadería con los que abastecerá ambos puestos de venta.
texts.en: Judith is 47 years old. She is married to Osias and with him has 2 children. They live together comfortably in their own home that they bought with a lot of hard work. Judith's activity is selling bread, cheese and smoked meats. She has 2 sales booths in a market close to her home where she offer these products for sale. Her activity starts every day in the morning hours with the delivery of the products from the suppliers. Sometimes her sales are very good and she is able to sell everything she has for sale that day. She has worked for 4 years with her daughter's help and she started this business with a private loan and then little by little was able to increase her sales. She considers her business to be very profitable since she makes good earnings. She remarks that she decided to start this business thinking about her family's well being. Now she hopes to stock her two booths with a larger quantity of baked goods and in the future consolidate with a third booth. At this time, she will ask for a loan of S/. 2000 soles. She is happy knowing that she has financial support to go ahead with her plans. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy a larger quantity of breads, cakes, smoked meats, cheese and other baked goods to stock both booths.

loans.use: to buy bread, and cakes, among other things.

loans.name: Domtilla

texts.en:
Domtilla is a married woman. She has a child who is 16 years old. She describes herself to be a determined woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells  fruit. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Domtilla will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fruit  within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a forty-nine-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. For sixteen years she has been operating a restaurant business and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land, pay school fees for her children, and renovate her house. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University and see them work for reputable organizations. High cost of foods and price fluctuations affect the business while her plan is to have a hotel. Amina intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Four years ago she decided to set up a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as soda and sugar, among other things. After realizing that her husband alone could not provide all the basics, she decided to start her current business. Price fluctuation and high cost of rent affect her business, while her dream is to trade in wholesale.

Rose intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. She is a twenty-year-old single mother living in Kasese, Uganda.

After she became pregnant, her fiancé refused to take responsibility. She realized that the only way to support herself and the forthcoming baby was to have a daily source of income, so she set up a retail shop with her personal savings. She has been in the business for one year and with the income she has been able to meet medical expenses and rent a house. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her personal goal is building a permanent house to live in and her business goal is to diversify the business to include farming.

Joseline is requesting money to buy sugar, soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For seven years he has been trading in produce and the business is very lucrative. Customers not paying on time and insufficient supply due to unpredictable weather affect the business, while his dream is to own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. He started by selling two sacks a month but now sells over ten sacks in a month and is hopeful that he will be the leading supplier in the next two years.

Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree

loans.name: Ramiro José

texts.es:
Ramiro José es nacido y criado en el municipio de El Sauce con buenas costumbres, proveniente de una familia muy pobre, pero sí humilde, honrada y trabajadora.

Se dedicó desde muy joven a ofrecer sus servicios como profesor de primaria ya que le gusta enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños que son el futuro de Nicaragua.

 Actualmente trabaja en una comarca aledaña al municipio a 5 km de distancia el cual viaja en bicicleta a diario para estar puntual en la escuela donde la mayoría de los niños son de escasos recursos que muchas veces no tienen ni para un cuaderno.

Cabe señalar que le entristece ver a estos niños que tienen la voluntad de aprender a pesar de ser del campo pero muchas veces por las circunstancias de la vida no lo hacen.

Como padre e hijo trata de dar lo mejor y en este momento está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar medicina y realizarle unos exámenes médicos a su mamá que últimamente ha estado mal de salud.

Pide a los inversionistas Kiva que le financien este crédito a través de Ceprodel para que su mamá mejore, ya que con su bajo salario muchas veces no puede cubrir algunas necesidades.
texts.en:
Ramiro José was born and brought up in the district of El Sauce. He comes from a poor but humble, honourable and hard-working family.

Since he was young, he has been a primary school teacher as he loves teaching the children who are Nicaragua's future how to read and write.

At the moment he works in a neighbouring region which is 5km away so he goes by bike each day so that he arrives at the school on time. The majority of the children are from poor backgrounds who often don't even have enough to buy an exercise book.

He also notes that it makes him sad to see children from the countryside who want to study but who don't because of their circumstances. 

He tries to do his best both as a father and son. He is requesting finance to buy medicine and have some medical tests done for his mother who hasn't been well recently. 

He would like the Kiva investors to help him through Ceprodel so that his mum improves as he isn't able to meet these needs with his low salary.

loans.use: to buy medicine and have some medical tests done

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is a 49-year-old woman who lives in West Point; one of the most populous and best-known markets in Montserrado county, with her four children. She did not attend school; she is married. Three of her children are attending school. For the past 20 years, she has been selling "lappa" (fabric) from a table in the local market. Sometimes she experiences slow buying, but most of the time she realizes a profit and she uses her profit to sustain her family, She is requesting a loan to purchase more 'lappa' ( fabric) to expand her sales. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more 'lappa' ( fabric) to expand her sales

loans.name: Janga

texts.en:
Janga is 30 years old and lives in West Point one of the most populous and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She lives with her partner who is a mechanic and they have two children aged 3 and 13. Both live at home with her and attend school. 

For six years now, Janga has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale and has to buy retail which is much more expensive. She likes the interaction with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. Janga has requested a loan to purchase Vita, oil, salt, pepper, rice, fish, dry meat, chicken feet, and charcoal for her business. In the future, she would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase Vita, oil, salt, pepper, rice, fish, dry meat, chicken feet, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a forty-four-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Eleven years ago she decided to set up a stationary business with the help of her husband. She also runs a poultry project so as to earn extra income. High cost of rent and feeds affect her business, while her dream is to buy a printer and expand her stationary business into new areas.

Alice intends to buy stationery such as box files and books to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery such as box files and books to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is a farmer who grows bananas for commercial purposes. With the proceeds, she has been able to buy more land to expand her plantation.

As it is every responsible mother's dream, Violet desires to educate her children up to the university level and see them graduate with degrees. She says that her plantation is not sufficient to supply her increasing customers. That is why she has to buy from other farmers. Violet intends to use the loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 39-year-old married woman with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Ten years ago, she decided to venture into the shoe business in order to support her growing family. The ever-changing customer preference coupled with limited capital pose a challenge to her business growth. Her dream is to venture into the clothing business so as to spread the risks. Grace intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 21-year-old single man. His father is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Bassam is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Bassam to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Bassam and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Twenty years ago, he ventured into events services, where he would hire out tents, chairs, bridalwear and other items. Despite the business being seasonal, he has been able to reap tangible benefits that have enabled him to provide basics to his family. 

Mishandling by customers and loss of some items pose a challenge to his business, and his desire is to venture into modern agriculture and build a permanent house for a residence.

Eliab intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell and building materials for construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and building materials.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en:
Jamali lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for four years. In this business, he sells retail stock like rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. He heard about bee keeping and would like to invest in that business.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are the high costs of products. 

Jamali is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy retail stock like sugar and flour and open a mobile money transfer shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar and flour and open a mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad who appears in the photo inside his store, is a 23-year-old married father of three sons.
For the past year, Ahmad has had his own business, operating an electrical goods store. His store is located in a good commercial area and he has many loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one. It is the only source of income for his family, and Ahmad needs more support to cover some costs.
Ahmad is requesting a $1,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing more electrical goods for his store. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income, so he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of one school-aged child. She runs a clothing business as a hawker alongside another job. 
Judith was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to purchase new clothes to sell such as curtains, dresses, trousers, shirts, etc.	
Judith believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children and is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of some of her customer's bad debts.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell such as curtains, dresses, trousers, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chairs and additional stock of cosmetics and hair pieces.

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for 18 years. She also has a rental house and earns additional income through her spouse’s employment. Maua employs two other people in the business.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, and other goods.
Despite the high level of bad debts, Maua believes she can save the money needed to educate her children, provide employment to her other employees and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. He owns a store which has been running for two years. He sells items like rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.. He heard about bee-keeping and would like to invest in the business.
He heard about Milango through friends who invited him to the group; he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business. His main challenge is the high cost of transportation. 
Ibrahim is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy more stock. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock items like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Mona is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother to five sons. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Mona and her family also work in agriculture. They own a large piece of land and farm different types of vegetables over the course of the year. They sell their harvest in the market and earn a good income that helps them cover some of their needs and live in better conditions.
Mona is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing seasonal seedlings.
This will allow them to produce a better crop and thus increase their sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a single business man who has run a barber shop and salon for the last three years. George learned of Milango from a friend and joined the group to access credit for his business. 
George is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy shampoo, clips, kits, etc. for his business.
He believes this will help increase his income despite the challenge of competition and occasional high energy bills.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, clips, kits, etc..

loans.name: Nathmiah

texts.en:
Nathmiah, who appears in the photo, is a 55-year-old single woman. She gives lessons to school children, which has been profitable and her only source of income.
Nathmia is well known for her strong, ambitious personality and her persistence in achieving her goals. 
Nathmiah is studying for a Masters Degree at the university, specializing in Arabic language. Nathmiah wants to complete her studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This will ensure a better future for Nathmiah and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay her university fees.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
El señor José Leonel trabaja en una empresa de la capital vive en un barrio de la capital  casado con dos hijos que están en edad escolar. 

José está solicitando un crédito a ceprodel  para  pago de colegiatura y compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que  en estos momentos su prioridad es que sus hijos asistan a la escuela. 

Ya que considera que la mejor herencia para sus hijos es darles estudios. Se siente bien agradecido porque gracias a los crédito de ceprodel ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida .
texts.en:
José Leonel works for a company of capital city; he is married and has two children who go to school, and he lives in a neighborhood of Managua.

José is requesting a loan to Ceprodel to buy school stationery and to pay for school fees for his children: at the moment it is top priority for him that his children go to school, as he thinks that education is the best legacy he can bestow on his children. 

He feels really grateful because thanks to Ceprodel loans he has improves his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy school stationery and to pay for shcool fees.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón es un pequeño pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita El Joven Rigoberto Rojas de 41años de edad.

Rigoberto es casado, su esposa trabaja en un pequeño negocio que aduras penas ayuda al sustento Diario a su familia, cuentan con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, pero es de sus sueños vivir en una mejor vivienda. 

Rigoberto cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, honradez que es lo que lo ha mantenido bien a su familia.

 Hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel Y Kiva apoyaba a este tipo de persona, por tal Razón Solicita un crédito para la compra de: Zin y Madera, Esto sería de gran importancia porque aprovecharían mejorar un poco el techo de su vivienda.
 
 Agradece a Ceprodel y Kiva, espera que estos le sigan dando la mano amigable para seguir  mejorando su vida familiar".
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small town with different economic activities; this is where Rigoberto Rojas, 41, lives.

Rigoberto is married. His wife works in a small business and makes barely enough to help support the family. They have three children and the dream of having a better house. Rigoberto’s good health, working skills and honesty are the reasons why he has been able to give his family a good life.

He realized that Kiva and CEPRODEL supported these types of persons, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy zinc sheets and wood. These materials are important because they would help him improve his house’s roof.

Rigoberto wants to thank CEPRODEL and Kiva and hopes to continue receiving their friendly support in order to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and wood to improve his roof.

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es: Dulia, de 27 años de edad, esta divorciada del padre de sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia .La actividad que realiza Dulia es la venta de comida, especialmente desayunos y almuerzos. Los cuales entrega en forma de pensión a sus clientes que laboran en las obras de construcción, eso le permite tener un ingreso fijo y constante. Todas las preparaciones las realiza en la casa de su tía quien también le ayuda a vender , ella se inició en este negocio hace 4 años con un capital propio.Comenta que decidió iniciarse en éste negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para mantener a sus hijos ya que se había separado de su pareja y no contaba ingresos . Gracias a sus esfuerzos a logrado establecerse en el mercado y ahora con las ganancias desea ampliar su negocio . En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero ya que se siente más segura de avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Dulia is 27 years old and divorced from the father of her two children who live with her. Dulia sells food, especially breakfasts and lunches. The customers are from construction sites and they pre-order the meals which she delivers to them. This gives her a fixed and constant income. 

She prepares everything at her aunt's home. Her aunt also helps her sell. She began this business 4 years ago with her own capital. She says that she started it because she needed to be able to count on an income to look after her children after she seperated from her partner and had no income.

Thanks to her efforts she has been able to establish herself in this market and now with her profits she wants to expand the business. She is requesting S/. 1500 peruvian soles. She is grateful for the opprotunity to be able to receive financial help as it makes her more confident to advance the business.

With the money she will buy the necessary ingredients such as rice, sugar, oil etc. to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Libia Ricela

texts.es:
Libia tiene 37 años es casada tiene tres hijos vive en Chimbo con el esposo y con los hijos.

Libia se dedica a la siembra de maiz en terrenos arrendados, el credito solicita para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, el credito le ayudado a cubri las necesidades de los cultivos.

El sueño de Libia es tener dinero para educar bien a la hija que le falta culminar los estudios, en los tiempos libres salir con los hijos hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Libia is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives in Chimbo with her husband and children. 

Libia sows corn in leased land. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilisers. The loans have helped her cover the harvesting necessities.

Libia's dream is to have money to educate well her daughter who hasn't finished her studies yet. In her free time, she goes out to play sport with her children.

loans.use: seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: María Pamela

texts.es:
María Pamela es una joven de 30 años, casada con dos hijos en edad escolar, como toda Sauceña trabajadora y luchadora a pesar de que no pudo terminar su carrera universitaria como médico veterinario se dedica desde hace cinco año a comercializar cosméticos y ropa nueva el cual inició con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo con el fin de que generara sus propios ingresos.

Su día es muy agitado ya que empieza desde las cinco de la mañana para alistar a sus dos pequeños y llevarlos a la escuela, luego se dedica de manera ambulante en una bicicleta a visitar a sus posibles compradores y mostrar los productos que ofrece.

Dado la ocasión que se acerca la temporada de verano sus clientes le están demandando ropa y cremas acorde a esta temporada, por lo que necesita más capital para poder surtir de estos productos y satisfacer a sus clientes.

Por tal razón está solicitando un crédito a Ceprodel para comprar blusas, pantalones, chinelas, short, perfumes, lociones y bloqueadores solares.

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas kiva y Ceprodel apoyen su solicitud para poder llevar a cabo su ojetivo y sigan ayudando a tantas personas pobres de todo el mundo.
texts.en:
María Pamela is 30 years old and married with two children that are school-aged. Like all women in her region, she is hard-working and determined despite the fact that she couldn't finish her univerisity studies in veterinary medicine. 

For the last five years, she has sold cosmetics and new clothes. She started the venture with money from her husband so that she could earn her own income. 

She has a very busy day as she starts at five in the morning to get her two children ready for school. Then she goes by bicycle to visit possible buyers to show them her products. As summer is arriving, her clients are asking her for suitable clothes and creams so she needs more capital to be able to stock these products and satisfy her clients.

Therefore, she is requesting this loan from Ceprodel to buy blouses, trousers, flip flops, shorts, perfumes, lotions and sun blocks.

She trusts in God that the Kiva investors and Ceprodel will support her request so she can accomplish her objective and that they will keep helping poor people around the world.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, flip flops, shorts, perfumes, lotions and sun blocks.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Michel est un homme de 41 ans et marié. Il possède et gère  une petite usine de production et de vente de frites de pomme (chips) à domicile dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans. Dynamique et travailleur, ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de matières premières (pommes, huile, etc) afin d'accroître sa production et ses profits. les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans son activité (achat de 02 foyers à gaz, créer une grande unité de production), couvriront la ville de Douala et amélioreront les besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Michel is a 41-year-old married man. He has own and run a small potato chip production unit and shop in his home, in a district of town, for 4 years. A dynamic and industrious man, he will be able to increase his inventory of raw ingredients (potatoes, oil, etc.) with this loan, and thus increase his production and his profits. The profits generated will be reinvested into his business (by buying 2 gas stoves and creating a large production unit) so that he can cover the town of Douala, and will take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make chips.

loans.name: Celeste Mirabelle

texts.fr: Celeste est une femme de 45 ans, marié et mère de 6 enfants. elle possède une boutique dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans où elle y vend des produits alimentaires (jus, biscuits, lait, céréales, lessive). elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices générés seront investis dans l'activité (expansions) et subviendront aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en: Celeste Mirabelle is a 45-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 6 children. She has owned a shop in a district of town, where she sells food (e.g. juice, biscuits, milk, cereals) and items like washing powder, for 4 years. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her inventory of products so that she can satisfy her clientèle. The profits generated by her business will be reinvested (in order to expand the business) and used to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and owns a restaurant which he has been operating for five years. He employs four other people in the café.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of seasonal changes. 
James is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy stock like rice, cereals, wheat flour, etc. His extra income from this loan will be invested back into the business and for the improvement of his family's living standard. His dream is to open another restaurant.

loans.use: To buy stock for his restaurant like rice, cereals, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Patachaj Group

texts.en:
In Patachaj, San Cristobal Totonicapan in Guatemala, villagers make a living farming and manufacturing clothing. The rural village, founded in 1880, is home to a people who are friendly and happy, despite the area’s typically cold weather.

Three years ago, Patachaj Trust Bank was founded by seven local women. With the addition of six new members this year, the group has grown to 13 enthusiastic women, excitedly awaiting their loans from Friendship Bridge.

Teresa is one of the new members. She is 31 years old and married to a day laborer named Alejandro. The couple has three children, two girls and one boy, who attend the local elementary school. Teresa and her husband, who were themselves unable to attend school beyond the second grade, are dedicated to keeping their children in school.
 
A year ago, when Teresa noticed that her husband's income was not enough to support their family, she started a small business selling tortillas.  Currently using a wood stove, she is restricted to selling the tortillas on the road outside her home three days a week. She joined Patachaj Trust Bank so she could buy a gas stove. A gas stove, which is more economical and easier to transport, would allow her to locate her business in San Cristobal Totonicapan’s busy market center, ten minutes from her home. Her goal is to work at least four days a week in her business.  

Besides Teresa’s tortilla business, the women in Patachaj Trust Bank hand-embroider blouses, manufacture clothing, and own small convenience stores, among other enterprises. The loans and monthly training they receive from their involvement in Friendship Bridge’s microcredit program expand their businesses and keep their children in school. They all expressed their gratitude to KIVA investors for helping to develop them and their families.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist in purchasing a workstation and chairs, closet and shelving, materials and artificial nail supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Chucuxcabel Group

texts.en:
Chucuxcabel Trust Bank was formed in December of 2011. The Trust Bank, whose name means “cherry’s heart” is located in the western highlands of Guatemala in rural Patachaj, San Cristobal Totonicapan. Currently the group has ten members, half of whom are starting their third loan cycle. The other half are new members. The women's businesses include animal husbandry, weaving, embroidery and garment-making.

One of the women, Ana, is 32 years old and has one son. She makes skirts and embroidered blouses, typical of Guatemala, which she sells wholesale.  She started her business five years ago, and joined the Chucuxcabel Trust Bank when it started in 2011, so that she could hire employees to help expand her business. Proudly, today she provides jobs to six women, all of whom are better able to support their large families because of their employment with Ana. In her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, Ana plans to buy yarn and fabric in preparation for the annual Easter holiday. This year she hopes her team will be able to start work early in order to meet the customer demand.

Ana and the other members of Chucuxcabel have paid back their previous loans and are requesting a new one. By allowing them to grow their businesses, the loans have a great impact on their lives and those of their families. Ana, in particular, has benefited from Friendship Bridge’s microcredit program which, in addition to the loans, provides monthly training sessions to discuss issues like women’s health, self-esteem, women’s rights, and business management. 

The Chucuxcabel Trust Bank appreciates the help from KIVA investors as it encourages them to continue investing in Guatemala.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es: Jose, de 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro sula con su esposa e hijos. Jose es una persona muy emprendedora, lleva 10 años de realizar su propia actividad de negocio, el vende todo tipo de verduras de manera ambulante en una carreta con caballo. Vende cebolla, tomate, papas, repollo, chile, coliflor, etc. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar producto de verduras al mercado para revenderlas y con una parte va reparar una carreta que utiliza para vender las verduras. Su meta es incrementar las ventas, los ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, age 42, is married and has 4 children.  He lives with his wife and children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Jose is a very enterprising person.  He has been working in his own business for ten years.  

He sells all types of vegetables in an itinerant manner with a horse and cart.  He sells onions, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, chilies, and cauliflower, etc.

He has decided to request a loan for 15,000 lempiras from ODEF.  He will use the loan to buy vegetable products at the market.  He will resell the vegetables.  He will use part of the loan to repair the cart that he uses to sell the vegetables.

His goal is to increase his sales and income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell and to repair his cart.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Business est composé de 29 membres. Christine et Aline étaient empêchées le jour de l'octroi du crédit.Sur la photo, elles ont été représentées par leurs maris respectifs:Patrick et Emile.

Désiré est le représentant du groupe  Business et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 28 ans.  

Il prend soins d’un  jeune de 20 ans, qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce des habits   depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son  troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus.
