Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait d’abord reconstituer un nouveau capital, puisqu’il  a perdu ses biens par   l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura.
texts.en:
The "Business" group has 29 members. Christine et Aline were not able to come the day the loan was granted; they are represented on the photo by their husbands, Patrick and Emile respectively.

Désiré is the Business group representative and lives in Bujumbura. He is single and 28 years old. He is responsible for a young, 20-year-old man who is studying. Désiré has been selling clothes for 10 years. This is his 3rd loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and allow him to buy a lot of clothing for resale, so that he can earn more money. In the years to come, he would like to rebuild his assets, as he lost his possessions in a fire at the central market of Bujumbura.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist in building a professional kitchen outside her home.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia provides cosmetic treatments and has built a salon that is well liked and appreciated in her area. She is constantly working to ensure her salon stays strong by drawing customers and providing quality services. She completed a training course in laser treatments and wants to introduce such treatments to her salon.

Nadia needs this loan to help buy a laser hair removal machine.

Nadia is a professional and one day wants to expand into a full-service beauty salon providing a variety of cosmetic treatments.

loans.use: To purchase a laser hair removal machine.

loans.name: Baby Liza

texts.en:
Baby Liza is 23 years old and has two children.

She earns a living farming vegetables in the Philippines. Baby Liza is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies for her business.

Baby Liza has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming coconuts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies for her business

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 44 years old and married with two children.

Cecile works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items like snack foods, rice, canned goods, and other groceries.

Cecile has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cecile aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, rice, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Patria has a business selling fish in the Philippines. Patria requested a loan of 12000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Patria has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Patria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. Christina is married and has a food-processing business in the Philippines.

Christina requested a loan of 15000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-processing business.

Christina has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Christina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a food-processing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Basel, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Noor is a 23-year-old married young woman and a mother of one son. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Noor is a very ambitious woman; she is studying at the university, specializing in arts. Noor wants to complete her studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a $1,500 loan from FATEN to help her pay the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Noor and improve the family's living conditions positively.

loans.use: To pay the university fees.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Julie Ann has been in this business for 6 years. Julie Ann earns additional income from a general store.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Graciela del Carmen es originaria de la comarca Rio Grande un caserío ubicado a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce rodeado de un fabuloso y enorme río caudaloso. 

Esta señora es madre soltera de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo una en educación primaria y el otro en la universidad, a pesar de haber criado a sus hijos sola ha tratado de darles lo mejor con su salario como maestra de primaria el que ha desempeñado desde muy joven y a lo largo de estos años está luchando por preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente para que sean personas de bien y que se defiendan en el futuro.

Actualmente necesita un crédito para comprar útiles escolares y pagar varios meses de la universidad para que esto no sea un obstáculo en el futuro para que su hijo culmine su carrera universitaria.

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva le otorguen este crédito a través de Ceprodel y les agradece de ante mano por el apoyo que le han brindado a muchas familias necesitadas como ella, ya que estos créditos vienen a solventar tantos gastos del hogar que con el salario no se pueden cubrir.
texts.en:
Graciela del Carmen is a native of the Río Grande region. She is from a hamlet located 10 kilometers from the municipality of El Sauce, which is surrounded by a fantastic and enormous river.

Graciela del Carmen is a single mother of three children, two of whom are still her dependents. One of these is in primary school and the other is in university. Despite having raised her children by herself, she has tried to give them the best with her primary school teacher’s salary. She has been a primary school teacher since she was very young. Throughout the years she has fought to prepare her children to be good people and to be able to look after themselves in the future.

Graciela del Carmen is requesting a loan to buy school supplies and to pay for a number of months of university tuition. She does not want this to be an obstacle that could prevent her son from finishing his university degree. She says that she trusts in God that Kiva lenders will grant her this loan through CEPRODEL and she thanks them in advance for the support they have provided to many families in need like hers. She says that these loans help to meet so many household expenses that are often not possible to cover with one’s salary.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and to pay for a number of months of university tuition.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loreta is 43 years old, and three of her children are in school. Loreta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Loreta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en: Elcita is 58 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elcita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Elcita has been raising pigs for 20 years, and she also earns additional income from fishing and from buying and selling dried fish. Elcita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to continue to build her businesses of raising pigs, fishing, and buying and selling fish. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory (including canned goods, noodles, spices and eggs) to sell. Estrella has taken out and and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for eight years, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory (including canned goods, noodles, spices and eggs) to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional items, including eggs by the dozen, bread, canned goods and soft drinks, to sell in her store. Jocelyn has sustained her business activities with her 15 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, including eggs by the dozen, bread, canned goods and soft drinks, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more balut (street snacks) to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business and a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fruit to sell to customers.

Cecilia successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Cecilia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to customers.

loans.name: Oscar  Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar Eduardo es un joven originario de la ciudad Managua, su estado civil es casado convive con su padres, este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona  con buenos valores morales, actualmente cuenta con trabajo estable en un centro de capacitación profesional, desempeñándose como auxiliar de contabilidad con tres años de experiencia.

Oscar Eduardo solicita a CEPRODEL  un crédito  para poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como cinz, perlines para  hacer reparación de su techo de su vivienda. 

Agradece a Ceprodel y a kiva por la oportunidad y la confianza que le puedan brindar con este financiamiento ya que él quiere acondicionarle la casita a su familia  para una buena comodidad.
texts.en:
Oscar Eduardo is a native of the city of Managua. He is married and lives with his parents. He says he is known for being a person with good moral values. Oscar Eduardo has a stable job in a professional training center, where he has worked as an accounting assistant for three years.

Oscar Eduardo is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL to buy construction materials such as zinc sheets and purlins to repair the roof of his home. He is grateful to CEPRODEL and to KIVA for this opportunity and for their confidence. With this loan he wants to improve his family’s home to make it more comfortable for them.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc sheets and purlins to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children aged from two years to seven years. He describes himself as an honest and sociable man. 

He operates a motorcycle, which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own another motorcycle with financial help from SMEP DTM within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will purchase many motorcycles. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcyle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess is 28 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known townships in Montserrado county, Liberia. She was unable to complete high school, but she is good at managing her business. She is single and has three children aged between six and thirteen, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years, Princess has been selling towels in her local market. She has a lot of customers and makes more profits every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more towels to sell. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more towels for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a loan of 12000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy recycled materials and sell to wholesalers. 

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like empty bottles, cans, and scrap iron.

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, ageed four and two. 

Gracelyn is a rice farmer and has been in the farming business together with her husband for more than six years now. Gracelyn needs a loan for the improvement of her business. 

She is applying for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to produce a healthy and abundant harvest.

In the future, Gracelyn dreams of expanding her farm. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: James Mark

texts.en:
James Mark is a 24-year-old, married man and father of a 2-year-old son from Ubay, Bohol. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of his income.

James Mark is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and eventually his harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to be used in her carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Lenin Carlos

texts.es:
El joven Lenin Carlos  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabajador de una institución,  casado responsable con su familia.  
Actualmente está viviendo en casa de sus padres está solicitando financiamiento  a kiva para gastos de  matrículas y compra útiles escolares para poder enviar a sus hijos a la escuela.
 
Lenin manifiesta que está muy agradecido con ceprodel porque gracias al financiamientos anterior que ha obtenido ha podido mejorar  las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lenin Carlos lives in the city of Managua, where he works in an institution. He is married and is responsible for his family. He currently lives in his parent’s home.

Lenin Carlos is requesting a Kiva loan to pay tuition and buy school supplies to send his children to school.

Lenin Carlos says that he is very grateful to CEPRODEL because thanks to their previous loans he has been able to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy school supplies to send his children to school.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread and other snack foods. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional food to sell in her food-vending business.

Lorena has been in this business for eight years. Lorena earns additional income from making pillows and from a general store.

Lorena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending, pillow-making, and general store.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional food to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Maria has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business but also in their children's education. She was able to buy more ingredients for her food stall, which means a higher income. This has been her business for five years now. She and her husband work hard to continuously provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan of 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a good life with her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit stand business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell in her fruit stand business.

Marilyn has been in this business for ten years. Marilyn earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Marilyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fruit stand, pig-raising, and rice farming businesses.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Joveniano

texts.en:
Joveniano is a 43-year-old carpenter and fisherman. He is a married man and and has five children. They live in Anda, Bohol. Joveniano is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights for his fishing business. 

In the future, Joveniano hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 30 years old and married with one child who is currently going to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Karin Javier

texts.es: Karin de 23 años ya es ingeniero industrial y actualmente está ejerciendo su profesión, pero su mayor deseo es culminar sus estudios de post-grado en gerencia de proyectos, lo cual es muy importante para su desarrollo laboral y personal, por lo que solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso mencionado ya que sus ingresos son bajos y no puede cubrir este gasto de un solo pago, solamente con financiamineto podra hacer posible este sueño.
texts.en:
Karin, 23 years old, is an industrial engineer already.  At the moment he is working in this profession. However, his greatest wish is to complete his postgraduate studies in project management. This is very important for his professional and personal development. 

That is why he is asking for the support of a loan, in order to pay for the aforementioned course. His income is low and he cannot pay for the course in one go. He can only make this dream a reality by obtaining financing.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate course

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
DOÑA ANA PATRICIA
Ella es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a confeccionar uniformes escolares y a bordados a mano desde hace algunos años.
Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora ya cuenta con su propiO negocio
El esposo de ella trabaja en el mismo negocio y gracias al apoyo de él, ella sigue adelante con sus trabajos para el beneficio de su familia.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y así mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
Ella ha tenido ya tres créditos KIVAS y con la puntualidad en sus pagos no ha caído en mora. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de bordados y costuras.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is a native of the municipality of Tecpan Guatemala. She is responsible for her two minor children. For a number of years now she has worked making school uniforms and hand-made embroidery.

She began with a small business, which she says thanks to God grew little by little into her current business. Her husband works with her in her business, and thanks to his support she is able to keep going with her work for the benefit of her family.

Her dream is to increase the size of her business in order to earn greater profits. With more profits she would like to send her children to school so that they have a better future.

Ana Patricia has had three Kiva loans previously and she says she has been punctual in making her payments and did not fall into default. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for embroidery and sewing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidery and sewing.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, de 37 años, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, junto a ellos vive en su casa propia .Herminia se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, bebidas energizantes y refrescos naturales. Ha consolidado su negocio en una esquina muy transitada de su localidad y esto le permite tener clientes en todo momento, ahí atiende diariamente a todas las personas que acuden para saciar su sed sobre todo los fines de semana luego de una extenuante labor deportiva en un parque cercano a su establecimiento de trabajo . Lleva en este negocio más de 10 años y trabaja sola. En su hogar tambien vende gaseosas, hielos y chupetes.Su trabajo le genera buenas ganacias económicas, lo que le sirve para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y destinar otra parte al ahorro familiar. Sin embargo, actualmente ha visto una gran necesidad en su sector y es la falta de puntos de venta de comida, es por ello que ha decidido optar también por este rubro y tentar la suerte, espera complementar su actividad con un puesto de comida .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito y asi  pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará gaseosas y bebidas energizantes para continuar trabajando, asimismo comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para iniciar su negocio de venta de comida como pollos, arroz, huevos, aceites entre otros.
texts.en:
Herminia, 37, is married and has five children. She lives with them in her own home. Herminia makes a living selling beverages such as sodas, energy drinks, and natural sodas. She has consolidated her business in a very busy corner of her town and that permits her to have clients at any moment. 

There she attends daily to all the people who show up, satisfying their thirst above all on weekends after they take part in strenuous sports activities in a park near her work establishment. She has been working in this business for 10 years and she works alone. 

In her home she also sells soda, ice and lollipops. Her work generates a good income, which helps her to cover her basic needs and dedicate another part of her earnings to family savings. However, she has seen that currently there is a great need in her neighborhood: a lack of food sales spots. This is why she has decided to also opt for that line of work and tempt fate. 

She hopes to complement her current work with a food stand. At this moment she is requesting 800 Peruvian soles, for which she thanks all those who make this loan possible since with it she can realize her plans. She also commits to making her payments in a punctual fashion. 

With the amount requested she will buy sodas and energy drinks so she can continue working, as well as buying the necessary ingredients to launch her food sales business, including chickens, rice, eggs, oil, and more.

loans.use: to buy sodas, energy drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, whose previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy all the ingredients she needs for her food stall, which has been running for ten years now. Her business helps a lot with her family's finances and even for the education of her children. She and her husband work hard for their family.

Janet would now like to apply for another 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products for her stall. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Janet hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children and grand children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 40, is a very humble and hardworking woman. She patiently manages her variety store in order to attain a good living for her family. She has always wanted to have a comfortable living, so she really works hard for it. Arlene would like to increase the quantity of products she offers to her villagers in order to gain a higher income, but insufficient capital hinders her. 

Because of this, she requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, 20 cases of soft drinks and shake powder. She believes that through her hard work and the loan, she could be able to earn better income which will provide for her family's daily expenditures and the education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, 20 cases of soft drinks and shake powder.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma has been engaged in selling AVON and MSE products for over two years. She successfully provides a good source of income through her diligence. She is aiming for a higher income that would make her living conditions better. This motivated her to borrow a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy lotion, lipstick, face powder and shampoo to resell at a higher price. She wants to grow her primary business so that she will able to save for her future.

loans.use: to buy lotion, lipstick, face powder and shampoo.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 38, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, an engineer, and is a mother to her children. She is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business.

Angelina operates a buy and sell business. She sells different laundry and dish washing products. What she basically does is buy her products from wholesalers and then sell them per item for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products like dish washing liquid, fabric conditioner, detergent powder and other products for her business.  

Angelina dreams of having her own stall for the business and hopes to give her children a good life and a future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products like dishwashing liquid, fabric conditioner, detergent powder and other products for her business.

loans.name: Noraita

texts.en:
Noraita is 43 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Noraita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Noraita has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and farming coconuts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Dúo Luceros De La Mañana Group

texts.es: Dúo Luceros de la Mañana, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Juana de 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura (cultivo de apio y rabano) ella se dedica a esta activida desde hace años, ya que de esta forma es como ella ayuda a su familia con los gastos de su hogar, en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para seguir cultivando su producto, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The "Dúo Luceros de Mañana" group has 28 year old Juana as a member.  She makes a living in agriculture (growing celery and radish).  She has been doing this work for some years now as, through it, she is helping her family with household costs.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser to continue growing her products.  She hopes that you can help with the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for crops.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell pineapple and banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of pineapple and banana fruits to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of pineapple and banana fruits to sell.

loans.name: Margie-Lyn

texts.en: Margie-Lyn is 25 years old. She really desires to lift up her family from their poor living conditions. This causes her to devote herself to the selling of dry goods. Through this she is able to provide the daily needs of her family. She wants to improve and boost her income, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and kids' shirts. She hopes to receive her requested loan to further improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and kids' shirts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the computer parts and supplies for her computer shop. She was able to buy a set of computers, too. This has been her business for five years now. Her husband, who is a farmer, helps her in generating income for their family.

She would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy a new set of computers and more video games. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams of having another branch of her computer shop and hopes for good health for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a new set of computers and more video games.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 30-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children, from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari store business, selling various items and goods to the people in her place. 

Juliet is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries. With these groceries, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus increasing her sales and profit. 

In the future, Juliet hopes to make her business grow and be sustainable. Moreover, she wants to continue to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is 38 years old. She is married, with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nory has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy dried fish to sell.

Nory has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Nory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Raiza

texts.en: Raiza, aged 22, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and child. Her husband is a tricycle driver. For her age, she has a lot of experience. As of now, she is helping her husband through caring for hogs for sale. She is doing such business to save funds that will be used by them when their child goes to school. Right now, she is asking for additional support in terms of a loan through ASKI for repairing and maintaining the tricycle as well as for the purchase of feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Hopefully, 12,000 pesos worth of loan will be approved.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the tricycle as well as purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: Jose Alejandro, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia del municipio de San Pedro Sula. El tiene su propio negocio en su casa de la elaboración de carteras y billeteras típicas. Su experiencia cuenta con 22 años, la que adquirió donde trabajaba. Ahora el tiene su propio taller y las carteras y las billeteras las vende en los mercados locales de la ciudad. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para poder comprar materia prima como cuero, hilos, pegamentos y otros que utiliza en el taller de billeteras. Su plan es seguir trabajando para tener mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Alejandro, age 56, is married and has two children.  He lives in a neighborhood in the San Pedro Sula municipality.  He has his own business at his house.

He makes typical purses and wallets.  He has 22 years of experience, which he acquired where he used to work.  He now has his own purse and wallet shop.  He sells them at the local markets in the city.

He has requested a loan for 10,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy raw material like leather, thread, glue, and others that he uses in his wallet workshop.  His plan is to continue working in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw material like leather, thread, glue, and others that he uses.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marvin Antonio es un señor de 58 años, casado, Sauceño que se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a laborar como profesor de primaria con una gran experiencia en el ramo que se ha sido muchas veces premiado como uno de los mejores maestros que tiene el municipio.

A pesar que le toca dar clases en una comunidad alejada al municipio donde tiene que viajar en bicicleta porque es un lugar de difícil acceso se siente muy contento de enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños de dicha comunidad porque son personas muy pobres que muchas veces no tienen el pan de cada día pero que hacen el esfuerzo por salir adelante.

Don Marvin está solicitando un crédito para realizarse un trabajo dental ya que últimamente ha presentado problemas en sus dientes y quiere verse a tiempo esto para evitar mayores consecuencias.

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le ayudarán con dicha solicitud para hacerse este trabajo ya que es costoso y con su salario no puede cubrirlo.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio, from El Sauce, is 58 years old and married.  He has worked for almost all his life as a primary teacher:  He has a lot of experience in this field and on many occasions has received the prize for best primary teacher in the municipality.

He has to give classes in a community very far from his home and although he has to cycle to work because it is a difficult area to access, he is very happy teaching the children in the community to read and write because the are very poor and often do not have enough to eat every day.  Nevertheless they work hard to do well.

Marvin is applying for a loan to have some dental work done as recently he has had problems with his teeth.  He wants to be seen by a dentist soon so he can avoid serious consequences.

He trusts in God that Kiva lenders, through Ceprodel, will help him with the loan so he can have this work done..It is expensive and he cannot afford it on his salary.

loans.use: to pay for dental work.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 33 años de edad,  esta casado y tiene  un hijo de 11 años de edad, vive en compañía de su familia en la casa que construyó con mucho esfuerzo.El trabajo de José consiste básicamente en brindar servicio de elaboración de planos, asesoramiento logístico, elaboración de perfil de obras, ejecución de proyectos y otros. Su trabajo es independiente y en horarios libres dependiendo de la disponibilidad de clientes. Tiene una computadora en casa , lugar donde trabaja arduamente para brindar un buen trabajo a sus clientes . Afortunadamente, asegura que los clientes con los que ha trabajado hasta ahora se han sentido satisfechos con su trabajo  Lleva en esta actividad 4 años y se siente muy bien en esa actividad . Trabaja con la ayuda de una socia y al principio le fue complicado abrirse camino en este rubro, sin embargo su tenacidad y esmero le permitieron seguir adelante, ahora espera seguir progresando y que su trabajo siga siendo reconocido.  En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles para la compra de materiales de oficina que le son útiles en su centro de trabajo tales como hojas bond , tintas , reglas , entres otros . A la vez  se siente contento con el apoyo financiero que le está brindando Mfp ya que le ayudará a concretar sus planes.
texts.en:
José, 33, is married and has an 11-year-old son. He lives in the company of his family in a house he built with much effort. José's work basically consists of offering services which include the preparation of construction plans, logistical advising, preparation of construction profiles, project execution and more. He works independently and on a loose schedule depending on the availability of clients.

He has a computer in his house, where he works arduously to offer good work to his clients. Fortunately, he assures that the clients he has worked with thus far have been satisfied with his work. He has been doing this work for four years and he feels very good doing it. He works with the help of a partner and at the beginning it was complicated to open up a path in this line of work, however his tenacity and care allowed him to continue moving forward.

Now he hopes to continue progressing and that his work will continue to be recognized. Today, he is requesting 800 Peruvian soles to buy office materials such as printer paper, ink, rulers, and more, which will be useful to him for his work center. He also feels happy with the financial support that Mfp is offering him since it will help him realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy office materials

loans.name: Gracy Mariel

texts.es: Gracy tiene 22 años, labora en diseño grafico, es estudiante de la carrera de marketing y publicidad, apoyada de sus padres económicamente ha continuado con sus estudios, ahora ella solicita un préstamo para poder pagar un curso de especialización para culminar sus estudios superiores, lo cual le da mucha emocion por que es una oportunidad para optar a un mejor empleo con mayores conocimientos.
texts.en: Gracy, 22, works in graphic design. She is a student with a major in marketing and publicity, and she has been able to continue her studies by being financially supported by her parents. Today, she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for a specialized course which will allow her to complete her higher education. This excites her greatly because it will give her an opportunity to apply for a better job with more knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for a specialized course

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is 29 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, milk, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Mitchelle aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 22-year-old married woman and a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. Joy has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of their income. Joy works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm lot.

Joy is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Joy hopes to make her farm a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old, married, and was gifted with two children. She and her husband aim to uplift their status of living to give their children a better life. In this regard, Nora plans to improve her small variety store to generate a higher income. She has been in the business for almost two years and usually earns a profit of PHP 4,000 per month that she spent for their daily consumption and allowances of her children in school. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, soft drinks, vegetables, and grocery items to sell. She is hoping that this loan will be a great help in making more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, soft drinks, vegetables, and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria Santos, de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales(pollos) ella se dedica a esta activida desde hace 6 años, ya que es la unica forma de como ella ayuda a su familia como los gastos de su casa, en esta ocacion ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas animales para la crianza(pollos)ya que nececita mas capital para agrandar mas su negocio espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito que solicita.
texts.en:
Maria Santos is 34 years old.  She has worked at raising chickens for six years now, and it is her only way of helping her family with household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks to raise. She needs more capital in order to increase the size of her business. She hopes that Kiva lenders can help her with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 35-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three children. Her eldest child is 13 years old, and her youngest is 9 years old. She has operated a fish selling business for seven years now. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety store) business as her second business. Her husband is a habal-habal (motorcycle transportation) driver. These are her sources of income. 
Susan requests a loan to provide additional capital for her fish selling business. She will also use the loan to buy assorted goods for her sari-sari business. Susan is going to buy and sell fish for her business. She also wants to buy assorted goods including canned goods, noodles, toiletries, snacks, candies, seasonings, and spices. Through this, she can earn more income.
In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La señora se dedica a su negocio ubicado en uno de los mercados de chinandega desde hace 10 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos a sus cargos y solamente dos de ellos  estan estudiando, la señora se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante brindandoles estudios, y mejoras en su hogar, en la actualidad la señora ha invertido sus financiamientos tanto en su negocio como en su vivienda, ahora cuenta con una camionetita donde sale a buscar cerdos en pie con ayuda de su esposo, y ella se va al mercado a las siete de la mañana a realizar las ventas y termina a las dos de la tarde en su negocio vende carne de cerdo, pepena, fritos, charrascas todo para hacer un riquisimo chancho con yuca.

la señora se siente muy agradecida por ser clienta de ceprodel y ser favorecida con los financiamientos que kiva otorga para aunmentar nuestro capital con agilidad en las entregar e intereses bajos.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris, who has run her business in one of Chinandega's markets for 10 years, is responsible for her three children, two of whom are students. She strives to provide for their education and to maintain her home. She has invested her loans in both her business and her house. She has a small truck that she uses to pick up pigs with her husband's help. She heads to the market at 7 a.m. to make purchases. At 2 p.m. she closes her business, where she sells pork meats and offal, fried food, knives, and everything needed to make a delicious stew with yuca. 

Mayra is thankful to be a client of Ceprodel and to have Kiva loans available to her to easily increase her capital at low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy live pigs.

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La señora tiene su negocio en el mercado de chinandega desde hace 25 años  en su negocio vende productos de madera, como roperos, percheros,  estos los elabora en un taller de carpinteria que tiene en su casa con ayuda de su espso, batellas este es un lavandero de madera que la mayorias de mujeres compramos cuando damos a luz a nuestros bebes para lavarles su ropita en ese lavandero. tambien la señora elabora piñatas  es un don que tiene desde muy jovencita aprendio a hacer piñatas y ella le enseña a sus hijas para que vean cuanto cuesta la vida.
la señora es madre de 5 hijos  todos a su cargo y tres estan estudiando  por los cuales ella se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante, su negocio lo empezo con dinero que fue aporte de su esposo, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las  ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde . es una señora que lucha por salir adelante le gusta trabjar con la instituciòn porque le damos financiamientos a corto plazo y con intereses super bajos.
texts.en:
Ana has had her business in the market of Chinandega for 25 years. In her business, she sells wood products such as closets and racks. She makes these in a carpentry workshop that she has in her home, with the help of her husband Batellas. The majority of women buy wooden washers when they give birth to their babies so that they can wash their little clothing on these washers. 

She also makes piñatas. It is a gift that she has had since she was very young, when she learned to make piñatas. She then taught her daughters so that they could see how much life really cost. She is the mother of five children, all under her care, and three of them are studying. She strives to move them forward. 

Her business was started with money that was contributed by her husband. She works from Monday to Sunday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She is a woman who fights to get ahead and she likes working with the institution because they give her short-term financing with very low interest.

loans.use: to buy crafts and wood for the production of closets, china cabinets, and racks.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 50 años es casado, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad  es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí. El es comerciante hace más de 10 años tiene un salón de ventas de ropas de todas las marcas y clases y también de prendas que el mismo confecciona, ya que también es costurero y  trabaja al por mayor y menor.
Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus prendas son de muy buena calidad y no son caras. Su meta es seguir creciendo y tener más clientes lo que le dará mayores ingresos.
Solicita del crédito para la reparación de unas de sus máquinas de coser, ya que esta es su medio de trabajo, y la que le permite hacer sus prendas.
texts.en:
Domingo, 50, is married and has three older children. He is from the city of Paraguarí.  He has been a merchant for more than 10 years. He has a clothing sales room with clothing of every brand and class, including clothes that he manufactures himself since he is also a tailor and he works wholesale and individual sale.

He has generated a very good clientele since his clothing is of very good quality and is not expensive. His goal is to continue growing and have more clients which would give him a better income. He is requesting this loan for the repair of some of his sewing machines, since this is his work medium and that which allows him to make clothing.

loans.use: to repair a sewing machine

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en: A 53-year-old married woman, Lelia has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. Lelia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, which will allow them to sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed for her business.

Rowena has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from food processing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 57, is a hardworking mother who sells assorted items such as candies, frozen foods, junk foods and soft drinks. As a businesswoman, she wishes to have a greater income. In connection to this, she is asking a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy sweets, breads, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks, embotido and longganisa. Through the loan, she hopes to improve her business and acquire increased income in order to live an enhanced life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, breads, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks, embotido and longganisa.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras  está en su ciclo número  1, están empezando a hacer su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron por buscar un bien para sus familias.
Hilda, una de las miembros, esta trabajando arduamente por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo y con ayuda de su grupo. Ella es consciente de que trabajando es la única forma de salir adelante. Hilda se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa pequeña, pero bien surtida,  en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ir creciendo con su negocio y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, carnes, leche, panificados y demás, ya que son los productos que más vende y quiere poder tener un buen stock de ellos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Luchadoras" is in its first cycle. They are starting to do a survey on the elimination of poverty. They are very hard-working women who joined together in order to seek the best for their families.
Hilda, one of the members, is working arduously to get ahead and help her family, through her work and with the help of her group. She knows that work is the only way to get ahead. Hilda is a merchant and has a small but well-stocked store. She works there every day from the wee hours of the morning. Her goal is to be able to keep working and expanding her business.
She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables, condiments, meat, milk, bread ingredients, and other items. These are her biggest sellers, and she wants to have a good stock of them.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, milk, bread ingredients, and other items.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas ellas han hecho la encuentra de eliminación de pobreza, y están siendo capacitadas para ir mejorando.
La Sra. Sandra, una de las miembros, es comerciante y también limpiadora en una Escuela cercana a su casa. En su trabajo de comerciante se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser harina, verduras, carnes y demás. Ella es muy sacrificada, ya que tiene dos trabajos, y por medio de ambos siempre trata de dar lo mejor a su familia y tener mayores ingresos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes y demás, para que con ello siga trabajando con sus ventas y teniendo un ingreso extra.
texts.en:
The communal bank Oñondivepa is in its 3rd loan cycle with the women's program, in which everyone works and helps each other get ahead. The members have participated in the poverty reduction survey and are being trained to improve their skills.

Sandra, a member, is a merchant and also a janitor at the local school. As a merchant, she sells basic items such as flour, vegetables, and meat. She is very dedicated, as she works two jobs so that she can provide the best for her family and have more income. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables, meats, and more to keep selling merchandise and have extra income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Kuña Kayupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo 1. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las mujeres a través de los talleres, visitas semanales están tratando de salir adelante ya que se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Actualmente están en proceso de pasar al nivel dos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace ventas de comestibles , como ser sopa paraguaya, chipa, y ventas diarias de ropas. Como se ve, ella es muy trabajadora y quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus alimentos, como ser choclo, sal, queso, huevo, aceite y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Katupyry is in its first loan cycle. It is participating in the poverty reduction survey, where the women, who are now living below the poverty line, are trying to get ahead through workshops and weekly visits. They are about to reach poverty level two.

Sonia, a member, was at poverty level one in the last survey. She sells prepared foods, traditional soups and breads, and clothing. She is hardworking and wants to succeed. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients such as sweet corn, salt, cheese, eggs, and oil to prepare her dishes, which will help her firm up her business plan and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn, salt, cheese, eggs, oil, and more.

loans.name: Alcadio

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcadio es dueño de una zapatería se dedica a está actividad  hace más de 30 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos. Alcadio es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con muy buena referencia en el barrio.
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que es muy conocido por el buen trabajo que hace, y gracias a ello está ayudando a su familia y saliendo adelante. Su meta es seguir trabajando y teniendo los medios para seguir teniendo los ingresos para cubrir el día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para pode invertirlo en la compra de cuero, suela para calzados, pegamentos y demás, ya que estos son sus principales herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alcadio is the owner of a shoe store.  He has been in this business for more than 30 years.  He is married and has two children.

Alcadio is a very hardworking and enterprising person, and has a very good reputation in the neighborhood.  He says that he has very good customers since he is very well known for the good work he does.  Thanks to this, he is helping his family and getting ahead.  

His goal is to continue working and having the means to continue earning the income to cover day to day costs.  He is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of leather, shoe soles, glues and more, since these are the primary tools of his work.

loans.use: to buy leather, shoe soles, glues and more.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, es separada  tiene dos  hijas una de ellas se encuentra en etapa escolar,  viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mururata de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió solo hasta el nivel primario, se dedica a la venta de distinta variedad de frutas en distintas ferias de la ciudad.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una gran diversidad de frutas de la temporada (piña,tunas,bananas, mangos).

El sueño de Virginia es poder convertirse en distribuidora al por mayor de frutas.

Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Virginia is separated and has two daughters, one of whom is school age.  They live in a rented house, which is located in the Mururata area of the city of El Alto.  

She only studied through primary school.  She makes her living selling a variety of fruits in different markets in the city.

She needs the loan to buy a wide variety of seasonal fruits (pineapple, prickly pears, bananas, mangos).  Virginia's dream is to be able to become a wholesale fruit distributor.  This is the second time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits (pineapples, prickly pears, mangos, bananas, etc.) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is 42 years old and married with ten children.

Sahara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dry goods store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Sahara has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and reselling dried coconut meat and rice grains.

Sahara aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 50 years old and married with six children. The family lives in CPG, Bohol. For ten years now, Leonarda and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business as the source of their income.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters. This will help her husband to improve his catch and allow them to sell more fish in the market. Leonarda is optimistic that this loan will help her realize her dream of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sauda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling gasoline. Sauda is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the past, Sauda has sustained her business activities through 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Necifina

texts.en:
Necifina is a hardworking and enduring person. She is married and raising three children. Her husband operates a motorcycle transportation business, while she works fattening hogs for sale and caring for their home. Necifina and her husband help each other to provide their children a comfortable life. 

Necifina is asking 11,000 PHP to buy new tires, renew her husband's driver's license, and buy feed for her pigs. She hopes to improve both her own and her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, renew her husband's driver's license, and buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 34, raises livestock for a living. She works hard to improve her standard of living. 

Rosemarie is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and chickens. She will continue raising livestock because she was only able to attain a low level of education, which does not allow her to pursue other types of business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Mercy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has children.  She works hard to support her family.  She has a fish business in the Philippines. 

Virginia is requesting her 22nd loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store business.

Virginia has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish and rice.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
In order to meet the challenge of financial difficulties, Christy aims to improve her small variety store and generate more income. Christy is 26 years old, married, and has three siblings. Two of them are presently in grade school, and Christy's family wants them to continue their studies so that they can earn degrees. 

To this end, Christy is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy stock for her store such as snack foods, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soaps, eggs, soft drinks, and seasonings. She hopes that her business will continuously grow and become more profitable in order to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages nine, seven, and four. They live in CPG, Bohol, Philippines. For six years, Letecia and her husband have operated a motorcycle transport business.

Letecia needs a loan to buy fuel and spare parts, such as tires, nuts, and bolts, for her business. This will help her and her husband maintain the good working condition of their motorcycle.

Letecia hopes to make her business a success and plans to invest in a new venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Gloria Regina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es transportista, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el municipio de Victoria. Gloria tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y golosinas como churros y otros. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y tiene buena demanda. Ella ha solicitado este préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras porque necesita surtir de más mercadería nueva para vender. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Gloria, 39, is married and her husband works in transportation.  She has six children and lives in the municipality of Victoria.  Gloria has had her own business for five years; she sells merchandise like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, packaged snacks, etc.  The business is home-based and has good demand.  She’s requested this 15,000 Lempira loan because she needs to stock up on new merchandise to sell.  Her dream is that her business grows and to be able to help her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ana lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como ropa, carteras, lociones, cremas, zapatos, sandalias, y otros. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes todo el dia. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para capitalizarse y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar 5 fardos de ropa de segunda americana para vender. Su meta es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias va comprar un portón para su casa.
texts.en: Ana, 30, is a single mother living in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Ana has been selling merchandise like clothes, purses, lotions, creams, shoes, sandals, etc. for ten years.  Her business is home-based and she tends to customers there all day.  She’s decided to request a 15,000 Lempira loan to use as capital to buy five bales of second-hand American clothes to sell.  Her goal is to increase sales and to use profits to buy a gate for her house.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand American clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es: Emelda, de 40 años, esta casada y tiene 6 hijos , con quienes vive en su casa de material noble , la cual fue construida con mucho esfuerzo . Emelda tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos la venta de productos  regionales, desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los mejores plátanos, limones, granadillas, coconas,entre otros que considera comercial . Realiza sus ventas en el frontis de su vivienda en donde instala una mesa con todo lo que tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo 8 meses y le esta yendo muy bien.Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando está actividad ha aprendido muchas cosas ya que las experiencias le han enseñado a ser más cuidadosa con algunos productos y a poder invertir más en otros. Espera seguir trabajando mucho ya que su máximo anhelo es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, además desea poner un almacén en la ciudad donde pueda comprar y vender productos al por mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo .Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas y verduras como plátanos, aguaje ,naranjas, maíz y frijoles en sacos .
texts.en:
Emelda, 40, is married and has six children; she lives with them in a house made of substantial materials that was built with much effort.  Emelda’s source of income is selling regional products.  She heads out to the city’s main port early in the morning to look for the best bananas, lemons, sweet granadilla and coconas, among others she feels sell well.  She sells from her front porch where she sets up a table with everything she has available to offer her customers.  She’s been doing this work for 8 months and is doing very well.

In the time she’s been working she’s learned many things because experience has taught her to be more careful with certain products and to be able to invest more in others.  She hopes to continue working hard because her greatest wish is that her children complete their schooling; she also would like to open a store in the city where she can buy and sell at wholesale.

On this occasion, she’s asking for an 800-sol loan and is grateful to all those who make access to this financing possible because she will feel surer of making progress with her work.  She will use the requested amount to buy fruit and vegetables like bananas, aguaje fruit and oranges as well as sacks of beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. 

Leonila earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Elmira works very hard to provide for them.

For five years, Elmira has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Elmira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock her general store.

loans.name: Milton Orlando

texts.es: Milton, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Jose Comayagua con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura anteriormente cultivaba maíz, frijoles y hace 12 años tiene su propio cultivo de café. Produce café en pergamino y lo vende a los intermediarios de la zona. Su finca la ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, el que esta solicitando es el séptimo préstamo y es por 5,500 lempiras, con el cual va comprar abono y pago de limpieza de la finca para mejorar y sacar mejor producción. Su plan es darle buen mantenimiento y mantenerla cultivada su finca para sacar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Milton, 30, is married and has three children; he lives in the municipality of San José Comayagua with his wife and three children.  He’s spent his entire life working in agriculture.  He used to grow corn and beans but for the last 12 years has had his own coffee crops.  He produces coffee in parchment and sells it to local middlemen.  He’s kept his farm going thanks to various loans.  The one he’s asking for now is his 7th and it’s for 5,500 Lempiras he’ll use to buy manure and to pay to clear his land to improve and obtain better crop yields.  His plan is to provide good care and continue growing crops on his farm to provide income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay to clear his fields.

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
el señor edgard antonio vive en un barrio al norte de la  cuidad de managua se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y su hogar, actualmente trabaja en una institución desempeñándose como operador de limpieza.

el señor esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel un financiamiento para cubrir primeramente  gastos de estudio de  sus hijos que estan en edad escolar y comprales uniforme y todos los utencilio que ellos necesitan para asistir a la escuela . 

edgard esta agradecido con ceprodel y kiva por que con los crédito obtenido ha mejorado su casa. y esto lo hace sentirce bien por que  a podido darles un hogar acogedor a la  familia
texts.en:
Edgard Antonio lives in a neighborhood in the northern part of the city of Managua. He is known for being an honest person in both his work and his home. Currently he works as a cleaner in an institution.

Edgard is requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL to pay school fees for his school-age children and to buy them uniforms and any other equipment or supplies they need to attend school.

Edgard is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for previous loans with which he improved his home. These improvements make him feel good because he has been able to provide a cozy home for his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his school-age children and to buy them uniforms and any other equipment or supplies they need to attend school.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene un hijo y vive en el Municipio de Victoria, Yoro.
Doña María Elsa,  hace 11 años que estableció un negocio de pulpería. Ella ofrece productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, maíz, harina, manteca, lácteos, etc. Ella  es una señora muy reconocida en la zona cuenta con sus propios clientes. Inició este negocio con la visión de crecer y tener sus propios ingresos que le permitieran ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
