Ha decidido solicitar un segundo  préstamo a ODEF por 12,000 lempiras para compra más  productos alimenticios como   frijoles, maíz, churros, arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, lácteos etc. Con esto aumentar su inventario y sus ingresos.
Su meta es crecer económicamente y mejorar el local donde tiene ubicado el negocio.
texts.en:
María Elsa, 56, is married.  Her husband works in agriculture and she has a son and she lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  María Elsa opened a grocery store 11 years ago.  She sells basic staples like beans, rice, corn, flour, lard, dairy products, etc.  She’s a very well-known lady locally and she has regular customers.  She started the business with the intention of growing and earning her own income to help her husband with household expenses.

She’s decided to ask for her second ODEF loan.  It’s for 12,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more food items like beans, corn, snacks, rice, flour, sugar, lard, dairy products, etc. to increase her inventory and her income.  Her goal is to grow economically and to make improvements to the locale her business is located in.

loans.use: to buy food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Herliet

texts.en:
Herliet is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined woman. 

Herliet operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Herliet will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy meat to sell. 

Herliet’s business goal is to run two more butcher shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land with profits from the business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to previously pay a loan of KES 50,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ester has a native bag-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials to make native bags.

Ester has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to save up for the future and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make native bags.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Marciano es vendedor de productos  de primera necesidad al interior del departamento  se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 8 años, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela y es muy conocido por ellos.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buenas referencias en el barrio. Comenta que su meta es tener una gran despensa y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, harina, huevo, etc. Ya que son los productos que más salida tienen y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes y pedidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marciano sales food staples in the Paraguayan department of Ñeembucú, he has been dedicated to this activity for more than 8 years. This is why he already enjoys of a very good customer base that has gotten to know him very well.  
He is very hardworking and enterprising, with excellent referrals in his neighborhood. His goal is to grow his business into a mini-market and to keep working the same way as he has until now. 
He requests this credit to purchase staple merchandise for his business such as sugar, flour, eggs, etc. All of this due to the fact that these are the products that are sold the most, therefore he wants to be able to fulfill his clientele requests.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ann Ngirote

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined woman.

Ann operates a retail service business where she provides M-pesa service (mobile phone-based money-transfer service). She has been involved in this M-pesa business for two years, after engaging herself previously in a business of timber sales. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Ann will use the KES 30,000 loan to add M-pesa float (electronic credits). 

Ann’s business goal is to run another M-pesa retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from CPG, Bohol. Lolita has operated a welding shop together with her husband for several years now. 

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy equipment for their welding shop like a compressor, drill, and welding machine. With this, they will be able to improve and cater for more customers in their welding shop. Lolita has hopes of making their welding shop a success.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her welding shop like a compressor, drill, and welding machine

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en:
Kavata is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be intelligent and an honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. 

Kavata describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 49-year-old mother who sells tobacco and beetle nuts in the market to supplement her husband's income. She aims to make the business profitable in order to earn sufficient income for her family's necessities and to pay for the education of her youngest child. 

Due to inadequate capital, Esther is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy more tobacco and beetle nuts to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy tobacco and beetle nuts to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 61-year-old married woman from Alicia, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has been engaged in the farming business for 20 years now. She raises rice plants. Usually she earns 4000 PHP a month. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a driver.

Teofila is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, plant medicine,and seedlings. Fertilizer and plant medicine are used to make the crops grow faster and healthier.  Through this loan, she will be able to buy these to raise good and healthy crops. 

In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plant medicine, and seedlings

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 30-year-old, married man. He has two children, two and four years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

He operates a retail store where he provides secretarial services, such as typing and printing. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Patrick will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a photocopier. His business goal is to run a big company within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Patrick also works as a priest at his church.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Antony is married and has four children, ages 5 to 9 years. He describes himself to be an honest and warm man. He operates a rental housing business where he provides housing accommodations. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a busy market along a highway and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from customers. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. His business goal is to operate three more rental houses within five years. In addition, Antony runs a retail business where he sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of rental houses

loans.name: Dúo La Familia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Familia este grupo esta integrado por la señora Lesbia ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, esta contenta porque espera que por medio de ustedes ella pueda optar al credito,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo.
texts.en: Lesbia is a member of this group.  She has been a farmer for several years and is happy because thanks to you she will be able to get this loan.  She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires to sell in his business.

loans.name: Holger Anibal

texts.es:
Holger tiene 50 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Holger trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de maiz en terrenos cerca de la casa. El credito solicita para la comprar se semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesitades en los cultivos, los desafios que enfrenta son la variacion del clima, y las enfermedades de los cultivos.

El sueño es tener dinero para realizar un viaje en avion. En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo y recordar la infancia.
texts.en:
Holger is 50-years old, married and lives with his wife and their children in the city of Chimbo, Bolivar Province.

Holger works in agriculture.  He grows corn on land that is nearby his house.  He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer for his crops.  The loan will help him to get the things he needs for his crops.  The challenges he faces are variations in the weather and crop disease. 

Holger's dream is to have enough money to take a trip on a plane.  In his free time, he likes to walk through the country-side and reminisce about his childhood.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel (with his child) is a married man. He has one son who is five years old. He describes himself to be an understanding and honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as flour, cooking oil, soap, etc . He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy household items to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en:
Lynda is a 52-year-old  woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in making and selling handcrafted fashion accessories. This is the source of her income. Lynda is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for making fashion accessories: mahogany pods, coco beads and wooden beads, etc. With this, she will be able to make and sell more accessories thus allowing her to earn more.

In the future, Lynda has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making fashion accessories: mahogany pods, coco beads and wooden beads

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 41 years old and is married with five children. She has a sari-sari (convenience) store business where sells biscuits, soy sauce, breads and a variety of other items. She is requesting a loan 8,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar and spices. She hopes to earn more and be able to save and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his photography business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 66-year-old married woman with eight children, ages 15 to 35 years. She describes herself to be a humble and optimistic woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for over 20 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate vegetables to sell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to sell more produce within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 41 years old and married with seven children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a business making and selling native bags in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making her native bags.

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Alberto vive en la ciudad Managua, se desempeña como instructor de arte plástica con más de seis año, en el centro de capacitación profesional, donde él enseña su habilidad a persona con espíritu de superación, labora desde la ocho de mañana hasta la cinco de la tarde para llevar el sustento a su familia.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para gastos  escolares tales como uniforme, zapato, mochila, cuaderno  y el resto lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom, para poner piso ya que es de tierra su vivienda. 
 
Este financiamiento  le servirá  para darle a su hijo una mejor educación para el futuro, con esta oportunidad que  le ofrecerá  kiva y Ceprodel quedaría muy agradecido, ya que es el único sostén de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rafael Alberto lives in the city of Managua and has worked as an instructor of plastic arts in a professional training center for more than six years. He teaches his skills to people with a strong desire to better themselves. Rafael works from eight in the morning to five in the evening to provide for his family’s livelihood. 

Rafael is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL to pay for school expenses such as uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks. He will use the rest to buy construction materials such as tile to install a floor in his house, which is made of earth.

This loan will help Rafael give his son a better education and future. Rafael is very grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for this opportunity and their support.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses such as uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks and to buy construction materials such as tile to install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Don Jose, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Don Jose, tiene su propio taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, este lo tiene en su casa y brinda el servicio de pintura y reparación de golpes de todo tipo de vehículos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad. El ha decidido obtener este préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar unas láminas y reparar la galera donde tiene el taller y poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y brindar buen servicio. Ya que su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y lograr que su hijo estudie una carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

Don Jose has his own auto body and paint shop that is located at his house. There he provides paint and dent repair services for all types of vehicles. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. Jose decided to obtain a loan of 12,000 HNL in order to buy metal sheets so that he can repair the workspace of his shop. This will allow him to have better working conditions so that he can provide good service.

His goal is to grow his business so that he can help his son study for a technical degree.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets so that he can repair the roof of his workshop.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad hubicada al sur del país vive la señora Rosa, ella tiene la edad de 68 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se encuentra casada con el señor Marcos que se dedica a la albañileria, ellos tiene 1 hijo que se encuentra casado. Su poblacion se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera y alli se encuentra el Ingenio la Margarita uno de los principales productores de azucar y brinda fuentes de trabajos a la zona.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de Antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, gorditas, enchiladas, platanos) desde hace 10 años porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, ademas de que quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su esposo.

Ella realiza la venta de sus antojitos en Mexicanos desde la comodidad de su hogar, pone por las tardes pone sus negocio en marcha preparando sus alimentos para posteriormente esperar a sus clientes para realizar sus ventas.

Doña Rosa necesita esta inversion para la compra de tomate, chiles, cebolla, ajo, queso, crema, masa, carne, tortillas, col, frijol, platano, aceite, gas para posteriormente poner en marcha su negocio.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio mejore y pueda tener una vida prospera.

Doña Rosa es uno de los integrantes del Grpo Las Flores  el cual esta integrado por 10 mujeres, las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Claudia venta y elaboracion de tejidos
Irene venta de pollo 
Maria Isabel venta de abarrotes 
Epifania venta de cosmeticos 
Lucia venta de cosmeticos 
Adahi venta de cosmeticos 
Raquel venta de pan 
Ambrosia venta de antojitos 
Erika venta de tacos
texts.en:
Rosa lives in a community located in the south of the country. She is 68 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married to Marcos, who works in construction. They have one married son. Their town is in an area of sugarcane production. Ingenio la Margarita, one of the main sugar producers, is based there and offers a source of employment for the area.

Rosa has been selling Mexican antojitos (corn-based dishes such as empanadas, tostadas, gorditas, enchiladas, and plantains) for ten years, because she wants to support her husband with their expenses. She also wishes to have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

She sells her dishes from the comfort of her home. In the afternoon, she starts to open up her business by preparing the food. Later, she waits for her clients and makes sales.

Rosa needs this loan to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, garlic, cheese, cream, corn paste, meat, tortillas, cabbage, beans, plantains, oil, and gas in order to kick off her business.

She hopes that with this investment, her business will improve and she will be able to have a prosperous life.

Rosa is one of the members of the Las Flores Group, which is made up of ten women. The other members of the group are:

Claudia makes and sells fabric
Irene sells chicken
Maria Isabel sells snacks
Epifania sells cosmetics
Lucia sells cosmetics
Adahi sells cosmetics
Raquel sells bread
Ambrosia sells antojitos
Erika sells tacos.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, garlic, cheese, cream, corn paste, meat, tortillas, cabbage, beans, plantains, oil, and gas.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Alfa y omega es el nombre del grupo integrado por 7 personas alegres, trabajadoras y honestas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de tener una mejor calidad de vida: Santa Rosalia venta de cosméticos, Lucinda papelería, Monserrat venta de calzado, Esperanza venta de abarrotes, Cristina servicio de taxi, Gabina venta de calzado. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región cañera donde la principal fuente de trabajo es la siembra y recolección de caña de azúcar.
Doña Lucinda es   una de los integrantes de este grupo. Ella tiene la edad de 58 años, ella estudio la secundaria y este casada con don Juan. 
Ella platica que durante mucho tiempo ha sido comerciante pero hace poco tiempo logro establecerse, rento un local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vende papelería, regalos y juguetes.
Ella realiza esta actividad ya que desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y poner contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.
Ella dice que poco a poco a ganado clientes ya que tiene buenos precios y atiende su negocio de manera muy amable esto ayuda a ganarse a los clientes y que sus ventas aumenten.
Un prestamo de Vision Fund  le ayuda a comprar variedad de lapices, lapiceros, sacapuntas, hojas blancas, hojas de color, pegamento, papel bond, cartulinas, tijeras, colores, plumones para resurtir su papelería y algunos regalos como carteras, osos de peluches, chocolates y perfumes.
Doña Lucinda dijo "me gustaría ver en un futuro mi negocio mas grande con un mayor surtido, también con mucho clientes se venda la mercancía. Me gustaría darles las gracias ya que con su apoyo no podríamos ver crecer nuestro pequeños negocio".
Otros factores que le ayudan a tener Buena venta a que su negocio esta en una buena ubicación y vende productos que siempre están saliendo.
texts.en:
Alfa y Omega is the name of this group, which is made up of seven happy, hardworking, and honest people. Each of them has undertaken a business activity with the goal of having a better quality of life: Santa Rosalia sells cosmetics, Lucinda has a paper store, Monserrat sells footwear, Esperanza sells groceries, Cristina has a taxi service, and Gabina sells footwear. This group is located in a sugarcane region, where the main source of employment is planting and harvesting sugarcane. 

Lucinda, 58, is one of the members of this group. She is has a secondary school education and she is married to Juan. She says that she has been a businesswoman for a long time, but she only managed to establish herself a short time ago. She rented a space in the center of her community where she sells paper goods, gifts, and toys.

She has this business because she would like to have a better quality of life and to contribute to her home expenses.

She says that she has gained clients little by little, because she offers good prices and looks after her business with a very friendly manner. This helps her to gain clients and increase her sales.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy an assortment of pencils, mechanical pencils, sharpeners, white paper, colored paper, glue, bond paper, poster boards, scissors, colors, and felt-tip pens to re-stock her business, as well as some gifts such as wallets, teddy bears, chocolates, and perfume. 

Lucinda says, "In the future, I would like to my business to be larger and have a better inventory, and to sell merchandise to many clients. I would like to thank you because without your help, we could not grow our small businesses."

Other factors which allow her to have good sales are the good location of her business and the fact that she constantly sells new products.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of pencils, mechanical pencils, sharpeners, white paper, colored paper, glue, bond paper, poster boards, scissors, colors, and felt-tip pens.

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La Virgen de Guadalupe es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 personas cada una de ellas con una actividad económica: Laura brinda servicio de transporte, Eugenia venta de pollo, Maria Manuela venta de tacos, Eulalia venta de tortillas y Petra artículos par el hogar. Ellas decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que en la casa que se reunen hay una imagen muy bella de la virgen. Este grupo esta  ubicado en la comunidad de Vicente Camalote, en el cual la principal fuente de empleo la brinda un Ingenio productor de azúcar 
llamado "La Margarita".

Doña Eugenia tiene la edad de 35 años,solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Oscar con el cual tiene 4 hijos. Ella platica que desde hace 14 años, ella trabaja para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que cada dia la situcacion economica esta mas dificil y el dinero no rinde, doña Eugenia realiza venta de pollo destazado todos los dias por las mañanas.

Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que se siente un poco independiente ya que gana su propio dinero y ha hecho buenas clientas, amigos con el paso de estos años.

Ella dice que su trabajo inicio desde muy temprano ya que tiene que madrugar para matar los pollos y aliñarlos para posteriormente ponerlos a la venta, también nos dice que hay tiempos donde se vende bien que es ahorita esta zafra (cuando los ingenios trabajan en la producción de azúcar) ya que hay trabajo y la gente tiene un poco mas de dinero.
Un préstamo de Vision Fund le ayudara a comprar pollos para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella espera poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con sus ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio día a día. Ella dijo  
"Gracias por el apoyo que nos dan y a nosotras y tambien es una nueva oportunidad de salir adelante"
texts.en:
La Virgen de Guadalupe is the name of this group, which is made up of five members. Each of them has their own business: Laura has a transport service, Eugenia sells chickens, Maria Manuela sells tacos, Eulalia sells tortillas, and Petra sells home goods. They decided to give this name to their group because there is a beautiful image of the Virgin in the house where they meet. This group is located in the community of Vicente Camalote, where the main source of employment is a sugar production company called "La Margarita."

Eugenia is 35 years old. She only studied in primary school, and she is married to Oscar, with whom she has four children. She says that she has worked to help her husband with their home expenses since she was fourteen, because the financial situation is worse every day and there is not enough money. Eugenia sells sliced chicken every morning.

What she most likes about her business is that she feels a bit independent, because she earns her own money and she has made good clients and friends over these years.

She says that her work begins very early, because she has to wake up at dawn to kill the chickens and season them in order to sell them later on. She also tells us that there are certain times when sales are good. Now, for example, it is the sugarcane harvest season and the companies are working to produce sugar. Therefore, there is work and people have a bit more money.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy chickens to continue with her sales.

She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life with her income and to grow her business day by day. She says, "Thank you for the support that you give us. This is a new opportunity for success."

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Iris Marisela

texts.es: Iris, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 7 hijos, y reside en el municipio de Yoro. Ella tiene 15 años de tener su propio negocio  en su casa. Iris compra y vende carnes, ofrece carne de res, de cerdo, mondongo, chicharrones, chorizo etc. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 lempiras, siendo el sexto ciclo, con el cual va invertir en la compra de carnes para vender. Su plan es que su negocio vaya en crecimiento e ir  aumentando las ganancias. Su idea es darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y comenzar a implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Iris, age 40, is a common-law relationship with her partner. They have seven children and live in the town of Yoro.

For the past 15 years, Iris has managed her own business from her home. She buys and sells meat including beef, pork, tripe, pork rinds, chorizo sausage, and other products. Her business has remained stable as a result of investing several loans. She is requesting her current loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. This will be her sixth loan cycle and she will invest in the purchase of meat to sell.

Her plan is to grow her business and increase her earnings. Among her ideas are to provide a better life for her children and to start another business.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en: A 42-year-old married mother of seven  from Ubay, Bohol, Ma. Elisa has had a rice farm for several years now. She helps her husband in tilling it. Ma. Elisa is applying for a loan to buy additional fertilizer in order to improve the farm. In the future, she hopes to expand it and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a married woman. She has four children between the ages of 12 and 22. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides manicures, pedicures, and hair services such as blow drying, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are students and ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power outages. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan after successfully repaying a loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is in the business of selling vegetables and fish. Because it is her only source of income, she works really hard to make it as viable as possible. With the help of her husband, she is improving her business and thus their living standard.

In order to keep improving, Anacita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy cabbage, squash and fish to resell. She hopes for higher income to follow.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, squash and fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase water, bottles and stoppers for her business of purifying water under the Salvavidas label.

loans.name: Adina

texts.es: Adina, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Adina se dedica  a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y lleva 5 años de tenerlo. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 11,000 Lempiras para comprar harina de maíz que es el insumo principal para la elaboración de tortillas y con una parte va ampliar un apartamento de su casa construirá una pared y para eso va comprar unos bloques y cemento. Su plan es mantener bien el negocio ya que de allí cubre los gastos del hogar y de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adina is 31 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Adina has her business of making and selling corn tortillas. Her business is in her home and she has been in this line of work for five years. She has decided to request a loan of 11,000 HNL so that she can buy cornmeal, which is the main ingredient for making tortillas. A portion of the loan will be used to expand part of her house by building a wall. For this reason, she needs to buy some blocks and cement.

Her plan is to maintain a successful business so that she can cover her household expenses and pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal for making tortillas and to acquire blocks and cement for expanding her house.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, esta casada con Henry quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 4 hijos . Juntos habitan cómodamente su hogar construido a base de material noble .La actividad a la que se dedica Sofía es la venta de verduras frescas , Cuenta con una furgoneta para el transporte y realiza su venta de manera ambulatoria en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en algunos casos por zonas alejadas como asentamientos humanos o cacerios . Brinda una buena atención a los clientes lo que le ha ayudado a ganarse su confianza. Hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga de conducir la furgoneta mientras que ella atrae a los clientes con su potente voz. Lleva realizando esta actividad más de 1 año y le va muy bien. Le gusta este negocio pues genera el ingreso económico que necesita su familia y además porque se siente cómoda desarrollando una actividad laboral con la cual se siente una persona productiva . Considera éste negocio rentable por las ganancias que obtiene razón por la cual desea continuar en este camino. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento y asi pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará verduras frescas como lechugas, tomate, papá, cebollas y otros para continuar vendiendo por las calles de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sofía, age 31, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  She is married to Henry, who works in transportation and is the father of their four children.  They live together comfortably in their home, which is made from sturdy material.

Sofía sells fresh vegetables.  She has a truck for transportation, and she sells in an itinerant manner at the city’s main market.  Sometimes she sells in remote areas like settlements and hamlets.  She offers her customers good service, which has helped her to gain their trust.

She currently has the support of her husband who is in charge of driving the truck while she attracts customers with her strong voice. She has been doing this work for over one year, and it is going very well for her. 

She likes this business because it generates the income her family needs.  She also likes it because she feels comfortable developing a work activity that makes her feel like a productive person.  She feels that this business is profitable because of the income that she gets.  That is why she wants to continue on this road.

She will now request a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is thankful to all those who make her loan possible so that she is able to solidify her plans. She will use the loan to buy fresh vegetables like lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and more in order to continue selling on the streets of the city.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula. Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa nueva variada, vende camisetas, cortinas, ropa de cama y otras que le piden. La mercadería la vende en su casa. Su negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente esta solicitando un séptimo préstamo el cual es por 8,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir de más ropa nueva para obtener mayores ganancias. Su meta a corto plazo es utilizar las ganancias es arreglar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Dona María is 48 years old and a single mother with four children. She lives in a suburban section of San Pedro Sula.

For the past five years, María has been selling merchandise such as various types of new clothing, T-shirts, curtains, bedding, and other items that are requested. She sells the merchandise from her home. Her business has remained stable as a result of investing several loans. María is currently requesting her seventh loan, which is in the amount of 8,000 HNL. The money will be used to restock with more clothing so that she can generate more profits. Her short-term goal is to use her earnings to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday, a 33-year-old married father of four living in Kasese, Uganda, has been operating a retail shop for three years. He got his start-up capital from his previous employment as a shop attendant. Customers not paying on time are his main business challenge. His personal goal is building a permanent house, and his business goal is moving his business to a more permanent location.

Friday intends to use this loan to buy beans, sugar, maize flour and groundnuts. He used his previous one to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, maize flour and groundnuts.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Nancita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials needed to make native mats.  In the future, Nancita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make native mats.
